Job description responsible for supervising and checking every journal made by accounting staff based on invoices and working papers in finance in accordance with applicable accounting standards. Responsible for recording payment and receiving transactions. Responsible for preparing data needed for financial reports, managing fixed assets properly, asset book depreciation, reviewing and analyzing journal transactions and transaction data, supporting and ensuring financial transactions are based on data, preparing monthly financial statements.  

Job requirement: Bachelor degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field. Age maximum thirty-five years. Minimum five years of experience in manufacturing. English skill is a must, Mandarin skill preferable. Strong computer skills. Team size handled at least two resources. Sound knowledge of accounting principles and practices. Attention to detail and accuracy. Accounting certification is a plus. Willing to be placed in Bogor, West Java.

normalized_jd:
Accountant accounting tax finance expertise experience managing finance retail company proficient using Microsoft Excel accounting software willing to work in Semarang, Central Java. En Ko Rio, one of the leading jewelry companies in Semarang, CV Sentosa Dik, known as Kom Bunga Tanjung, is opening a limited opportunity for an outstanding accountant to join as Accounting Tax Supervisor placed in Semarang, Central Java. Toko Ma Bunga Tanjung believes the best service and client satisfaction are important and wants to provide world-class service, always working synergistically to achieve a common goal. We want to work and also learn together. School life waiting.  

CV requirement: General Accounting Tax Staff profession also intended for those looking for positions such as Accounting Tax Finance, Accounting Supervisor, Accounting Tax Supervisor, Finance Supervisor, Accounting Supervisor Tax Supervisor. Minimum education: Bachelor’s degree. Age: twenty-five to thirty-five years. At least three years of experience in accounting, tax, finance. Proficient in using Microsoft Office PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, especially Microsoft Excel. Proficient in using accounting system software. Experience working in accounting, tax, retail company. Pleasant personality, able to work quickly, pay attention to detail, responsibility. Responsible for bookkeeping of company financial transactions for offline store and online store. Accounting functions: invoice, receivables, payable, financial report, control function, budgeting, general ledger reconciliation, data quality connection, posting to accounting system, monitor bank account reconciliation. Treasurer functions: cashier, petty cash, bank receipt, payment, create financial report, manage appropriate tax transactions according to applicable provisions: Value Added Tax, Income Tax Article 21, Income Tax Article 25, Corporate Income Tax.  

Benefit: full job, permanent full-time employment status, fun family-like working atmosphere, holiday allowance. If you meet the criterion, take action and send CV, photo, last salary. February seventeen, 2022. All CVs handled strictly confidentially. Selected candidates will be contacted.

normalized_jd:
Hello great people, we are looking for accounting staff to join our team. Details follow: job description includes gathering and monitoring financial data, for example sales revenue and liabilities, preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual statements, balance sheets, income statements, and forecasts of costs and revenues, managing tax payments, organizing internal audits, preparing budgets for the entire company and departments, monitoring and reporting accounting discrepancies, conducting detailed risk analyses, assessing potential investments, analyzing financial trends, and performing month-end and year-end closing processes.  

Requirements: proven work experience as an accountant or in a similar role, preferably in the cosmetic manufacturing or retail industry; advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and accounting software; in-depth understanding of business bookkeeping procedures; solid knowledge of accounting regulations; excellent mathematics skills; attention to detail; time management ability; confidentiality; a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a relevant field; additional certification, for example Tax Brevet ABC.  

Full-time positions are available. Join us — we offer challenging career development, a good working environment, enhancement of professional growth, and support for expansion. We are currently looking for high-caliber candidates to join our team. See you soon.

normalized_jd:
Applicant position preferred experience in the finance and accounting field. Brief experience using Microsoft Dynamics NAV and SAP program. Self-motivated personnel management knowledge, fast learner, able to work independently.  

Following qualification job summary: Responsible for account transactions, ensuring business targets within the area are reached. Preparing documentation relating to accounts payable, accounts receivable, tax, and bank accounts payable. Handle daily bookkeeping, invoice payable, bank payment voucher, make sure accounts payable balance is correct, prepare payment schedule based on cash availability and due date of invoice, communicate with local vendors regarding balance payable and payment details.  

Accounts receivable: Prepare bank receipt for payment received.  

Fixed assets: Maintain fixed asset register, update data regularly in case of correction, disposal, or transfer of asset.  

Tax: Calculate and prepare tax payment for Tax Article Twenty-Three, Twenty-Six, Four, Two, and Twenty-Five. Liaise with tax officer, external auditor, and bank.  

Prepare monthly bank reconciliation.  

General accounting: Handle bookkeeping, posting accrual, depreciation entry, amortization expense on a monthly basis.  

Others: Checking employee monthly claims, handle petty cash transactions, monitor cash advances, ad hoc tasks.  

Finance and Accounting Manager requirement: University graduate with a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting major. Fresh graduates welcome. Two years of experience in the finance and accounting field preferred. Preferable experience using Microsoft Dynamics NAV and SAP program. Strong skills in Microsoft Office Excel (advanced), PowerPoint, and Word. Proficient in English language is important. Age maximum twenty-seven years old.

normalized_jd:
Junior Business Planning Analyst Gucci New York  

Role Mission  
Junior Business Planning Analyst primary responsibility: produce and distribute scheduled reporting daily, weekly, and monthly, ensuring information communicated is clear and accurate. Analyst also coordinates collection of information from internal and external sources, strategic presentation support, and Business Planning Department budgeting, forecasting, and planning activity for the company.  

Key Accountability  
Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly reports for business channels, dose commerce, outlet, and wholesale. Assist budgeting, planning, and merchandising activity including yearly budgeting process and merchandising plan. Additional project assignments as needed. Support preparation of business presentations.  

Key Requirement  
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or Business with strong quantitative focus. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required. Must be proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint. Flexibility to multitask and handle multiple requests with varying degrees of priority simultaneously. Proactive communication skills to collaborate with multiple team members. Supporting attention to detail, capacity to thrive under pressure, and ability to retain complex verbal instructions. Excellent organizational skills, time management skills, and work ethic. Experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Knowledge of retail merchandising metrics is a plus. Required: one year experience in a quantitative analytical role in a top-tier organization preferred.  

Equal Opportunity Employer  
DFV  

Primary Location: North America, United States, New York  
Location Detail: New York Corporate Office  
Start Date: As soon as possible  
Job Type: Permanent  
Schedule: Full-time  
Job: Business Development Strategy  
Organization: Gucci  
Job Number: 000JRX

normalized_jd:
Since one thousand eight hundred fifty-one, Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company commitment always help people protect family, support community, help one another, want inspire people live mutual. Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company values diversity, inclusion, people helping people. Career, you mean work alongside exceptional people empowered to reach professional and personal goals. Employee foundation makes Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company strong, stable, ethical business. Seek value in unique, varied perspectives and experiences. Believe stronger when voices are heard. Invite to bring bright, innovative ideas. Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company continues to help millions of Americans rely together stronger.  

Description:  
Responsibility: Planning work, marketing, cross-team stakeholder identification of business requirements, customer needs, as well as idea testing, new opportunity presentation, requirements, business value. Product Owner prioritization. Actively participate in roadmapping exercises, definition, write functional specifications, prioritized requirements based on thorough understanding of existing products, processes, context, including clear expectations for design, development, quality assurance.  

Design work: Design cross-team stakeholder engagement to ensure timely completion, strong user experience, user interface design, prioritized requirements. Work with design, customer insight, customer service to understand user behavior and preferences.  

Development work: Developers outline optimal technical approach to ensure timely completion of development work, prioritized requirements, monitor progress in sprints, remove hurdles.  

Testing work: Quality Assurance Engineers pitch as needed to ensure developed tickets are properly tested, iterated as needed, released. Coordinate developers, Quality Assurance Engineers, Release Manager, infrastructure team to ensure timely completion of user acceptance testing, production release.  

Work with Product Owner, stakeholders to remove hurdles post-production. Partner with customer service to analyze data metrics, monitor, improve customer experience, ensure production issues are promptly defined, prioritized, resolved as needed.  

Impact ideas to influence future direction of industry, combining understanding of evolving customer needs, evolving technical capabilities. Vocal advocate for customers, build simple, superior, meaningful experiences, future-proof products embedding quality, modularity, extensibility.  

Requirements: Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts, three to six years of experience as Business Analyst, Junior Product Owner, Manager role in software development team operating in Agile environment. Entrepreneurial-minded self-starter able to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Individual authorized to work in United States employer without requiring visa sponsorship.  

Preferred skills and experience: Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts in Information Technology, Computer Science, business-related field. Experience in startup company. Experience analyzing data, identifying options, presenting recommendations to business decision makers. Experience working within financial services, insurance context. Experience working on long-term cross-team projects delivered via Agile sprints.  

Competency: Strategic perspective, critical thinking, attention to detail, execution, accountability, teamwork, inspiration, collaboration within and across teams.  

Ranked seventy-seventh in annual Fortune five hundred ranking by Fortune magazine, June two thousand seventeen. Recognized as World’s Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere Institute. Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company guided by single purpose: help people secure future, protect ones they love. Company owned by policy owners, defined by mutuality vision, put customers first. Company structured to be way of life: people protecting people. Company exists for people willing to share risk, resources, rely, count on each other. Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company lives mutual.  

Core values: Focus on customers, understand customers well, look for every opportunity to deliver experiences clear, easy, personal, human, empowering, trustworthy. Act with integrity, deliver on promises, open, honest, humble, adhering to letter and spirit of applicable laws, rules, regulations, company policies. Value people, respect, learn from others’ diverse backgrounds, experiences, ideas. Engage, develop people to greatest potential. Work collaboratively, work together to achieve results, actively listening, seeking understanding, creating solutions as unified team, driving toward one company, one culture, one brand. Achieve results, focus on winning, exceeding expectations, getting better every day.  

Information: Visitors find us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Google, Instagram, Pinterest. Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company is an equal employment opportunity employer. Minority, female, sexual orientation, gender identity, individuals with disabilities, protected veterans welcome to apply.

normalized_jd:
Program description: Nonprofit launch career for military veteran and underserved young adult. Consultancy position with client company to place individual looking to launch career. Minimum nine-month engagement to learn and grow as client consultant, provided with mentor to ensure maturing and becoming a successful professional employee. Candidate applies with Workforce Opportunity Services to work and match candidate skill set to requirements of current and future positions. Workforce Opportunity Services works on candidate’s behalf to place them with one of our partners as a consultant for the consultancy period. Consultancy period varies; consultants average nine to twelve months with the intent that the consultant is hired away by the client company at that point. Tenure with Workforce Opportunity Services is complete when fully integrated as an employee.  

Position: Full-time entry-level opportunity. Individual will receive hourly wage in addition to benefits package. This is a “test drive” situation; throughout the consultancy period you make an hourly wage, work hard, and actively work toward bettering your transition to full-time employee with the client, with a much more competitive salary.  

Candidate profile: Military veteran honorably discharged or currently serving in the National Guard or Reserve. Experience or training in the following: Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science; Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration with concentration in Technology Management; military experience in technology or computer science. Availability to work full-time.  

Project Coordinator responsibilities:  
- Develop project plan including prioritizing tasks and activities contained in the plan.  
- Publicize project plan and activities to project team.  
- Track project activities against project plan.  
- Notify project team members using project agenda for upcoming meetings and subsequent minutes of meetings.  
- Provide day-to-day administrative and functional direction to team to ensure project milestones are achieved.  
- Monitor compliance with system development standards.  
- Ensure issues are captured, tracked, and resolved in a timely fashion.  
- Responsible for matters relating to coordination of project tasks in the project plan.  
- Support project team utilizing necessary project systems and tools.  
- Develop necessary project reports and communications.  
- Ensure quality using company-approved methodology.  
- Keep informed of technical and managerial advances, including leading introduction of best practices.  

Qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.  
- Experience with demonstrated leadership capability in project work planning.  
- Good, thorough understanding and experience with project management methodology, requirements management, and quality assurance processes.  
- Demonstrated experience working with outsourced vendors and offshore teams within the Information Technology field.  
- Ability to manage projects from inception to successful implementation.  
- Strong, excellent oral and written communication skills.  
- Strong facilitation skills.  
- Strong judgment and management skills.  
- Strong analytical ability.  
- Excellent leadership, technical, teamwork, and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to foster working relationships with team, management, client, and department.  
- Good understanding of technology platforms and ability to explain technical concepts to business users in the context of business requirements.  
- Ability to define performance, scalability attributes, constraints, and non-functional requirements.  
- Candidate must have a valid driver’s license and be willing to travel within the state.  

Business Analyst responsibilities:  
- Responsible for full data lifecycle, business requirements analysis, data feed definition, data mapping, testing, and monitoring project costs.  
- Research projects, prepare correcting entries as necessary, and prepare project cost accruals.  
- Work with finance users.  
- Organize, analyze, and document business requirements.  
- Responsible for gathering and documenting functional requirements and producing detailed functional specifications.  
- Leverage knowledge of functional requirements to assist in user interface design, wireframe documentation review, and development of use cases.  
- Execute test cases.  
- Work with build and component testing staff to ensure deliverables meet business requirements.  
- Contribute to development of best practices.  
- Identify, collect, consolidate, validate, track, and report data.  
- Oversee development of data definitions, help analyze data sets and data anomalies, and verify data quality and content.  
- Oversee integration, data transformation, and overall architecture.  
- Recommend and develop necessary new methodologies supporting information management, security, and compliance requirements related to data management.  
- Work with business partners to help identify, analyze, and resolve data errors and inconsistencies.  
- Understand high-level database architecture.  
- Work with data analysts and architects to ensure database design is consistent with information architecture and information management industry standards.  

Qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.  
- One to three years of experience in business or data analysis.  
- Experience with standard business modeling techniques, cross-functional process flows, use cases, wireframes, and Unified Modeling Language.  
- Functional understanding of data modeling and relational database design concepts.  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  
- Demonstrated ability to interact with technical and non-technical members of the organization, including senior management.  
- Able to multitask with ease, including demonstrated track record of delivering multiple concurrent complex technical projects on time.  
- Experience working within a database environment.  
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  
- Excellent documentation and presentation skills.  
- Strong, excellent oral and written communication skills.

normalized_jd:
Vacancy name Business Analyst New York  
Location city New York  
You started two thousand Efficio Specialist Management Consultancy focused on procurement supply chain improvement program.  
Currently Efficio has three hundred fifty employees globally with exciting plans to grow rapidly over the next eighteen months.  
A truly international organisation with thirty different languages spoken, the firm places high value on employees and offers great training and development opportunities to help career progression.  
Consultants return to the home office on Friday from client engagements to spend time with colleagues and attend training courses.  

Description:  
Given the growth, Efficio is going to be looking for Business Analysts to provide support to project teams working on consulting assignments.  
The Business Analyst role is targeted at graduate entry-level candidates as the first step into management consulting.  
Although based in the New York office, Business Analysts are at client sites four days a week and therefore need to be flexible with travel and working.  
Under the guidance of experienced consultants, a key role is to collect, analyse, and synthesise data from a variety of sources to gain insight and understanding.  
Analysis provides important input to the project team’s recommendations and solutions.  
Business Analysts also provide input to client presentations and work as team members in the day-to-day delivery of projects.  
For example, they may assist in developing and issuing Requests for Proposals, evaluating proposals from suppliers, and interacting with clients and suppliers as needed.  
Business Analysts are typically involved in client-facing projects from day one and need to be able to learn fast, get up to speed quickly, and work effectively under pressure.  
They must be able to work independently and also be team players willing to contribute wherever needed to ensure the success of projects.  
The ability to prioritise work effectively in the face of sometimes competing demands is also essential.  
Business Analysts are expected to challenge existing ways of doing things and suggest new ideas; however, they are also expected to be able to justify conclusions and recommendations with relevant experience and rigorous fact-based analysis.  

Efficio has a collaborative and supportive culture where performance is recognised and success celebrated.  
Business Analysts are supported to continually develop skills and expertise through a comprehensive training and development programme, including formal training at the Efficio Academy, on-the-job training, coaching, and mentoring from experienced consultants and Efficio executives.  
Opportunities for support come with the role, making Efficio an unmatched springboard to a top-tier consulting career.  

Essential requirement:  
Exemplary academic background, preferably with a top degree in Engineering, Science, Business, or Economics.  
Must have the right to work in the United States of America.  

Desirable requirement:  
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability.  
Ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions.  
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint.  
Proactive and inquiring approach.  
Strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders.

normalized_jd:
Layer Even Data Solution is a full lifecycle technology service company helping businesses resolve technical issues. Layer One Seven Layer Even Data Solution makes advanced technology simple and cost-effective for the small and medium-sized business and enterprise market. For over a decade, Layer Even Data Solution has provided great opportunities. One client in New York conducts clinical research on cancer as well as developing new drugs that provide advanced treatment forms for adult and pediatric cancer. The client is a Senior member of the National Comprehensive Cancer Network.  

Currently hiring a Business Analyst for the client.  

Job responsibilities:  
Create documentation to ensure compliance with Food and Drug Administration regulations, Title 21 Code of Federal Regulations Part 11. Elicit business system technical requirements, document business system technical requirements, create mapping documents, provide leadership, support, and guidance related to business analysis, testing, and overall quality to the project team. Provide training to the project team in Hewlett-Packard Application Lifecycle Management, handle multiple complex assignments concurrently, provide testing leadership for large project initiatives, create and present test plans, develop test strategies, test plans, manual and automated testing as well as multiple releases. Participate in requirement and design walkthroughs, analyze requirements aiding in the creation of test cases and test scripts, test systems, create test scripts based on documented requirements, execute test scripts documenting passed and failed tests, perform root cause analysis, defect management within Hewlett-Packard Application Lifecycle Management tool, create and maintain test data, conduct triage meetings, aid in investigation and resolution of defects, work with the development team to solve complex problems, identify gaps in requirements, and document.  

Required skills:  
Six years of experience eliciting and documenting business and technical requirements for multiple large system replacement projects. Six years of experience as a Project Lead. Six years of experience working as a business subject matter expert in hospital, research, and pharmaceutical systems. Six years of experience creating test plans, test scripts, and tracking defects. Two years of experience using Hewlett-Packard Application Lifecycle Management, Hewlett-Packard Quality Center, Mercury Quality Center, or similar products. Six years of experience working in hospital, research, and pharmaceutical companies in a software testing and Business System Analyst capacity. Three years of experience working in regulated environments requiring compliance with Food and Drug Administration Title 21 Code of Federal Regulations Part 11, State Department of Health, and Joint Commission regulations. Two years of experience working with Clinical Trial Management Systems and Clinical Trial Electronic Data Capture systems.  

Must be authorized to work in the United States. No sponsorship or third-party candidates. Must be a local candidate.

normalized_jd:
Business Analyst Financial System Job Description Work Financial Planning and Analysis team develop reporting actionable analysis drive decision making assist daily tasks associated with Essbase application including but not limited to executing data load, running business rules, Profit and Loss report, loading statistical data, planning, organizing Hyperion Essbase improvement efforts in conjunction with System Administrator and key business owners. Assist development and maintenance of SmartView reports, develop and document operational and technical processes, functions, and procedures involving Hyperion, act as liaison with Financial Planning and Analysis to translate business needs into technical specifications, assist rollout of new functionality, Quality Assurance testing, perform data validation to ensure consistency of Essbase application with various data sources, identify opportunities for improving business processes in partnership with process owners and management. Hyperion Essbase, SAP General Ledger, Financial Management and associated information systems. Analyzes feasibility, develops requirements for new systems, enhancement of existing systems, ensures system design fits needs of users, provides user support and training in usage of Hyperion Essbase, performs related duties as assigned. 

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field. Two to three years related experience in financial planning and analysis. Strong interest in financial systems, familiarity with Hyperion Essbase, Enterprise Performance Management Architect, SmartView preferred. Must be able to work independently and as part of a team with multiple competing priorities, history of meeting and exceeding deadlines and delivering high quality results, proven ability to identify and focus on high priority tasks, ability to manage time effectively according to priorities and timelines, must be self-motivated, apply good judgment and decision-making skills, excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills, strong Microsoft Office ability with heavy concentration in Microsoft Excel. J.Crew Group Inc. Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability, or any basis protected by applicable law.

normalized_jd:
Morgan Stanley, a leading global financial services firm, providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management, and wealth management services. The firm’s employees serve clients worldwide, including corporations, governments, and individuals, in one hundred and two offices across forty-three countries. A market leader, the talent and passion of our people are critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and a strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place where people can learn, achieve, and grow. Our philosophy balances personal lifestyles, perspectives, and needs, which are an important part of our culture.  

Department Profile:  
Office of Business Management (OBM), Morgan Stanley Wealth Management, focuses on strategy and day-to-day business management of the Wealth Management group. OBM works closely with Senior Management across firm functions to analyze information, develop recommendations, and communicate policy. OBM is also responsible for leading strategic workstreams, including the design and implementation of the Financial Advisor and Branch Manager compensation program, strategic cost management, client retention policy management, and Field Management Information Systems.  

Position Summary:  
Tracking and Coordination Analyst – provide data analytics and project partnership support to OBM Field Management and Senior Management. The analyst team is responsible for various ongoing projects and workstreams, including Branch Manager compensation, contributing to the creation and communication support for Branch Manager compensation policy, Regional Chief Operating Officer, and Assistant Complex Manager support. Work closely with management across the branch network to improve business reporting via phone calls, in-person meetings, and Field Management metrics. Prepare and investigate performance against Field Management goals, driving improvement in efficiency and business performance metrics. Assist in developing an analytical view of key performance indicators for the field.  

Private Banking Support:  
Coordinate as a member of OBM Private Banking group and Field Management Private Bank strategy initiatives to drive increased participation in services. Expense management seeks balanced expense control and strategic and tactical opportunities, including preparing and analyzing monthly reporting for Division Chief Operating Officer meetings. Total revenue premium support analytics to develop hypotheses around best practices and possible additional functions.  

Newly Created Metrics – Real Estate:  
Assist in strategy management of occupancy and equipment profit and loss lines, including project reviews, financial impact analysis, and business rationale, working closely with Field Management and Corporate Services.  

Requirements:  
Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree, strong academic record, strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills including presentation skills, advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Word, and Adobe Portable Document Format. Individual must be detail-oriented, possess strong organizational and multitasking skills, project management experience, strong analytical ability, problem-solving skills, willingness to learn, positive attitude, and be comfortable working to tight deadlines across a diverse range of functional groups.

normalized_jd: Card flight seeking Business Operation Analyst to join Finance Strategy team. Business Operation Analyst responsible for supporting Supply Chain monthly recurring process components, Sales Operation key metric tracking, Business Analytics, as well as working on ad hoc data analysis related to often cross-functional projects that arise. Great opportunity to be part of a fast-growing startup. Position reports to Senior Director, Finance Strategy, Sales Support Operation. Thirty-five support Sales Operation process, commission calculation, Sales budget versus actual calculation, assist customers as hardware purchase forecasting, assist using data analytics tools to report Key Performance Indicators to key stakeholders in Supply Chain Operation. Thirty-five manage order tracking, fulfillment process, manage customer and distributor correspondence related to hardware shipment, oversee inventory reconciliation efforts, data analysis. Twenty compile internal, often cross-functional, external data information requests, produce ad hoc analysis for Finance team and key stakeholder team engagement. Ten become immersed in payment industry, get involved in company-wide meetings and outings, obtain and maintain full understanding of client needs. Bring to the table one to two years of work experience in operations, project management, analytical roles. Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science degree. Ability to thrive in fast-paced environment, strong interpersonal communication skills, ability to juggle many tasks in environments with competing demands, ability to work independently as well as in team settings. Experience and knowledge of Microsoft Office, Google Suite. We would love experience in startup environment, proven ability to improve upon existing processes, experience working in Sales, Sales Operation, experience and knowledge of Slack, Trello, QuickBooks, Salesforce, Chart.io.

normalized_jd:
Overview Guidepoint Engineering Team thrives on problem solving, creating happier users. Guidepoint works to achieve its mission of making individuals and the business world smarter through personalized knowledge sharing solutions. The Engineering Team is taking on the challenge to improve the internal Customer Relationship Management system, create new products, and optimize seamless delivery of services. Business Analysts support Guidepoint’s growth by gathering business product requirements from internal stakeholders, analyzing data to validate business opportunities, and delivering software requirements. Quality Assurance Engineering Team implementation is essential.  

The ideal candidate is highly analytical with proven experience delivering results, analyzing and solving business problems at the root, stepping back to understand the broader context, and using data mining and analytical techniques to validate and measure business opportunities. Manage and execute entire projects from start to finish, including project management, requirements gathering, systems analysis, problem solving, communication, insight, and recommendations. Define workflows, use cases, and detailed business logic. Identify, vet, and manage third-party software providers, including Application Programming Interface integration. Work daily with Quality Assurance Engineering to guide product feature development and launch. Assist Product Managers with rollout planning and launch of new solutions to market, including user-facing documentation.  

Three years of experience in business systems analysis or equivalent experience in consulting, finance, or operations. Detailed understanding of the software development process, including the ability to assess feasibility without consulting an engineer. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required for using large-scale complex data sets. Basic Structured Query Language programming knowledge is a plus. Proven ability to solve complex business challenges and demonstrated ability to operate strategically and tactically in a high-energy, fast-paced environment. Knowledge of data visualization and exploration tools such as Looker and Tableau.  

Competitive compensation, free snacks and beverages, excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage for dependents, 401(k) match, life insurance, commuter benefits, corporate gym rates, paid time off, parental leave plan, Friday happy hours, summer Fridays, year-round corporate athletic league, and a casual work environment.  

Guidepoint is a leading expert network firm that connects clients with vetted subject matter expert advisors through a global professional network. Guidepoint clients leverage insights and perspectives shared by advisors to stay informed and make better business decisions. A slate of services including phone consultations, surveys, events, and proprietary data insight products help professionals gain a comprehensive understanding of topics and make strategic investment decisions. Guidepoint’s multinational client list includes nine of the top ten consulting firms, the largest hedge funds, private equity firms, and Fortune-ranked public companies. For more information, visit.

normalized_jd:
Known great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax, and advisory services. The organization today is important to industry growth, driven by delivering real results to clients, and also enabled by a culture that encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence, and supports community quality. Like Wonder, consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, DiversityInc, and others. If you are passionate about the future, join the team at KPMG.  

Currently seeking a Business Analyst in the State and Local Management Consulting practice. Responsibilities include evaluating integrator client deliverables related to requirement specification, process analysis, system-based manual control, functional design, test plans, and government accounting systems; conducting ongoing review of integrator deliverables in the System Development Lifecycle (SDLC); evaluating risk related to requirement management, business process definition, testing process, internal control, project communication, training, and organizational change management; reviewing business process information security controls to help provide effective, efficient, and secure access to information within applications; clearly communicating business and functional issues to various levels of clients and internal staff; establishing standard deliverables and measurements; understanding processes used to create deliverables; reviewing deliverables against established standards; identifying gaps and root causes.  

Qualifications: Minimum of one year of experience as a Business Analyst, system user acceptance testing planning and execution, health and human service engagement, and team environment. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university, preferably in business, human service management, information systems, computer science, or public policy. Demonstrated experience in application development, system evaluation, and support for health and human services including unemployment, Temporary Assistance for Needy Families, Medicaid Management Information Systems, child services, and Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information Systems. Strong understanding of data models and typical SDLC phases. Demonstrated experience assisting organizations in reviewing and implementing Information Technology Infrastructure Library standards. Applied experience related to enterprise architecture and service-oriented architecture. Travel may be eighty to one hundred percent.  

Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship in the future. KPMG LLP, a member firm of KPMG International, offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, gender, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, pregnancy, veteran status, unfavorable discharge from military service, genetic information, personal appearance, family responsibility, matriculation, political affiliation, status with regard to public assistance, or any other legally protected status. KPMG maintains a drug-free workplace. KPMG considers employment for qualified applicants with criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state, and federal law, including San Francisco Ordinance Number 131192. No phone calls or agencies please.

normalized_jd:
Given growth, Efficio is going looking for a Business Analyst to provide support to the project team working on a consulting assignment. The Business Analyst role is targeted at graduate entry-level candidates as a first step into management consulting. Although based in the New York office, the Business Analyst will be at the client site four days a week and therefore needs to be flexible with travel. Working under the guidance of an experienced consultant, the key role is to collect, analyse, and synthesise data from a variety of sources to gain insight and understanding. Analysis will provide important input to the project team’s recommendations and solutions. The Business Analyst will also provide input to client presentations and work as a team member in the day-to-day delivery of the project. For example, they may assist in developing and issuing Requests for Proposals, evaluating supplier proposals, and interacting with clients and suppliers as needed. The Business Analyst is typically involved in client-facing projects from day one and needs to be able to learn fast, get up to speed quickly, and work effectively under pressure. They must be able to work independently, be a team player, and be willing to contribute wherever needed to ensure the success of the project. The ability to prioritise work effectively in the face of sometimes competing demands is also essential. The Business Analyst is expected to challenge existing ways of doing things and suggest new ideas; however, they are also expected to be able to justify conclusions and recommendations with relevant experience and rigorous fact-based analysis. Efficio has a collaborative and supportive culture where performance is recognised and success is celebrated. Business Analysts are supported to continually develop their skills and expertise through a comprehensive training and development programme, including formal training at the Efficio Academy, on-the-job training, and coaching and mentoring from experienced consultants and Efficio executives. The opportunity and support that come with the role make Efficio an unmatched springboard to a top-tier consulting career.  

Essential requirements: exemplary academic background, preferably with a top degree in engineering, science, business, or economics; must have the right to work in the USA.  

Desirable requirements: strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability; ability to isolate key issues and draw sound conclusions; proficiency in the use of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint; proactive and inquiring approach; strong communicator with the ability to influence stakeholders.

normalized_jd:
Lifetime Healthcare Company aims to attract the best talent from diverse socioeconomic, cultural, and experiential backgrounds to diversify the workforce and best reflect the community it serves. The mission is to foster an environment where diversity and inclusion are explicitly recognized as a fundamental part of organizational culture. The company believes diversity of thought and background drives innovation and enables it to provide leading-edge health care and insurance services. With this mission in mind, it recruits the best candidates from the community to diversify and strengthen the workforce and company culture. Employees are united by the Lifetime Way values and behaviors, which include compassion, pride, excellence, innovation, and fun. The aim is to be an employer of choice by valuing workforce diversity, innovative thinking, and employee development, and by offering competitive compensation and benefits.  

Summary:  
The position identifies and recommends operational improvements, reporting processes, and trend analyses, develops ad hoc reports and data analyses to support initiatives, and interacts with Senior Management to recommend next-level operational strategies. Duties also include understanding and planning building functions within systems, the ability to review and seek process improvement opportunities in operations, and essential responsibilities at the accountability level to act as Project Manager, leading and directing personnel in business areas. The role works closely with business units to define requirements for improving existing processes and developing new processes, manages data collection and analysis, develops and modifies business procedures, pulls claims and enrollment plans, builds data queries, and performs data analytics.  

The position maintains familiarity with the latest techniques in project management, analysis, testing, and implementation, manages evaluations of operational systems, recommends improvements, reviews project development documentation for completeness, quality, and adherence to project management methodology standards, prepares reports, and makes detailed presentations to project teams and management. The role consistently demonstrates a high standard of integrity, supporting the Lifetime Benefit Solutions mission and values, adhering to the corporate code of conduct, and leading with Lifetime Way values and beliefs. It maintains high regard for member privacy in accordance with corporate privacy policies and procedures. Regular, reliable attendance is expected and required.  

Functions assigned at Management Level II include additional responsibilities such as leading the creation and testing of suite plans, building and resolving claim configurations, auditing, and providing support to various operations departments, including limited plan building, configuration, and claim resolution. The role acts as a liaison for audits, plan building, and resolution, ensures accurate requirements are collected for projects related to the Javelina system (including claims, enrollment, stop-loss, and plan build procedures), works with stakeholders and business units on complex assignments, creates process improvements to ensure end-to-end continuity across single or multiple processes, performs periodic evaluations of end-to-end processes, understands and communicates strategic business objectives, applies process improvement concepts, coordinates evaluations of operational systems and processes, recommends improvements, coordinates data collection and analysis required for developing and modifying business procedures, conducts interviews and data-gathering activities, participates in departmental work groups, assists in facilitating team meetings, supports process improvements including interviews, knowledge transfers, and training, trains operations staff on new systems and processes, documents process improvements, identifies staff training needs, and ensures business practices comply with federal and state laws and corporate personnel policies.  

Minimum Qualifications:  
Level I: This classification includes multiple levels differentiated by demonstrated knowledge, skills, and abilities to manage increasingly independent and complex assignments, broader responsibilities, and additional decision-making cases, becoming a resource for others. In addition to using differentiated approaches, placement of new hires also provides guideposts for employee development and promotional opportunities. A Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and a minimum of four years of related experience, or a minimum of seven years of equivalent work experience (preferably in claim processing operations in a healthcare environment), is required. A clear understanding of aspects of claim processes and systems, and plan building functions, is essential. Solid oral and written communication skills, organizational and presentation skills, and analytical skills necessary to interpret operational data are required. Expertise in structured analysis, design, and data-gathering techniques, proficiency with personal computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, Project, Lotus Notes, and Access, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, project management skills, and experience with the ability to manage multiple dynamic priorities and think independently while working as part of a team are required.  

Level II: In addition to Level I qualifications, a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or a related field and a minimum of five years of user experience in process management and improvement, or in lieu of a degree, a minimum of eight years of relevant operations process management and improvement experience, is required. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to identify root causes of business workflow problems, determine innovative source solutions and opportunities, possess knowledge of process improvement methodologies and principles, have excellent written and oral communication skills, be proficient in process improvement design, gather information from stakeholders, and have the ability to analyze and provide solutions to process design issues presented internally and externally.

normalized_jd:
Marketing statement: MetroPlus Health Plan provides the highest quality health care service to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Staten Island. Comprehensive list of products includes, but is not limited to, New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange Partnership Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, and CASA. MetroPlus is a wholly owned subsidiary of New York City Health and Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States. The MetroPlus network includes twenty-seven hundred primary care providers, specialists, and participating clinics. For thirty years, MetroPlus has been committed to building strong relationships with members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest lives.

Position overview: Work with the business unit to collect user requirements by analyzing business needs, interviewing knowledgeable parties, documenting results, and assisting with end-user training needs for supported systems. Serve as a vital link between organizational information technology capabilities and business objectives. Skilled Business Analysts contribute to MetroPlus’ success and growth in many ways.

Job description: Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use case scenarios, business analysis tasks, and workflow analysis. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract low-level information into general understanding, and distinguish user requests from underlying true needs. Determine operational objectives by studying business functions, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats. Work with the development team to design new computer programs by analyzing requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications. Improve systems by studying current practices and designing modifications. Recommend controls by identifying problems and documenting procedures. Improve processes by monitoring project progress, tracking activities, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions. Maintain system protocols by writing and updating procedures. Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation, providing helpdesk support, and training users. Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential. Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends. Contribute to team efforts by accomplishing related results as needed. Establish and maintain relationships with third-party vendors and data partners. Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred. Background in Managed Care preferred. Experience in analysis and reporting development tools including Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Office, Cognos, Crystal Reports, and applicable data-driven analytical tools. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to analyze, evaluate, and construct accurate and efficient process solutions to business problems. Ability to work in a team. Ability to understand business needs. Ability to work independently with little supervision. Ability to understand and work within MetroPlus policies and procedures. Strong analytical product management skills required, including thorough understanding to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Familiarity with federally regulated reporting processes preferred.

Professional competencies: Integrity and trust, customer service focus, functional and technical skills necessary to perform at a high level, written and oral communication skills.

To apply: If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the apply button and forward your resume noting Job ID to MetroPlus Health Plan Human Resources Department, 160 Water Street, 8th Floor, New York, NY 10038, Attn: Recruitment Unit.

Unionized position: In addition to a variety of health benefit options, MetroPlus unionized employees are eligible for vision, dental, life insurance, and prescription drug coverage through the designated union.

normalized_jd:
Job description: Want to join the Forever Twenty One corporate team and showcase your skills working as an exceptional employee in the position of Business Analyst in the Department of Operations, reporting to the Manager of Business Analysis.  

Direct report: Fair Labor Standards Act status: Nonexempt.  
Location: 3880 North Mission, Los Angeles, California 90031.  

Job purpose: Under the direct guidance of the Analyst, responsible for generating and analyzing customized reports related to financial and operating data in the retail sector. The Analyst will provide analytical support for management decision-making and strategic retail planning deliverables. Maintain an active database via Structured Query Language and Microsoft Access of key company data in order to ensure the accuracy and relevance of information feeding analysis and reporting. Generate various established reports evaluating store and employee operating performance against established benchmark metrics. Perform competitor market analysis including geographic sales, market strategy, Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, and Threats analysis. Collaborate with the Business Analysis team to create and present analysis project findings to Senior Analysts and management. Research and review annual reports and business publications as sources to gather data on existing and potential competitors, market environment, and industry. Perform ad hoc reporting and analysis as requested by management.  

Knowledge, skills, and qualifications: Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar analytical discipline. Must have one to three years of experience in an Analyst-type role, including experience in sales forecasting, financial modeling, and Key Performance Indicator analysis. Experience in the retail apparel industry is a plus. Must have intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including cell formulas, PivotTables, basic macros, data manipulation, and formatting functions. Microsoft Access, Structured Query Language Server, and MicroStrategy knowledge strongly desired. Excellent critical thinking skills and the ability to research and analyze data retrieved from multiple sources. Demonstrated ability to work in a highly analytical environment and make decisions based on quantifiable data. Must have strong interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to establish, develop, and maintain key business relationships within the team and across the business. Ability to work independently. Must have the ability to devise solutions and deliver results rapidly in a dynamic environment. Strong organizational skills and successful management of multiple tasks simultaneously.  

Forever Twenty One’s style is not dictated but inspired. Forever Twenty One is a leading fashion retailer with the latest trends and the season’s hottest styles at irresistible prices. With international locations, we stay true to our fast fashion destination and iconic store aesthetic, giving fashion fans across the globe an unforgettable shopping experience. Joining Forever Twenty One means joining an incredible team of talented, passionate, and innovative people who work together to bring fashion to everyone, everywhere. We are always on the lookout for talented individuals eager to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment filled with vast opportunities for career growth and development—a place where ideas become actualized, creativity is encouraged, and possibilities are endless. Be part of something epic. Be part of Forever Twenty One. Apply today.  

Forever Twenty One will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  

184,652

normalized_jd: Los Angeles, California, Finance, Netflix, People Technology team manages and delivers applications, constantly evolving to meet Human Resources organization scale. Studio behind the world’s leading internet television network continues to look for the best and brightest talent to scale growth. Opportunity: team seeking outgoing, curious Business Analyst to work in rapid development environment with multiple internal customers throughout the business. Position resides in company’s Los Angeles-based office, reports to Manager, People Technology. Business Analyst role takes responsibility for many technical aspects of location accounting. Analyst expected to develop deep working knowledge of systems used in location accounting office, internally developed applications, and vendor-hosted Software as a Service applications that fall under purview of Analyst. Software ambassador for People Technology team with broad responsibility for driving tool adoption and developing strong cross-functional relationships with business partners in Human Resources, Accounts Payable, Production Finance, Payroll, Legal, and Tax. Primary responsibility: Analyst expected to stay current with technology trends and new offerings in proprietary and industry applications. Research is a large part of position: visit culture, document long-term view, learn unique Netflix culture. Opportunity to be part of team. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: business process analysis, participation in system design to automate Human Resources processes, analysis and documentation of requirements for development team, conducting training sessions and application demonstrations for end users, project management, application configuration based on business requirements, quality assurance testing, hypercare, research and evaluation of various cloud-based Software as a Service applications. Experience and competency required: experience in business process analysis, system software experience, ability to quickly grasp new applications, strong analytical skills, familiarity with logical and physical database design models using various data modeling tools, experience working in studio production environment, in-depth understanding of Human Resources domain, familiarity with Human Resources tools.

normalized_jd: Founded in one thousand nine hundred fifty-seven, Premier America, one of the nation’s largest credit unions, with one hundred thousand members and two point four billion in assets, serves members committed to making it easier to meet today’s needs and reach tomorrow’s dreams. Provides a full range of financial services and excellent career opportunities throughout Los Angeles, Ventura County, and Houston, Texas. Innovative thinkers who enjoy giving back to the community will find opportunities waiting. Talented, friendly, service-oriented individuals can put their skills and abilities to work for a progressive leader in the credit union industry. Top Business Analyst demonstrates passion for member experience, establishing and retaining financial relationships. Agency helps meet goals. Top premium finance in an efficient, effective, professional manner. Essential duties include performing market competitive analysis, analyzing operational processes, developing recommendations to resolve issues, ensuring the credit union is licensed in fifty states, staying informed on current premium finance underwriting philosophy, standard operational processes, program delinquency charges, and contributing factors. Seeks and pursues new business with general agents and agents in the state.

normalized_jd:
Los Angeles, California Human Resources currently hunting stunning talent for Operations Business Analyst. You will be responsible for operationalizing recruiting tool integration, acting as a thought partner in talent acquisition, with a solution-oriented, out-of-the-box recruiting approach. Position based in Los Angeles headquarters, open to Los Gatos office. Exciting time to join Netflix Talent Acquisition, with a seat at the table to scale without sacrificing quality. We will give context and effective resources you will need to efficiently get your way, be creative and innovative, and elevate a high-performing organization. Problem solving is your specialty, questioning, curious, challenging the status quo. Expectation: identify gaps, be resourceful to fill each challenge, implement easily, see gaps, master the art of influencing change, and drive results.  

Role: operationalize technology needed by the recruiting team, identifying opportunities, determining solutions, tools, leading implementation, facilitating integration of various tools and systems. Develop strong partnerships with internal and external teams, provide deep analysis of trends and opportunities, streamline and automate workflows, build projects, and continuously improve the effectiveness of talent acquisition. Conduct training sessions and application demonstrations for end users. Ensure data integrity, understanding, and designing business workflows and backend data structures within systems. Provide system configuration based on business requirements. Approach people and processes, conduct ad hoc analysis, assist in problem solving, and help with storytelling.  

You have five to eight years of experience within talent acquisition and Human Resources operations. You have implemented various Human Resources Information Systems and recruiting tools from discovery to implementation and iteration. You are user-focused, see solutions where others see problems, always looking for ways to make improvements, and continuously simplify the recruiting experience. You are a thought partner with concise verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional team members effectively. From the end-user perspective, communication is your strong suit, able to distill and translate technical language into developer speak, and also translate back into business needs. You are an initiative taker, early adopter, and technology enthusiast.  

Join the Netflix team to make a huge impact in an established company. Your work will add value, your opinion will be sought, and you will be given the resources, freedom, and opportunity to take ownership of your work. Take a look at the culture memo to learn about our recruiting culture. Fearless leader Nellie Pe Hong Kong Ov.

normalized_jd:
Part of the team creating the next generation internal system for movie distribution. Comfortable being part of a cross-functional team working with a diverse group of business stakeholders and technologists. Expected to have a deep understanding of business analysis, be passionate about technology and business, keep up with the latest trends, and take ownership of project deliverables. Part of the studio technology team to conceive, deliver, enhance, and influence products across the entire distribution value chain including sales, marketing, planning, operations, and finance. Work to service overall company initiatives. Imagine studio business integrated, automated, efficient, effective, machine-scale, flexible, rapid, technology-driven business dynamics.

Key responsibilities: write user stories, conduct interviews, perform workflow analysis, process analysis, and observation sessions. Write concise and effective user stories, produce clear and concise workflow documentation, drive balanced solutions considering people, process, and technology components. Evaluate information from multiple sources to help distinguish user requests from user needs. Facilitate and clarify customer business needs, translate application and operational requirements, assist in business case development using modeling techniques and methods as needed. Define precise and accurate user story acceptance criteria to be used by developers in automation test frameworks. Act as a byproduct owner to ensure product owner intent is effectively captured. Arrange client reviews during software development to ensure client satisfaction. Collaborate to develop user acceptance testing specifications at the interface level for internal clients. Analyze current business software development processes, foster Agile principles and methods for requirement gathering, adhere to Agile development methodology best practices, facilitate Agile rapid meaningful releases. Assist in the creation of project approval request documentation. Work with the project manager to help facilitate and ensure successful user acceptance testing. Work with the business to ensure business adoption and measure the impact of solutions on the business.

Passion for good software visible to team members and stakeholders in every product the team delivers. Take business automation seriously, help make decisions that drive value every day. Problem solver who takes deep pride in work, views new problems as opportunities for success, approaches challenges creatively and methodically, and is biased toward delivering requirements quickly within budget constraints. Inquisitive and curious, asks questions often, is eager to learn new things, understands complex problems, desires to learn how things are done, and looks for ways to improve and streamline existing processes. Comfortable with ambiguity, faces change with a cool head, perseveres even without all details, comfortable moving projects forward when facing uncertain risks, and is motivated by change to evolve and innovate. Technically astute, rapidly learns new skills, grasps complicated technical information often leaving others lost, whether product or industry hard knowledge is absorbed quickly. Ready, goal-oriented, focused on goals, driven to get desired outcomes, connects business, technology, strategy, and software delivery, easily articulates value created.

Business Analyst Level Three career practitioner including practical application of techniques outlined in Business Analysis Body of Knowledge Version 3. Three years of experience performing business analysis within a large enterprise covering business and information technology domains. Work experience in data analysis plus two years of experience using Agile Scrum methodology. Strong problem-solving skills, strong written and verbal skills, ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences, ability to communicate effectively with business stakeholders, translate business requirements to technical developers. Strong partnering skills, ability to work within a collaborative team environment. Proficient in the use of Unified Modeling Language including one modeling tool in the business and information technology domain, e.g., Sparx Enterprise Architect, Model IO, IBM Rational. Strong business process definition capability including the ability to capture process flows visually according to standard methodology. Responsive to business needs, highly motivated to improve skills and capabilities within the organization, sense of ownership and responsibility for delivery, ability to learn, understand, and apply new technology. Must be able to work independently, support several projects simultaneously, and prioritize effectively. Knowledge and experience in the entertainment distribution value chain including Electronic International Distribution Rights, rights availability, servicing, and financing preferred. Bachelor’s degree with technical emphasis in computer science.

Created one powerful brand bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. Foundation in creativity starting with Walt Disney Studios producing, acquiring, and distributing live-action and animated motion pictures, video experiences, music, and live performances. Brands include Marvel, Lucasfilm, Pixar, Disney Animation, Disney Nature, Hollywood Records. Medium entertainment company rival brands honored to bring to the world. Part of the studio technology team, you will be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting, dynamic industry. Looking for a self-starting software professional dedicated to shaping the future of movie distribution. Casual shop valuing passion, community involvement, and exceptional software. Want to join the team? 577,292.

normalized_jd:
Summary Lead Market Communications Technology Company operates a platform for buyers and sellers to buy and sell leads, calls, and clicks. Looking for a Data Analyst to join the Analytics Department. The Data Analyst will help identify opportunities for improving the company’s marketing strategy and processes. Responsible for performing data analysis, reporting, and visualization. The Data Analyst will report directly to the Director of Marketing Analytics and work closely with the Marketing and Sales Department. Responsibilities include applying Machine Learning methods and Predictive Analytics, creating advanced Structured Query Language queries, performing ad hoc exploratory data analysis, translating analytical insights into reports, creating data visualizations using various Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft Excel, developing and updating dashboards, and providing actionable insights. Define datasets needed for specific use cases, identifying data gaps. Specific tasks may change as business needs progress.  

Requirements: Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science in Statistics, Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a quantitative discipline. Three years of work experience as a Data Analyst. Advanced Structured Query Language skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI and data visualization tools. Proficiency in Python. Working knowledge of Machine Learning methods including Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machine, Decision Tree, K-Means, K-Nearest Neighbors, and Random Forest. Flexibility to handle directional changes and shifting priorities to ensure project success. Excellent written, verbal communication, and presentation skills. Ability to communicate at all levels of the company. Great attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure.  

Benefits: Group health insurance including dental, vision, and life insurance. Paid sick leave and vacation. Corporate discount for Equinox membership. Lunch provided. Great office with panoramic view.

normalized_jd:
Overview position responsible for collection, analysis, and maintenance of data focused on department goals. Responsibilities may include creation and administration of databases, support of computer programs and applications needed to achieve department goals. Essential functions consistently exhibit behavior and communication skills demonstrating DaVita Medical Group’s commitment to superior customer service, including quality care and concern for every internal and external customer. Protects and discloses DaVita Medical Group patient Protected Health Information in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act standards. Researches, collects, and analyzes primary and secondary data sources, reports trends to support department goals, designs and evaluates database systems to support department needs, develops and maintains organized documentation for efficient department operations, supports performance improvement duties in the department, and recommends strategies in relation to report building and data capture for internal customers. Performs additional duties as assigned.  

Education: Minimum Bachelor’s degree in related area. Minimum progressively responsible work experience in related area may be substituted in lieu of degree. Preferred Master’s degree in related area or equivalent work experience.  

Experience: Minimum five years of specific experience within the healthcare industry.  

Knowledge, skills, and abilities: Computer literate, proficient in Microsoft Office Excel, Access, Word, and Outlook. Able to type 25 words per minute. Strong leadership skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, excellent organizational skills, customer service oriented, ability to interact at all levels of the organization including management, excellent presentation skills, and ability to function with minimal supervision.

normalized_jd: Overview responsible for business analysis, quality analysis, and support. Person embedded in investment management, rapid solution, agile team. Work directly with front office trader, portfolio manager, analyst, and management to design, develop, and deliver creative, robust, value-added reporting and interactive tool solutions. Investment management team is part of agile team. Business analyst primarily responsible for analysis and quality assurance of many deliverables in sprint. Expected to analyze and understand business requirements and relevant data and database systems in order to design and implement optimal quality assurance to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality products to users. Responsibility to quickly analyze and understand business systems, databases, and data related to front office deliverables, understand new requirements, and produce and execute effective test strategies and test cases for sprint deliverables. Two years of work experience in fixed income portfolio management domain including derivatives and credit. Two years of work experience in quality assurance including understanding different testing types, approaches, and best practices. Strong Structured Query Language skills, ability and motivation to self-learn database, data, and business meaning relationships to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products. Team spirit, collaborate effectively with team and users to ensure rapid delivery of high-quality solutions. Conduct effective business analysis for assigned sprints, efficiently manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, accurately track and escalate issues to supervisor, provide effective documentation of requirements analysis as appropriate and effective, provide production support for released solutions, communicate effectively on matters related to responsibilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong ability to understand requirements in agile process, produce effective test strategies, test cases, and results. Ability to work in highly demanding, fast-paced environment managing multiple projects simultaneously. Work experience and knowledge of test automation scripting is a plus. Highly self-motivated, creative, result-oriented team player capable of independent, creative, and critical problem solving. Qualification: academic qualification minimum requirement is a bachelor’s degree in relevant field.

normalized_jd:
Job summary: Business Analyst responsible for reporting and analytics framework at Yami Buy. Critical role to interact with different business units directly to understand reporting needs, work to deliver reporting dashboards and analysis.  

Job requirements: Understand high-level business goals and use goals to guide work. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to obtain information for ad hoc and routine reporting and analysis needs. Perform qualitative and quantitative analysis to provide meaningful insights and synthesized recommendations to support informed decision-making. Cooperate with Data Engineers to build the Yami Buy data platform. Understand business requirements and data user needs, develop dashboards to provide a clear view of the business visually, translating complex data into actionable insights. Present data-related information succinctly and effectively to stakeholders and leadership. Monitor published information regularly and follow up with timely corrections as necessary to ensure reporting accuracy and integrity. Understand basic finance and accounting.  

Qualification requirements: Minimum two years of Business Analyst or Data Analyst related experience. Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field preferred, or a combination of education and equivalent work experience. Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel. Ability to extract, cleanse, and validate data using MySQL. Experience developing reports and dashboards utilizing visualization tools. Ability to perform analysis with data-supported conclusions. Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Problem-solving and critical thinking skills. Ability to organize and prioritize work to meet tight deadlines. Proponent of developing a data-driven culture and supporting team members. Understanding of data architecture within a relational database environment is a plus. Proficient in writing time-efficient MySQL scripts is a plus. Knowledge of using Extract, Transform, Load tools such as SQL Server Integration Services and Alteryx is a plus. Experience developing dashboards and reports in Tableau is a plus.
