normalized_jd:
Experienced sales and marketing professional with big dreams and ambition, who likes working for big commissions. Candidate for full-time work in the Prudential Venture Program. Organized part-time Prudential Life Assurance Prudential Venture Entrepreneur Leadership Program trains candidates to become entrepreneurs and agency leaders. Candidates are trained and equipped by professional trainers in a fun and conducive environment. Candidate will be able to make sales and recruit professional financial planners. Benefits include allowance of Rp 600,000 to Rp 1,000,000 depending on last income, twenty-four times repetitive commission transactions, annual bonus, three-month bonus based on self-performance, incentive trips to Asia and Europe, fun and supportive working environment, significant career path, flexible working time, training, mentoring, and proven success.  

Requirements: Maximum forty years old, candidate with at least a diploma or bachelor’s degree in any field, who has not held an AAJI license. Sales and marketing background preferred. Available to work in Jakarta, preferably domiciled in Jabodetabek. At least three years of working experience. Must have a minimum last income of IDR 5,000,000 gross per month.  

Job description: Make appointments with prospective customers online and onsite, educate prospective customers on financial planning, sell insurance policies, help customers regarding policy services. Willing to work and also wanting to grow and develop as a leader and entrepreneur.  

If you meet the criteria, please send your resume. Resumes will be handled in strict confidentiality. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Develop new business to increase turnover.

Job summary: Role responsible for attracting candidates, matching positions available in client companies, and building positive relationships in order to gain a better understanding of client recruitment needs and requirements. The role calls for a passionate, talented individual with a growth mindset who loves connecting the right people to suitable opportunities and is keen to convert leads into achievements using business development, marketing techniques, and networking to attract business for client companies.  

Job description: Client acquisition, fostering long-term relationships with clients, understanding client requirements, utilizing recruiting techniques to acquire candidates, sourcing, shortlisting, conducting pre-interview screening, matching suitable candidates to different positions, nurturing good relationships with candidates, providing advice as needed, and facilitating the finalization of agreements between candidates and employers.  

Job requirements: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, advanced proficiency in speaking and writing English, excellent sales and customer service skills, at least two years of working experience in a related field, a goal-oriented approach to work, the ability to handle multiple priorities, and problem-solving ability.

normalized_jd:
Overall summary: Data Scientist, Data Science Solution Team. Individual responsible for building advanced Data Science analytical solutions to help HBO better understand and grow a best-in-class television and film library data products. Individual develops wide impact across business, helping HBO audience discover new content and find new hit television shows. Data Scientist works closely with the Engineering Team to ensure product insights are properly moved to the production environment and used by the wider Analytics Team to drive business strategy. Primary responsibility is to lead development of Data Science solutions to help HBO make smarter content decisions across development, scheduling, marketing, and digital platforms including HBO, HBO Go, HBO.com, and mine HBO third-party data to better understand consumers and make entertainment choices. Work with the Engineering Team to transfer knowledge and processes to the production environment.  

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field of study such as Statistics or Operations Research from an accredited institution. Extensive work experience applying Machine Learning in a professional environment. Experience with Neural Networks, Computer Vision, and Deep Learning is a plus. Strong background in analytic programming in R and Python. Strong desire to continue learning and developing as a Data Scientist. Proven technical ability, excellent written, verbal, communication, and presentation skills. Proven success partnering with Engineering and Business Teams. Logical thinking ability and capability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with limited supervision. Four years of relevant experience.

normalized_jd:
team data science team newly formed applied research team within Standard & Poor's Global Rating responsible for building and executing bold vision around using machine learning, natural language processing, data science, knowledge engineering, human-computer interface augmenting various business processes. Impact role significant impact success data science project ranging from choosing projects undertaken to delivering highest quality solutions, ultimately enabling business process product artificial intelligence data science solutions. This is a high visibility team opportunity to make meaningful impact on future direction of company. Work with senior leaders in organization to help define, build, and transform business. Work closely with senior scientists to create state-of-the-art augmented intelligence, data science, and machine learning solutions. 

Responsibility: Junior Data Scientist responsible for building artificial intelligence data science models. Need to rapidly prototype various algorithmic implementations, test efficacy using appropriate experimental design and hypothesis validation. 

Basic qualification: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computational linguistics, artificial intelligence, statistics, or related field. 

Preferred qualification: Experience with financial data sets, Standard & Poor's credit rating process highly preferred. Knowledge and working experience in one of the following areas: natural language processing, machine learning, question answering, text mining, information retrieval, distributional semantics, data science, knowledge engineering. 

Recruitment agency: Standard & Poor's Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please forward resumes to Standard & Poor's Global employee office location or website. Standard & Poor's Global is not responsible for fees related to resumes. 

Standard & Poor's Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making employment decisions without regard to race, ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status including domestic partnership or civil union, sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Electronic job submission is considered employment application. If you need accommodation in application process due to disability, please send email to eeo compliance at Standard & Poor's Global dot com. Request will be forwarded to appropriate person. Equal Employment Opportunity law poster outlines discrimination protection under federal law.

normalized_jd: Need Junior Data Scientist New York area remote. Successful candidate will join team responsible for maintaining competitiveness of client predictive model as well as contributing to Research and Development agenda. Role will involve working closely with a variety of internal stakeholders ensuring alignment of priorities and maximising usage of insights. Skills and experience required: exceptional numerical ability, creative thinker, problem solver, experience using major data science tools, for example Python preferable, organized, autonomous, drive, commitment, excellent interpersonal skills. Candidate would be expected to work across existing team, strong communication and presentation skills including ability to translate analysis for non-technical audience. Desirable skills: proficiency in statistical modelling, machine learning techniques, for example K-means, decision tree, neural network, ensemble learning, good working knowledge of PostgreSQL, understanding of data modelling and relational databases, experience with machine learning libraries, for example Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, experience in feature engineering, designing robust model tuning approaches.

normalized_jd:
Want help guide core business Spotify using insight analysis data mission Premium Analytics team bring Spotify Premium user across globe constantly evolve improve offering role essential partner Consumer Subscription team discovering new way leverage content marketing offering guide growth direction Spotify Premium. At your fingertips you will have access to petabyte data and get opportunity to be creative, drive insight, and work on impactful projects that change the way the world experiences music. Work with a global team of world-class analysts, data scientists, marketers, business managers, and engineers passionate about moving forward high-impact projects at a high pace where learning and improving are part of the daily routine. You will be free to develop skills and ways of working that drive business decisions and help tailor offerings by synthesizing insights and recommendations from a trove of data. Work with business stakeholders to understand changes driving the business and help discover new opportunities to grow. Design and automate pipelines, experiments, dashboards, and models to ensure quick delivery of key insights. Be an expert sounding board for business managers and partners. Be intellectually curious, creative, diligent, and enjoy thinking about the business impact of your work as much as the data.  

Professional experience in data science techniques, experimentation, content valuation, user segmentation, churn analysis, and optimization. Three to five years of hands-on experience synthesizing insights from data using tools such as Python, SQL, and R. Experience with distributed systems, Redshift, object-oriented programming, and BigQuery is a plus. Studied Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a relevant field. Proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination and strongly believe diversity in experience, perspective, and background leads to a better environment for employees and a better product for users and creators. This is something we value deeply and encourage everyone to be part of changing the way the world listens to music.

normalized_jd:
Mayor Office of Data Analytics, MODA, New York City Side Incubator, Operational Analytics. MODA collaborates with city agencies to deliver measurable improvements to city services, working to touch virtually every urban issue including safety, physical infrastructure, economic development, social services, and quality of life. Depending on the needs of the city in different situations, MODA plays a role as strategic advisor, analyst, technical resource, and data advocate, hosting internal and external clients and partners.  

The successful candidate will serve as Data Scientist reporting to the Mayor Office of Data Analytics. MODA’s mission is to deliver actionable insight and quantitative support for New York City data analytics. Responsibilities typically include producing quantitative analysis to support ongoing projects, agency-specific pilot programs, and requests from Senior City Officials. Duties assigned by the Chief Analytics Officer include manipulating and analyzing technical data from city agencies in order to predict outcomes, prioritize inspections and audit resources, apply statistical and data mining techniques, conduct fraud detection, trend analysis, and predictive analytics using acquired data.  

Collaborate with team members to develop novel strategies for technical analysis. Develop detailed methodologies in order to allow successful projects to be transferred and automated for client agencies. Create and present compelling reports to stakeholders based upon project findings and methods. Perform special projects and initiatives as assigned.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
One, a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of experience in community work or community-centered activities in an area related to the duties described.  
Two, a high school graduation equivalent and six years of experience in community work or community-centered activities in an area related to the duties described.  
Three, education and experience equivalent to one and two; however, candidates must have at least one year of experience as described in one.  

Preferred skills:  
The successful candidate will possess the following: strong quantitative problem-solving skills; experience with empirical methods in data analytics including working with large, complex micro datasets; building applied statistical and econometric models; conducting research; ability to problem-solve while balancing competing priorities in complex situations under tight deadlines; ability to think creatively to develop novel strategies for analysis; ability to distill complex material into actionable recommendations; excellent written and oral communication skills; energetic, resourceful, organized, results-oriented, self-starter, team player; comfortable interfacing with Senior Management and stakeholders; proficiency in Statistical Analysis System, Stata, Structured Query Language, R Statistical Programming System, and statistical software; ArcGIS Geographic Information Program; Python programming language; interest in New York City policy and operations.  

To apply:  
City employees, please go to Employee Self Service, click Recruiting Activity, Career Search, and search Job ID 340645.  
Applicants, please go to search Job ID 340645.  

If you do not have access to a computer, please mail your resume indicating Job ID to:  
Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications  
Recruitment Office  
Two MetroTech Center, 4th Floor, Brooklyn, NY 11201  

Submission of a resume does not guarantee receipt of an interview appointment. Appointment is subject to oversight approval. Participates in E-Verify.  

Hours/Shift: Day  
Work Location: New York, NY  

Residency requirement: New York City residency is generally required within ninety days of appointment; however, city employees in certain titles who have worked for the city for two continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

normalized_jd:
Smartly.io is a fast-growing company aiming to be the best and nicest place for talented people to work and learn, building automation and optimization tools for the largest advertisers globally, including eBay, Skyscanner, Zalora, Nelly, Boozt, and Foodpanda, based in Helsinki, Berlin, San Francisco, New York, Singapore, and Buenos Aires. We are looking for individuals with a hunger for learning and life to join our world-class team.  

We are looking for a customer-facing Data Scientist who enjoys analyzing complex systems and communicating findings to customers and partners clearly and concisely. This role is essential in making sure we systematically improve optimization across customers.  

At Smartly.io, you would work with a global team of customer Data Scientists based in major offices in Helsinki, New York, San Francisco, and Singapore. You will analyze, validate, and test digital marketing best practices to meet advanced technical marketers in the industry and help take marketing and the whole industry to the next level. In addition, you will teach everyone around you about online marketing and work to elevate the whole company as a thought leader within the market.  

You will work closely together with Software Developers, Sales, and customer Data Scientists to analyze data, figure out what works, and, most importantly, work to drive the best in the world in optimizing digital advertising, beginning with Facebook and across channels later. In close collaboration with Product Development, you will bring learnings directly into the product, helping to innovate, test, and prototype new optimization features.  

You will be part of making Smartly.io a thought leader within the market through blogging, analysis, creating benchmark reports, and speaking at events.  

We are looking for a mathematical and analytical mindset, the ability and willingness to become a digital marketing optimization expert, the ability to collect and join data from various APIs and databases, and scripting skills to create and share tools for data analysis. The ability and willingness to work in a client-facing role, and previous experience in account management, sales, project management, or technical copywriting, are a plus.  

Benefits include working with the nicest and brightest teammates, a flat organization, a competitive salary, an option plan, recharging with a full five-week paid annual leave, enjoying weekly breakfasts, Friday demo beers, and monthly sports teams.  

Smartly.io is a fast-growing team of two hundred humble, hungry hunters building a B2B SaaS tool to fully automate and optimize online marketing at scale for the largest advertisers across the globe. We are a global company with thirty-six nationalities, a foothold in seventeen cities, serving six hundred customers across the globe, including eBay, Uber, and TechStyle. Our mission is to make online advertising easy, efficient, and enjoyable across major platforms—easy, automated, efficient, constantly driving performance, and providing the best user experience and service in the market. We combine creative automation, ad operations, and outstanding customer service to help brands scale results.  

We have a great headcount of people who choose to stay with us because they like the company culture, tackling challenges of huge scale and speed, and learning to work the Smartly.io way. See our culture handbook.

normalized_jd:
Marketing statement: MetroPlus Health Plan provides the highest quality health care service to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Staten Island, with a comprehensive list of products including Limited New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange Partnership Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, and CASA. MetroPlus is a wholly owned subsidiary of NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States. The MetroPlus network includes twenty-seven thousand primary care providers, specialists, and participating clinics. For thirty years, MetroPlus has been committed to building strong relationships with members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest lives.  

Position overview: Data Scientist tasked with leading data science projects to discover information hidden in vast amounts of data to help us make smarter decisions and deliver even better care to members. Primary focus is applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building high-quality prediction systems integrated into products. Data Scientist responsibilities span three domains: skills in statistical and mathematical reasoning, business communication and leadership, and programming and teamwork. The role requires collaborating with various subject matter experts, management, and industry leaders. The position requires an analytically minded individual with experience in healthcare who enjoys working in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.  

Job description: Solve business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data, implement new statistical and mathematical methodologies needed for specific models and analyses, use algorithms and programming to efficiently process large data sets, apply treatments and filters to condition data, create meaningful data visualizations, communicate findings and relate them back to create business impact, collaborate with departments to understand company needs and devise possible solutions, optimize joint development efforts, use appropriate databases, design projects, communicate results and ideas to key decision makers, communicate as needed with the New York City Department of Health regarding relevant analyses, use programming expertise in SAS, SQL, and Crystal Reports, develop and maintain reports, keep up to date with the latest technology trends, and perform duties as required.  

Minimum qualifications: Five years of practical experience in SAS, SQL, data processing, database programming, and data analytics. Extensive background in data mining and statistical analysis, skills in distribution, statistical testing, and regression, ability to understand various data structures and common methods of data transformation, excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills, experience with data visualization tools, good scripting and programming skills, great communication skills, Bachelor’s degree preferred, strong understanding of quality care, utilization management, measurement, and reporting, experience with Discharge Abstract Database and Medicare STAR preferred, knowledge of medical coding, professional competency, integrity, trust, customer focus, functional and technical skills, and written and oral communication.  

To apply: If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the apply button and forward your resume noting Job ID to MetroPlus Health Plan Human Resources Department, 160 Water Street, 8th Floor, New York, NY 10038, Attn: Recruitment Unit. Position classified as managerial title. In addition to a variety of health benefit options, MetroPlus managerial employees receive vision, dental, gym reimbursement, and life insurance benefits through the Management Benefit Fund of the City of New York. Please view the benefits page for detailed information.

normalized_jd:
Job description Junior Data Scientist Membership Analytics  

Job description: Looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join The Wall Street Journal Membership Analytics team. The Wall Street Journal mission is to present factual, fair information and offer nuance and balance to readers who believe market economics and business forces animate the world.  

The Membership Analytics team is committed to supporting great business journalism, improving product growth, and subscription business by building best-in-class data products and bringing applied research methods to all stages of the customer lifecycle. This includes developing innovative modeling approaches to inform product decisions and member engagement strategies.  

The role requires exceptional data visualization and data wrangling skills, as well as an obsession with great news products. A background in Machine Learning applications, Big Data architecture, and e-commerce analytics is a plus.  

Assist in the management and execution of large-scale data projects. Support daily reporting for business journalism sources. Query data as required for ongoing Business Intelligence efforts and larger-scale Data Science projects. Draw meaningful insights from large datasets and find creative ways for insights to be used to sell subscriptions and make the experience of reading The Wall Street Journal better.  

Assist in the management of long-term data projects. Effectively communicate with business, product, and newsroom stakeholders, identifying requirements and developing success metrics. Develop and deploy Machine Learning applications. Use visualization tools to present complex data in a simple, engaging manner. Identify opportunities for new data projects, ask smart questions, diagnose real problems, and develop long-term solutions.  

Requirements:  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related quantitative discipline. Applicants with data-related expertise and professional backgrounds in media are also encouraged to apply. One to two years of professional experience in a media company preferred. Enthusiasm for The Wall Street Journal and understanding of its products is a must. Entrepreneurial attitude toward work and attention to detail required.  

Experience using analytics tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Excel. Interest in advanced topics in analytics, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Coding skills in Python. Experience building web applications is a plus.  

Dow Jones is making a career in newsworthy work. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action, Disabled Veteran.  

Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application and interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation completing the application due to a disability, please reach out to the Talent Resource team at dowjones.com. Please put “Reasonable Accommodation” in the subject line.  

Business Area: The Wall Street Journal Customer Group.  

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats including print, digital, mobile, and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for one hundred twenty-five years. Today, it is one of the world’s largest newsgathering operations, producing leading publications and products including the flagship The Wall Street Journal, America’s largest newspaper by paid circulation, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).  

If you require assistance completing the online application, please contact the Talent Management team at applicationhelp@dowjones.com or the Talent Resource team at dowjones.com.  

Job requisition: 12873

normalized_jd:
Narrativ is a New York City based New Enterprise Associates backed technology startup building a better internet shopper machine learning technology to wire link at massive scale, enabling advertisers to unlock a 25 billion dollar monopoly by converting Amazon’s static link empire into a competitive cost-per-click marketplace where publishers get paid like Google rather than like a coupon site. Narrativ boosts yield four times on link inventory through competitive bidding so content consumers find what they want at the best price online, never landing on a “404 page not found.” One billion links have been rewired.  

Narrativ partners include Condé Nast, New York Magazine, Ulta Beauty, and Nordstrom. Launched in stealth in August two thousand seventeen, Narrativ is on pace to deliver six hundred million in advertiser revenue in two thousand eighteen. In June two thousand eighteen, the World Economic Forum honored Narrativ as a Technology Pioneer for its commitment to digital sustainability.  

Narrativ is looking to hire a Data Scientist whose work will improve product technology solutions to continue driving higher revenue for partners and make it easier for consumers to find the best products at the best prices. The technology company powers efficient advertising and marketing by collecting large amounts of data to feed real-time bidding systems used to match products across retailers for a seamless online shopping experience.  

The role is expected to explore data collected, present key findings and data relevant to stakeholders, develop models to explain trends in data, and help use models to build new product features. As the first Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to help define what the role looks like within a tight, talented team.  

Core responsibilities include:  
- Explore and visualize clickstream and product data.  
- Develop models and theories to explain trends in data.  
- Design and execute experiments to question assumptions and validate theories.  
- Clean, analyze, and select data to achieve project goals.  
- Build production systems using modeling and machine learning to exploit data trends and track impact over time.  
- Accurately determine cause-effect relationships.  
- Present clear proposals and results, combining data with actionable solutions.  
- Ensure data quality through processes for sourcing, collecting, normalizing, transforming, aligning, and mapping at all stages of data acquisition.  
- Collaborate with colleagues in engineering and business teams to improve data querying infrastructure for online use cases.  

Requirements:  
- Relevant degree and academic experience in high-level mathematics and statistics.  
- Proven track record in data dives to discover hidden patterns enabling error and deviation analysis.  
- Five years of experience using various machine learning techniques to model large datasets.  
- Knowledge of parameters affecting performance.  
- Proficiency with command-line usage and Python to implement models.  
- Ability to work independently on data exploration and visualization tasks.  
- Motivation to achieve results in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.  
- Exceptional organization and strong attention to detail.  

Narrativ offers an incredibly competitive salary, covers one hundred percent of health, dental, and vision insurance, and provides the challenge of architecting a new business model in a meaningful, profitable company growing rapidly without wasteful spending. Perks include weekly happy hours, monthly company outings, Slack meme games, and a commitment to making a societal impact by building sustainable technology, ending “404” errors, open-sourcing many projects, and contributing to the broader digital community.

normalized_jd:
New York City Department of Finance is responsible for administering tax revenue law in the city fairly, efficiently, and transparently to instill public confidence and encourage compliance by providing exceptional customer service, property valuation, and tax mapping. It is responsible for the valuation of one million properties in the City of New York, overseeing assessment and valuation in a fair and equitable manner as part of the city’s real property tax system. Valuation enables the efficient and effective collection of the majority of revenue for the City of New York.  

The City of New York recently contracted for image capture, which includes the delivery of aerial and street-level Light Detection and Ranging (LiDAR) data for property valuation and mapping. The unit is seeking a Geospatial Data Scientist to provide imagery processing specifically related to the exploitation of LiDAR imagery data. The individual will extract building features from aerial and street-level LiDAR data for the purpose of detecting changes and code violations, automate processes, and produce lists for inspection. The goal is to use LiDAR technology combined with multisource databases to assist in resolving workload issues by providing data-driven intelligence.  

Additionally, the person will be responsible for identifying new tools, techniques, and processes to transform geospatial information in order to improve and streamline workflow. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: LiDAR feature extraction from identified images and associated data; use of software to assist, integrate, manipulate, exploit, extract, and analyze digital imagery; geospatial database management; use of various databases; remote sensing; spatial analysis; Geographic Information System (GIS) tools; skills to construct multisource geospatial intelligence databases to guide policy; generation of three-dimensional buildings and three-dimensional modeling variables; use of statistical software to analyze geospatial data; merging databases; providing maintenance, review, and quality control of geospatial data; performing geocoding and digitizing of data; and performing special projects and initiatives as assigned.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
For Assignment Level I: A master’s degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, or environmental science, or public health.  
For Assignment Level II: A candidate must have one of the following:  
1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental, or social science, and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative, or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or  
2. Two master’s degrees from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental, or social science, and three years of responsible, full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or  
3. Education and experience equivalent to “1” or “2” above. However, candidates must have at least a master’s degree in the appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience as described in “2.” Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in “1” or “2.”  

Note: The probationary period for appointment to this position is subject to a minimum of one year.  

Preferred skills: The preferred candidate will have a minimum of three years of experience and a master’s degree in geography, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), image science, remote sensing, or a similar engineering or science field. Demonstrated experience in applied image processing and scientific analysis of LiDAR imagery; knowledge of image formation, remote sensing, and photogrammetry; knowledge of commercial imagery data products and processing sensors; experience with three-dimensional GIS; ability to communicate effectively in writing and oral presentations; ability to complete tasks in a timely manner with minimal supervision; ability to work cooperatively and effectively as a team member; proficiency in using image processing software; knowledge of programming languages R and Python; familiarity with commercial data source integration; ArcGIS experience; and experience utilizing large datasets and databases in a cloud environment.  

Additional information: In compliance with federal law, persons hired are required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.  

To apply, click the “Apply” button. We appreciate every applicant’s interest and consideration. Only those contacted will be considered.  

Hours/Shift: Unless otherwise indicated, this position requires a five-day work week.  
Work Location: Sixty-Six John Street, New York, New York. Current location could be subject to change.  

Residency requirement: New York City residency is generally required within ninety days of appointment. However, city employees in certain titles who have worked for the city for two continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of the interview.

normalized_jd:
Overview Alliant seeking Associate Data Scientist to join Data Science team to build predictive models and perform customer segmentation. Ideal candidate is data-curious, motivated, and a contributing member of the team focused on delivering profit-building solutions to direct interactive marketers. Successful candidate will have experience building regression models with online and offline data. Additionally, candidate will be familiar with Statistical Analysis programming, large-scale databases, and personal computer software for data processing. Position reports to Vice President of Data Science. Principal responsibility is to build predictive models to meet business requirements for direct digital marketers, conduct ad hoc analysis, identify changes and count trends in marketing data, produce analyses to compare, validate, and improve modeling solutions, evaluate third-party data, and create novel solutions and products for online and offline marketers.  

Key skills and background: Graduate degree or related coursework in data mining, statistics, operations research, or similar field required. One year of experience building predictive models. Entry-level experience programming Statistical Analysis Base, Statistical Analysis Macro, visual analytics, visual statistics, and advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge. Overall keen understanding of technology. Must have experience with large-scale databases, Unix, R, and Python. Must have strong quantitative and analytical skills, extensive attention to detail, and excellent oral and written communication skills. Direct digital marketing industry experience is a plus. Knowledge of Linux, object-oriented programming, and Structured Query Language is a plus. Must be flexible, detail-oriented, team-oriented, able to work independently as needed, and committed to good time management and great job performance.

normalized_jd:
Position mission summary: Looking for an opportunity to use cutting-edge technology analyzing petabytes of data in a world-class Object-Oriented Programming cluster, generating insights to guide the consumer journey to wellness and help achieve health ambitions, whether running in a trail marathon or playing tackle football with grandchildren. Aetna Member Analytics team is focused on delivering strategically impactful programs and tools to help members across life stages feel the joy of achieving their best health.  

This position will work within and across functional teams delivering predictive analytics solutions to drive customer engagement, next best action, and improve customer experience across critical journeys, e.g., onboarding, breast cancer, maternity.  

The candidate will be responsible for extracting and manipulating data from multiple large data sources, using data to deliver predictive model solutions to drive member behavior and experience across channels: mobile application, web, email, social, call center, Apple Watch.  

A fundamental component develops United States advanced algorithms and statistical predictive models, determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques, and evaluates scenarios for potential future outcomes.  

Requires strong programming skills to explore, analyze, and interpret large volumes of data in various forms, solve complex business problems, and support experimental design for campaigns across multiple channels, i.e., web, mobile application, email, social, Apple Watch.  

In partnership with marketing stakeholders, evaluates campaign performance for optimization in subsequent iterations. Demonstrates strong ability to communicate technical concepts and implications to peers, managers, and business partners.  

Background experience: Two to three years of progressively complex related experience. Demonstrates proficiency in areas of mathematical analysis methods, machine learning, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and in-depth specialization in areas of expertise.  

Using R and Python to manipulate large datasets and develop statistical models. Expertise in data management in an Object-Oriented Programming environment, including use of Hive. Excellent problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and conceptual thinking ability. Strong ability to communicate technical concepts and implications to business partners. Knowledge of the healthcare industry preferred.  

Education: Highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Master’s degree.  

Additional job information: Aetna job opportunity to reshape health care in America and across the globe, developing solutions to improve quality and affordability of health care benefits for generations to come. We care for our customers, our community, and are inspired to make a difference. We are committed to integrity and excellence. Together, we empower people to live healthier lives.  

Aetna is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select, and develop women, people of color, veterans, and individuals with disabilities.  

Our company is built on excellence, with a culture that values growth, achievement, and diversity in the workplace. Your voice is heard.  

Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click to review benefits associated with this position.  

Aetna takes candidate data privacy seriously. At no time will an Aetna recruiter or employee request financial or personal information (Social Security number, credit card information, direct deposit) via email. If such information is requested, it will be discussed prior to and conducted via a secure website provided by the recruiter. If you are asked for such information, please notify us immediately.

Ideal candidate is data-curious and willing to participate in a team-driven environment to provide direct digital marketing clients with innovative, profit-building solutions. Successful candidate has a wide range of experience building regression models and presenting results to marketing team and Senior Management. Additionally, candidate is familiar with Statistical Analysis programming, large-scale databases, personal computer software, web analytics, and database manipulation. Position reports to Vice President of Data Science and will become a key contributor to a skilled predictive modeling and analytics team. Principal responsibility is to build predictive models to meet business requirements, direct digital marketers, conduct ad hoc analysis, identify changes and trends in marketing data, produce analysis to compare, validate, and improve modeling solutions, evaluate third-party data, and create novel solutions for products for online and offline marketers.

normalized_jd:
Join Sweeten, a fast-growing, award-winning technology company based in New York City, founded and trained by an architect team of super ambitious, fun people fascinated by construction, design, technology, and building. Go to marketplace for major renovation, Sweeten’s first Data Scientist will chart the course for data infrastructure, drive insight, and lead step-function improvement to connect renovators and construction professionals to the best fit job role. Design and apply statistical models, build mission-critical dashboards, help structure and order data pipelines, and enable Machine Learning to scale renovating, a complex undertaking.  

The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative, fluid environment, is comfortable learning new skills, and working with unfamiliar technology. We are looking for someone who loves design and technology that elegantly solves complex business problems, and wants to apply their talent to a company that values creativity and problem solving. We believe in general contractors investing in the potential of world-class tools to help get renovation work done successfully. The Data Scientist will also serve the internal team as an information resource to help us get great work done at increasing scale. Sweeten’s technology is ultimately people-focused, and we are looking for a new team member who wants to be part of the big picture.  

**Responsibilities**  
- Set up, maintain, and scale data analytics infrastructure.  
- Work closely with Product, Marketing, and Sales teams to develop new and improved platform products.  
- Build interactive dashboards to guide day-to-day operations, planning, and strategic decision-making.  
- Build Machine Learning models to power core operations, matching algorithms, and lead quality assessment.  
- Translate business constraints into product management, query data science questions, and experimental design.  
- Consider ways to test, track, measure, and optimize across systems.  
- Innovate fearlessly, looking for ways to keep things simple.  

**Requirements**  
- One to three years of industry experience in Data Science broadly.  
- Skilled Full-Stack Data Scientist equally proficient in software development, Machine Learning, Big Data visualization.  
- Strong Python and Pandas skills.  
- Proficiency in Structured Query Language (SQL).  
- Experience with Git, Roku, Amazon Web Services (AWS).  
- Pacesetter who wants to set the standard.  
- Self-directed, organized, committed to innovation.  
- Passion and interest in learning, design, real estate, renovation.  
- Relentless drive and collaborative spirit.  
- Knowledge of statistics, clustering, regression, and experimental design is a plus.  
- Experience working with Deep Learning neural network models using TensorFlow and Keras is a plus.  
- Experience with Docker, Dash, Plotly analytical web applications is a plus.  

**Benefits**  
- Competitive compensation.  
- Exciting growth opportunities.  
- Fully funded health plan.  
- 401(k) options.  
- Fly Sweeten swag designed in-house.  
- Weekly catered team lunch.  

Sweeten deeply values diversity and individuality, and is committed to creating a work environment where creativity, ideas, interests, and varied perspectives are valued and central to the success of the team. If you are interested in joining the team, we encourage you to apply. Be sure to include a cover letter to let us know if the position sounds like a great fit and how you will succeed at Sweeten.

normalized_jd:
Role: Free Seas Patient Messaging Platform delivers targeted, meaningful digital messaging to ten million patients per year. Looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing Analytics team — someone smart, eager to learn, with extraordinary analytical and technical skills. Joining a team of especially smart, humorous, quick-witted, dedicated coworkers passionate about data and healthcare. You will be responsible for modeling and understanding the makeup of the patient population, determining and optimizing message targeting, and building an analytics framework for measuring the effectiveness of campaigns. Create analytical frameworks to optimize patient message targeting and forecast sales. Responsible for modeling and understanding the makeup of the patient population, devising optimal targeting strategies, and helping measure and report the effectiveness of campaigns. Must love solving problems and be committed to continual improvement. Create and optimize message targeting strategies, investigate methods to efficiently classify and characterize patients, configure and optimize message delivery systems, model and forecast patient messaging inventory, and create and improve internal reporting systems. Discover valuable insights for clients, manage various aspects of configuration, deployment, and testing of messaging products, identify and diagnose issues in message delivery, and provide monthly reporting to key partners internally and externally.  

Need: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related technical field. Superior analytical and problem-solving ability, strong Structured Query Language skills, Python skills, attention to detail, and the ability to organize and present complex data in a way that tells a compelling story and drives decision-making. Keen intuition for data analysis, ability to distinguish what matters and what does not, thorough understanding of ways data can mislead, excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal), and comfort working on complex, partially defined problems with limited guidance.  

Bonus points: Healthcare experience, basic understanding of clinical terms, experience with digital media, experience with Apache Spark.  

We strive to provide a diverse and inclusive environment and are an equal opportunity employer.

normalized_jd:
News ELA instructional content platform brings together engaging accessible content integrated assessment insight to supercharge reading engagement and learning in every subject, with a dedicated mission to unlock the written word for everyone. Three years since launch, New Sela is already in seventy-five schools across fifty United States, in addition to one hundred eighty countries. As a result: engaged readers, engaged readers become better learners. News ELA usage in classrooms worldwide has grown, with a focus on using data-driven analysis of results across every area of the business in order to make us efficient and effective in helping students learn to read.  

Data Warehouse Business Intelligence Intern will help us organize and make sense of vast amounts of product, sales, and marketing data. This is a paid part-time position, twenty hours per week, based in the New York City office.  

Responsibilities: work with Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists to improve data modeled and organized within the data warehouse. After five years of exponential growth, data systems have grown cluttered and confusing. The role will help us impose order, analyze database performance, find ways to make things run faster, rewrite Structured Query Language files, simplify complex queries, optimize Amazon Redshift tables, review analyst Structured Query Language code, provide feedback according to the style guide, write training documentation to help Data Analysts and business users understand the data they are working with, and recommend and implement data governance rules.  

Ideal candidate: current or recent college student with interest in databases and data modeling, proficient in Structured Query Language plus Computer Science, Information Science, or related course of study, experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau and Looker, experience creating data visualizations, interest or experience in web applications and data generation.  

New Sela is strongly committed to the principle of equal opportunity. Individuals at News ELA make employment decisions without unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or status protected by law.

normalized_jd:
Vroom.com, a venture-backed, fast-growing startup focused on revolutionizing the car buying experience, approaches the unique condition of pre-owned vehicles with high standards, selling online and delivering anywhere across the United States. We experienced tremendous growth in the first five years of operation and have become a disruptive force in the automotive industry. Vroom is an exciting, accelerating workplace; there has never been a better time to join our team. We are constantly exploring new ways to improve our car pricing algorithm, optimize our inventory merchandising model, and leverage data to better understand our customers.  

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Data Science and Analytics team. The ideal candidate is looking to apply their passion for data and technology to drive business-critical decisions in a role with high visibility in the business and strong potential for growth within the company.  

Responsibilities:  
- End-to-end data workflow development.  
- Develop deep domain expertise in underlying actor behavior manifested in data.  
- Implement and validate predictive models.  
- Create and maintain statistical models to optimize inventory, focusing on the used car market, pricing, vehicle attributes, and demand indicators.  
- Identify standard and novel data sources associated with consumer-related demand levels and market indicators.  
- Acquire, organize, and leverage insights derived from data.  
- Collaborate with Data Engineers to rapidly deploy newly developed models.  
- Develop and maintain Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) pipelines to optimize integration and use of available data sources.  
- Propose solutions and strategies for business challenges.  

Requirements:  
- Strong demonstrated technical skills and desire to continue expanding skills in quantitative and technical analytics.  
- Education: Master’s or Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in a quantitative discipline preferred.  
- Experience in supply chain planning, demand modeling, inventory optimization, or advertising technology industry preferred.  
- Proficiency in applying statistical and machine learning methods to real-world, contemporary data engineering and data science.  
- Technical skills, e.g., Structured Query Language (SQL), R, Python.  
- Desire to try cutting-edge approaches.  

Benefits:  
This full-time role offers competitive compensation, health, dental, and vision insurance through UnitedHealthcare, a 401(k) plan, fully company-paid short-term disability, long-term disability, life insurance, access to healthcare concierge service, virtual visits, and fifteen annualized days of paid vacation.  

The biggest benefit is being part of a low-ego, high-performing team that is transforming the used car market into a modern, online, data-driven industry. We are looking for people who want to be part of a contemporary startup culture that gets you out of bed to work with talented people on a mission that matters.  

Apply if you think you might be a great fit by sending your resume and cover letter telling us why you would be a great addition to the team.

normalized_jd:
ServiceTitan is building a strategic analytics team to take understanding of business growth cost drivers to the next level, make smarter investment and operational decisions across the company, and accelerate disruption in the home servicing industry. Part of ServiceTitan’s success is attributed to an intensive Software as a Service metric-driven culture and an environment of relentless investigation to get to the root cause and come to the right solution, either augmenting and replicating success or promptly addressing opportunities for improvement in critical investment areas. ServiceTitan bears a lot of responsibility as the business and technology investment portfolio grows in complexity, and the performance of the team has significant impact on ServiceTitan and also on the success of customers, impacting lives in the pursuit of extraordinary answers to critical business questions around marketing, sales funnel optimization, customer retention, business investment prioritization, and corporate development opportunities.  

Interact with key business stakeholders at ServiceTitan in end-to-end data analysis and modeling for assigned projects, create sustainable data science models, participate in continuous improvement of predictive analytics frameworks, leverage insights gained from analytics into actionable business recommendations, develop dashboard systems to monitor business metrics at an in-depth level, spot emerging trends, challenges, and potential opportunities, promote adoption of cutting-edge analytics across ServiceTitan, implement innovative quantitative research tools and models, ultimately contributing to the development of ServiceTitan’s decision support system.  

Need a Master’s degree or Doctor of Philosophy in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or similar quantitative discipline. Required: five years of experience, three years post-Doctor of Philosophy, as a data scientist or analyst developing business-oriented models in marketing analytics, demand forecasting, price optimization, and customer segmentation. Hands-on knowledge of data mining, forecasting, and optimization mathematics. Proficiency in one statistical optimization package: Python, R, or MATLAB. Expertise in Structured Query Language. Experience with business intelligence tools such as Tableau is also helpful. Experience in Agile software development is a plus. Good communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to communicate complex concepts to nontechnical business stakeholders. Capability to drive research and analysis initiatives, project design, and product development. Creative thinker able to develop unique methods of analysis when traditional methods yield no results.  

ServiceTitan is a mobile, cloud-based software platform that helps home service companies streamline operations, improve customer service, and grow their business. ServiceTitan is an end-to-end solution for the multi-billion dollar residential home service industry, including Customer Relationship Management, intelligent dispatch, custom reporting, marketing automation, mobile solutions for field technicians, and accounting integration into Intacct and QuickBooks. ServiceTitan brings a fully operational, modern Software as a Service infrastructure to an industry traditionally underserved by software. ServiceTitan is the preferred software for hundreds of the world’s most successful plumbing, heating, ventilation, and air conditioning, and electrical companies.  

For more information on ServiceTitan, visit Los Angeles Business Journal’s Top One Hundred Fastest Growing Private Companies 2017, Inc. 5000 America’s Fastest Growing Companies 2017, and Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup List 2017.

normalized_jd:
Job description Tech Style Fashion Group is currently looking for a Data Scientist. The Data Scientist will be responsible for developing algorithms for e-commerce merchandising, purchasing, media acquisition, inventory, order fulfillment, and member services for the Tech Style brand. The right candidate will possess outstanding communication skills to assist the brand team with experimentation and insights, ultimately training algorithms to support core business functions. This position reports to the Senior Director of Data Science.  

Responsibilities include developing solutions to support core business functions, carrying projects from concept to completion, working closely with business and engineering teams to push models to production, communicating effectively with product teams to explain return on investment, level of effort, and statistical findings from experiments, helping create algorithms known to provide return on investment in e-commerce environments, working closely with media teams to help maximize advertising spend, creating attribution models, assisting product engineering teams in determining features to support future machine learning models, and sharing insights learned from experimentation with underlying teams.  

Required skills include at least two years of experience and a degree in a mathematical field including statistics, economics, physics, or aerospace; fluency in Python; experience creating, deploying, and retraining machine learning algorithms to overcome problems in production environments; good understanding of existing models; experience in model selection, feature exploration, dimensionality reduction, and sparse datasets; experience with T-SQL, data manipulation libraries including Apache Spark, Pandas, and NumPy; experience with deep learning libraries TensorFlow and MXNet; experience with machine learning libraries Scikit-learn, Spark MLlib, and MLpack; data visualization experience including scatterplots, histograms, and distribution charts; understanding of cloud offerings including Snowflake, Amazon SageMaker, Google Cloud, Azure Machine Learning, and Azure Workbench; plus understanding of e-commerce; and outstanding communication skills.  

Tech Style is an equal opportunity employer: Minority, Female, Protected Veteran, Disability.

normalized_jd:
Data Scientist Intern help you discover information hidden in vast amounts of data, help you make smarter decisions, deliver even better products and services. Primary focus on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building high-quality analytical prediction systems integrated into products. Example projects include optimization of lead generation systems using machine learning techniques, building recommendation systems for personalized user content. Responsibilities include selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques, data mining using state-of-the-art methods, extending company data with third-party sources of information as needed, enhancing data collection procedures to include information relevant for building analytic systems, processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis, ad hoc analysis, presenting results in a clear manner, creating automated machine learning-based systems with constant tracking of performance.  

Skills and qualifications: excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-nearest neighbors, Naive Bayes, support vector machines, decision forests; experience with common data science toolkits such as R, SciKit-Learn, NumPy, TensorFlow; excellence in at least one highly desirable; great communication skills; experience with data visualization tools such as D3.js, ggplot; proficiency in using query languages such as Structured Query Language; experience with Structured Query Language databases; good applied statistical skills including distributions, statistical testing, regression; good scripting and programming skills in Python, Java; data-oriented personality.  

Education: Bachelor of Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or related field; Master of Philosophy or Doctor of Philosophy in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Physics, or related field.  

Success starts with the right people. Internet Brand values mentors and members of a growing team, seeking talented, goal-oriented professionals who live and breathe the internet, thrive in a flexible and challenging work environment, and are team innovators. Enabled, Internet Brand sustains high levels of profitability and success, evolving along with the internet for twenty years. Internet Brand promotes an entrepreneurial, friendly culture, applauds innovation that results from embracing change, and values independence. Employees are intensely driven and constantly encouraged to reach higher, use creativity to achieve success, and enjoy high levels of collaboration with the luxury of coming to work in jeans and sneakers. Proud to offer a unique blend of innovation, startup history, and the stability and benefits of an established corporation. Internet Brand is a wholly owned affiliate and an equal opportunity employer.

normalized_jd:
Snap Inc. camera company believes reinventing the camera represents the greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. The product empowers people to express, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together. Snapchat camera is used by millions of people every day. Snap family members watch stories from friends, see events around the world, and explore expertly curated content from top publishers. A short, passionate team is working hard to build the best platform in the world for communication and storytelling.  

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Snapchat team, working closely alongside Engineering, Product Design, and Product Management. You should enjoy creating inventive, data-based approaches to solving difficult business problems. Working in Los Angeles, California headquarters, you will work with the Camera Platform team to transform business questions into data analysis and help keep Snap at the forefront of Augmented Reality partner products and engineering. You will apply expertise in quantitative analysis to create and scale insights, create and test hypotheses, and create visuals and dashboards to effectively report insights to help business and engineering partners make data-driven decisions.  

Minimum qualifications:  
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a quantitative field.  
Two years of experience in quantitative analysis or a data science-related field.  
Fluency in Structured Query Language and big data querying languages.  

Preferred qualifications:  
Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a quantitative field.  
Experience with causal inference techniques, experimental design, or A/B testing.  
Experience with analytical packages such as SciPy.  
Experience with programming languages such as Python.  
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  
High attention to detail.  
Experience in a product-focused role at a social media or mobile technology company.  
Team player able to collaborate with Engineers and Product Managers in cross-functional teams.  
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance.  
Ability to communicate results of analysis in a clear and effective manner to a senior audience.  

Passionate about Snapchat Lens Studio and immersive technology. Snap believes that a team with diverse backgrounds and voices working together enables us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military veteran status, or any other protected classification in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local law.  

If a disability or special need requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to contact us at accommodation-ext@snap.com.

normalized_jd:
Job summary: Fans help fans everywhere get live events they love. Proud division of Live Nation Entertainment, Ticketmaster changed the way the world connects with favorite artists, teams, and shows. We continue to shape innovation every day, selling tickets better than anyone else, enriching lives one amazing experience at a time. Think that is pretty amazing? If you are passionate about the magic of live entertainment and want to work for a company dedicated to helping millions of fans experience it, we want to hear from you.  

We work with our biggest investment—people—offering comprehensive health benefits, 401(k) matching, student loan assistance, plus career-boosting opportunities like tuition reimbursement and targeted development sessions to help eligible employees thrive. Ticketmaster offers the fast-paced excitement of a startup with the rock-solid support of an industry leader, plus plenty of ticket perks on the side.  

Role: Ticketmaster has been building a new platform for live entertainment for the past four years. Our application programming interfaces have gone from one million per year to one billion per year, including mobile initiatives. Today we sell tickets on Ticketmaster.com and partner e-commerce sites and the biggest social networks. As we continue to grow, we need an outstanding Data Scientist to take on responsibilities as part of a dynamic, highly focused team responsible for providing machine learning insights to products that engage Ticketmaster’s one hundred seventy million users.  

Responsibilities include designing and implementing machine learning algorithms ranging from feature engineering, feature selection, clustering, predictive scoring, and classification, to supporting analysis that values various marketing channels in order to support appropriate allocation of resources. You will support feature engineering, modeling demand, pricing, sales forecasting, and carry out rigorous model validation, model tuning, and optimization as part of the natural model lifecycle.  

Qualifications:  
- Two years of software development with high-level programming languages like Java, C, C++, Python.  
- Strong machine learning background with supervised and unsupervised algorithms.  
- Experience with state-of-the-art machine learning toolkits and algorithms, e.g., Vowpal Wabbit (VW), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow.  
- Two years of industry experience or equivalent pertinent coursework.  
- Proficient in Structured Query Language, Relational Database Management Systems.  
- Experience and knowledge of frameworks like Object-Oriented Programming, Pig desirable.  
- Education: Master of Philosophy, Doctor of Philosophy in Mathematics or Statistics.  
- Effective communication skills and enjoyment of working as part of a team.  

Equal Employment Opportunity: Ticketmaster strongly supports equal employment opportunity for applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any characteristic protected by state or federal law.  

Hiring practices: The preceding job description is designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of duties, responsibilities, or qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. Ticketmaster’s recruitment policy is designed to place highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Ticketmaster may pursue any avenue available, including promotion from within, employee referral, outside advertising, employment agencies, internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting, and search firms.

normalized_jd:
Job title: Data Scientist Generalist  

Position overview: Looking for an entry-level Data Scientist to join a growing team. The successful candidate will work with the Data Science Engineering team to collect, process, and analyze data for projects relating to energy, healthcare, finance, and logistics.  

Responsibilities:  
- Ingest and organize data from various sources, e.g., relational databases.  
- Process data using typical Data Science techniques, e.g., deduplication, imputation.  
- Conduct analysis using common Data Science techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, and decision tree algorithms, e.g., random forest; clustering algorithms, e.g., k-means; support vector machines.  
- Analyze and visualize data using common Data Science packages such as NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, and Plotly.  
- Work in a highly collaborative environment to brainstorm, design, implement, and deliver solutions to challenging industrial Internet of Things problems.  

Qualifications and skills:  
- Minimum of one to two years of experience solving Data Science problems.  
- Programming experience in Python, Java, and MATLAB preferred.  
- Master’s or Doctor of Philosophy in application of Data Science solutions to industrial projects.  
- Domain expertise in energy, healthcare, finance, and logistics.  
- Research experience with high-impact publications.  

Beyond Limits:  
Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence company with technology legacy from space exploration spun out of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Jet Propulsion Laboratory at the California Institute of Technology. Beyond Limits provides advanced intelligence solutions that go far beyond conventional cognitive computing technology, mimicking human thought processes and providing autonomous reasoning to aid human-like decision making.  

Equal Employment Opportunity:  
Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunity to employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training. Beyond Limits expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Beyond Limits employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline, including discharge.

normalized_jd:
Edmunds has been driven to make car buying easier ever since it began publishing its printed car guide sixty years ago. The company has been in business, trusted for innovating ways to empower and support car shoppers. Edmunds launched the car industry’s first internet site in one thousand nine hundred ninety-four and established a leadership position online, never looking back. It is one of the most trusted review sites on the internet, with millions of visitors using it to research, shop, and use buying tools every month to make easy, informed decisions on their next car. Consumers bring peace of mind, and dealers make use of tools to help solve problems and sell cars.  

Ask the key ingredient? Enthusiastic employees, a progressive company culture, and cutting-edge technology.  

If you want to join the team, read on to find out more.  

The Analytics team at Edmunds.com is seeking a Data Scientist to play a crucial role in designing and optimizing tests to help guide product initiatives for the Tier One advertising business and Original Equipment Manufacturer partner initiatives. These involve in-depth studies of Edmunds users and clients, as well as the automotive marketplace, directly impacting revenue generated by the Tier One advertising business. Projects involve sound statistical models, carefully planned and executed experiments, creative use of Edmunds’ vast data resources, thoughtful analysis, and beautiful visualization of results.  

We are looking for a person who is smart, creative, and ambitious, able to work and communicate well with a variety of people with varying technical backgrounds. We especially want someone excited about engaging in data-driven analysis to strategically optimize Edmunds’ product offerings for customers and clients.  

At Edmunds, we care as much about helping people grow meaningfully, effectively, and prosperously as we care about our people. We have demonstrated passion for data analytics and provide incredible growth opportunities to make this the best job you have ever had.  

As a Data Scientist, you will:  
- Partner with Product Managers to design and implement in-depth studies of Edmunds users and clients.  
- Implement and provide feedback on robust tests that provide meaningful results.  
- Build statistical, machine learning, and optimization models to improve Edmunds’ Tier One advertising business.  
- Write production modeling code and collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms as necessary.  
- Prepare visualizations of data in order to explain, persuade, and communicate results to stakeholders across the business.  
- Identify key areas for future research needs.  

Qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field preferred; advanced degree a plus.  
- One to two years of work experience in an analytics-related position; three to four years of work experience in an analytics-related position preferred.  
- Deep understanding of data platforms you have previously worked with.  
- Ability to work well in a team.  
- Proficiency in Structured Query Language, strong R and Python skills, experience with Jupyter Notebook a plus.  
- Experience building models and engineering features using data to optimize product performance.  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  
- Experience performing analysis on raw event data from modern distributed system engineering stacks.  
- Ability to take findings and make simple, beautiful, and easy-to-interpret data visualizations.  

Working at Edmunds.com:  
Employees think it is a pretty great place to work. Publications have recognized it as one of the best places to work, including Fortune magazine, Great Place to Work, and the Los Angeles Business Journal for the last six years, as well as Computerworld. Built In Los Angeles has also identified it as one of the best workplaces specifically in technology and for diversity, including Asian American representation. In fact, Chief Executive Officer Avi Steinlauf was rated on Glassdoor as one of the highest-rated Chief Executive Officers.  

If you are interested in learning more and joining our mission, we would love to hear from you. Edmunds will consider employment for qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law.

normalized_jd:
Role located either Oakland or Burbank, offer relocation, active participation, range market strategy project essential Kaiser Permanente membership margin goal, market strategy analysis. Consultant provides analytical, strategic thinking, and leadership skills enabling project team to: one, isolate business issues; two, design and execute analytics studying business issues, market research, scenario planning, forecasting, market share, and profitability; three, bring technical content expertise in competitive intelligence utilization, financial analysis, deep data analysis, and programming; four, vet findings and make formal recommendations to Senior level Kaiser Permanente leadership; five, create and document strategic segment plan utilization reports to inform critical strategic issues.  

Preferred role primarily focused on analyzing digital campaigns, paid search, YouTube, Facebook, and online advertising. Person with three years of experience in Search Engine Marketing, Search Engine Optimization, and analytics, as well as experience building analytical models, logistic regression, and proficiency using SAS, SPSS, R, and Python is preferred. Three years of experience within an advertising agency or similar is preferred.  

Essential functions: collect and organize data from mainframe files, data warehouse reports, vendor extracts, departmental spreadsheets, databases, internet, and intranet sites; create easy-to-use internal business analytical tools for clients; create and maintain database tools delivering data to internal clients; use data to investigate identified business issues and address hypotheses; create complex analytical views of data, identifying major assumptions and gaps; develop preliminary conclusions and tell the story.
