normalized_jd:
Riot Games established in two thousand six. Entrepreneurial gamers believe player-focused game development results in great games. In two thousand nine Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. It became the most played PC game in the world with one hundred million players every month. Players form the foundation of the community and continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.  

We are looking for humble, ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two, and we promise to return the favor. Like you, we take play seriously, are passionate about games, embrace seeing things differently, and are not afraid to experiment with a healthy disregard for constraints.  

As a Data Scientist, you will develop advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical models to solve critical problems and help deliver an awesome player experience. You will partner with product teams to implement data science models in live production systems. You will bring a fresh perspective to inform decision-making toward a better player experience, translating player voice into insights using top-notch modeling and analytic skills. You will work closely with software engineers to combine modeling and coding skills to create tools and infrastructure that empower the next level of data science at Riot.  

Educated: You have earned a Bachelor’s degree equivalent in statistics, computer science, mathematics, physics, or an applied quantitative field, and have likely added a Master’s degree or Doctor of Philosophy in the field.  

Keeping good company: You are a precision-focused professional, preferring accuracy over grandstanding, with broad knowledge in machine learning, statistics, algorithm design, and software engineering.  

Experienced: You have earned recognition in statistical modeling, machine learning, distributed systems, and databases. You understand how to architect, implement, deploy, and maintain data science-intensive applications in cloud environments. You have also excelled in deep learning, natural language processing, server architecture, software engineering, full-stack web development, and visualization. You may have earned recognition in big data.  

Passionate: You have a firm grasp of Structured Query Language, Structured Query Language databases, cloud environments, and streaming, as well as object-oriented programming ecosystems, Apache Hive, and Apache Spark. You are curious about the frontier of big data technology and committed to exploring the newest code. You write well-abstracted, reusable code in Python, R, Java, and Scala, and freely navigate Linux environments. You understand web application documentation, version control, and code review.  

Innovative: You are analytical, a skilled lateral thinker, pulling insights from data and free-associating unique perspectives on problems that stump lesser innovators. You are a problem solver who conducts problem reconnaissance and resolution with skill and precision, delivering elegant, scalable solutions. You easily identify and troubleshoot problems, quickly resolving issues.  

Player-focused: As a gamer, you know the importance of listening to player needs, especially implicit needs uncovered by analyzing and understanding player data. You analyze petabytes of player data, develop and test data-fueled hypotheses, extract useful information, and turn it into helpful insights to improve the player experience.  

You bring data science to life by working with software engineers to architect, develop, and deploy production-level applications powered by advanced machine learning algorithms to improve the player experience. You bring data science to people by designing, prototyping, and implementing new ways to effectively communicate data science findings to non-technical audiences. You enjoy the beauty of advanced machine learning and develop tools to help data scientists and stakeholders efficiently explore deep, rich data stores. You bring fresh perspectives and new dimensions to analysis, embrace challenges, and identify opportunities for improvement. You develop algorithms and predictive models to solve critical Riot Games problems, validate models to ensure proper behavior, and work closely with fellow data scientists and engineers to identify opportunities to improve the data ecosystem.  

Do not forget to include your resume and cover letter. We receive many applications, and we will notice a fun, well-written introduction that shows you take play seriously.

normalized_jd:
New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, the nation’s largest for-hire transportation agency, is responsible for licensing and regulating the city’s yellow and green taxicabs, for-hire vehicles including applications like Uber, Lyft, Via, commuter vans, and certain luxury limousines. The Taxi and Limousine Commission develops and enforces rules to promote safety, transparency, as well as consumer and driver protection for this vital mode of transport in New York City. Vehicles and businesses, as well as drivers, are licensed and regulated by the agency, which moves one million people a day.  

With the introduction of new applications and technology, the Taxi and Limousine Commission is at the front line of the changing mobility landscape in New York City. The Taxi and Limousine Commission collaborates with renowned universities for data analysis and builds partnerships with leaders around the globe for the future of transportation. The work includes streamlining agency operations to meet the demands of a changing industry. The Taxi and Limousine Commission is a committed partner in the Mayor’s Vision Zero initiative to promote safe driving and is a leader in citywide initiatives including Open Data and the growth of the city’s wheelchair-accessible taxi and for-hire vehicle fleet.  

To assist in operations, the Taxi and Limousine Commission runs a number of SQL Server databases with GPS technology in a Windows environment to conduct and monitor operations. In addition, the Taxi and Limousine Commission uses Oracle Database Appliance for CPU-intensive business needs. Working under the supervision of a Senior Database Administrator, the selected database professional would attain a thorough understanding of essential business data, meet user needs, identify new requirements, and ensure the Taxi and Limousine Commission databases are appropriately tuned. The professional would assist users in accessing complex data structures and creating meaningful cubes and views, and work to develop complex graphical and textual analysis tools in Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
Professional vendor certification. Education and experience requirements as of the last day of the application period must include a current professional vendor certification. In addition, as of the last day of the application period, the candidate must have one of the following:  

1. A master’s degree in computer science or a related computer field from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), plus twelve months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized database administration and development experience, including database administration, data modeling, database design, testing, technical writing, and version control.  

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), plus twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized experience as described in option one.  

3. A four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state’s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization, plus twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized experience as described in option one, plus forty-eight months of information technology experience as described in the task inventory.  

4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to option three. Education may be substituted for information technology experience on the basis of thirty semester credits from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) being equivalent to twelve months of experience, to a maximum of forty-eight months. However, to qualify under options two, three, or four, candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state’s Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization, and at least twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized information technology experience as described in option one in the task inventory.  

The task inventory may be read online by clicking the task inventory button in the online notice of examination. Read the task inventory carefully to make sure your work experience meets the minimum qualification requirements.  

Preferred skills:  
Three years of experience in database development and support in Microsoft SQL Server. Strong experience in database administration in SQL Server 2008 R2, 2012, and 2016. Experience troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, and security issues. Experience in performance tuning and query optimization using Performance Monitor, SQL Profiler, and related monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Ability to detect and troubleshoot SQL Server-related CPU, memory, I/O, and disk space resource contention. Strong knowledge of backup, restores, recovery models, database shrink operations, DBCC commands, clustering, database mirroring, and replication. Expert experience implementing operational automation. Strong knowledge of indexes, index management, integrity checks, configuration, patching, and statistics, and working with indexes and stored procedures created and managed effectively. Knowledge of SQL Server tools such as Profiler, Remote Desktop, Task Scheduler, Microsoft SQL Server Agent, SQL Server Configuration Manager, Performance Monitor, Database Mail, and system procedures. SQL development ability to write and troubleshoot SQL code, design stored procedures, functions, tables, views, triggers, indexes, and constraints. Solid acquaintance with Windows Server security, delegation, permissions, and storage components. Documentation skills for processes and procedures, creating knowledge base articles, run books, and topology diagrams for SQL database operational support for technical users. In addition, preference will be given to candidates with development knowledge using Oracle PL/SQL.

normalized_jd:
Description Naval Nuclear Laboratory seeking highly motivated professional to join Information Technology team. Apply for position if you are seeking work in a mission-driven, technically diverse, dynamic environment with a strong technical team focused on learning and continuous improvement. If hired for the position, help maintain Oracle Database and database infrastructure across multiple sites, support Senior Database Administrator, provide support to users and developers, monitor system performance, security, and configuration, improve operations, serve as interface between organization and lines of business, ensure Information Technology needs of user community are addressed. Skills and experience will grow, and you will be encouraged to take increasing responsibility for operational and project work. Impact is limited only by ability and interest.  

Partial list of duties: proactively ensure production databases and underlying infrastructure are secure, running properly, and responsive; work with colleagues, users, and others to debug issues, restore and improve service as needed; collaborate with developers and stakeholders to ensure use of databases is consistent with best practices and policies; maintain recurring operational rhythm for backups, disaster recovery, resource utilization, and operational tasks; document work; partner with teammates to ensure work is validated and repeatable; learn useful skills consistently and repeatedly.  

Requirements: intermediate level Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university and a minimum of two years relevant experience; Master’s degree from an accredited college or university and relevant experience; advanced Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of four years relevant experience; Master’s degree from an accredited college or university and a minimum of two years relevant experience.  

Preferred skills: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Science, or Information Technology from an accredited college or university; work-motivated applicant with solid technical foundation combined with interest and ability to learn new skills; fundamental knowledge of computing, preferably Linux systems and relational databases; awareness of computer infrastructure associated with fields like hardware, networking, storage, and virtualization; ability to communicate clearly, listen sincerely, use a constructive approach to solving problems and improving existing approaches; collaborate openly and broadly to find and implement the best ideas regardless of source.

normalized_jd:
Summary objective: Full-time exempt position working in collaboration with the Advancement team creating reports, generating targeted mailing lists, assisting with research, stewardship, and donor management. The position requires user support as needed.  

Essential functions: Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.  

1. Support and maintain database applications, maintain donor profiles, ensure gift agreements are received and properly filed, and implement and ensure acknowledgement protocols.  
2. Conduct system tuning, performance monitoring, and database maintenance. Support and maintain Raiser’s Edge data integrity and maintain the Raiser’s Edge database application.  
3. Develop reports for custom user requests, develop and maintain accurate gift reports, develop and maintain custom reports, create targeted mailing lists for donor groups and programs, review mailing lists to ensure data integrity and appropriate group inclusion, maintain lists for donor recognition in the Jewish Community Center magazine, website, and permanent recognition, maintain updated lists of naming opportunities, work with Advancement staff to prepare stewardship reports, and create reports as required.  
4. Assist the Chief Advancement Officer with additional administrative support and user support as needed, track donor engagement steps, report progress, track grant timelines, submit reporting, research corporate and foundation grantmakers, research potential and current donors, and prepare materials and information needed for donor meetings.  

Physical demands: Largely sedentary role; however, filing is required and would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.  

Position type and expected hours of work: Flexibility in hours is allowed; employee must be available during core work hours of 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  

Required education and experience: Two years of related experience working in fundraising, working in a nonprofit, working with fundraising databases, knowledge of report creation, targeted mailing list generation, researching individuals, corporations, and foundations, knowledge of accounting, and donor recognition.  

Additional eligibility qualifications: Prior experience with Raiser’s Edge, Daxko software programs a plus. Computer knowledge required: Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, mail merge. MIP preferred. CampMinder preferred.  

Fundraising database duties: Please note this job description is designed to cover but not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee. Job duties, responsibilities, and activities may change over time without notice.

normalized_jd:
Position summary: Coordinate, monitor, and administer the accommodation process with particular emphasis on accommodated testing and note-taking accommodation. Ensure compliance with federal, state, and university requirements. Compile, track, and interpret data, prepare data reports, and make recommendations to the Director regarding changes to policy and procedure. 

Qualifications required: Education – Bachelor’s degree required. Experience – One year of relevant experience including case management and student services, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 

Required skills, knowledge, and abilities: Ability to communicate effectively on an individual level within the university, both verbally and in writing. Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Must have great attention to detail. Familiarity with word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications. Must be flexible with hours, including early morning and evening hours, and regularly able to work weekend hours, with minimal application during peak testing times. 

Preferred skills, knowledge, and abilities: Must have excellent organizational skills, be able to multitask in a high-volume, fast-paced environment, and be willing to work weekend days throughout the year. Must be available to check email regularly during evenings and weekends during peak testing times. 

Additional information: Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority, Female, Veteran, Disabled, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity.

normalized_jd:
College Aide  
First Year Graduate  
New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene  
Division of Epidemiology  

Provide expert epidemiologic support to agency programs and external organizations in order to improve monitoring and delivery of public health services in New York City.  

Fiscal Management and Administrative Services Unit oversees personnel services and data management division. The unit also provides budgetary oversight and administrative support to bureau programs.  

Unit seeking College Aide to assist in development and maintenance of databases for division administrative data. Duties include limited assistance in planning and maintenance of system databases, troubleshooting and correcting errors, utilizing Structured Query Language (SQL) and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) programming to create, develop, and run reports using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access. Collect and capture data, report, and run ad hoc reports as requested. Suggest technology solutions as needed. Handle special projects as assigned.  

Minimum Qualification Requirement:  
Assignment Level I: Matriculation in an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in college or graduate school.  

Assignment Level II: Information Technology – Matriculation in an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in college or graduate school with specific course of study in Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Processing, or a closely related field, including supplementation with nine semester credits in acceptable course study.  

Assignment Level III: Information Technology Fellow – Matriculation in an accredited college or graduate school. Employment is conditioned upon continuance as a student in college or graduate school with specific course of study in Information Technology, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Data Processing, or an area relevant to the Information Technology project assigned, including supplementation with nine semester credits in acceptable course study. Appointment to this assignment level is made by the Technology Steering Committee of the Department of Information Technology and Telecommunications.  

Special Note: Maximum tenure for assignment level title College Aide is six years. Students shall be employed half-time during weeks when classes are in session. Students may be employed full-time during vacation periods.  

Preferred Skills:  
Preferred candidate possesses the following:  
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access  
- Understanding of relational database design principles  
- Experience with Structured Query Language (SQL) and Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) is a plus  

Required Additional Information:  
Important Note to Candidates: Please note that if called for an interview, you will be required to bring to the interview a copy of original documentation that establishes identity and employment eligibility, such as a valid United States passport, permanent resident card (green card), driver’s license, and proof of education according to the education requirement for the civil service title. Current resume and proof of address for New York City residency dated within the last sixty days (such as a recent utility bill, telephone bill, cable bill, or mobile phone bill) are also required. Additional documentation may be required to evaluate qualifications outlined in the posting’s minimum qualification requirement section. Examples of additional documentation may include but are not limited to college transcripts, experience verification, and professional or trade licenses.  

Interview: Selected candidates will be contacted to schedule a non-boarding appointment. At the time of appointment, candidates will be asked to produce original documents along with the original Social Security card.  

Loan Forgiveness: The federal government provides student loan forgiveness through the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF). Qualifying public service employees working at the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene qualify as public service employees and may be able to take advantage of the program by working full-time and meeting program requirements. Please visit the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program site to view eligibility requirements and cancellation information.  

Public Service Apply: Apply online with cover letter. In the Job ID search bar, enter Job ID number 356718.  

We appreciate your interest. Thank you to applicants who apply. Candidates under consideration will be contacted.  

The New York City Health Department is committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and culturally responsive workforce. We strongly encourage people of color, people with disabilities, veterans, women, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and gender nonconforming persons to apply. Applicants are considered without regard to actual or perceived race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, age, or prior record of arrest, as prohibited by law.  

Residency Requirement: New York City residency is generally required within ninety days of appointment. However, city employees in certain titles who have worked for the city for two continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

normalized_jd:
Overall summary: Music Clearance Administrator responsible for music and footage clearance related to Home Box Office's original programming and promotional programming. Report to Vice President, Business Affairs. Primary responsibility: oversee music overflow clearance for high-volume promotional campaigns, e.g., Westworld, Game of Thrones, regarding clearance of sound effects and sound design elements used in connection with various Home Box Office promotional campaigns and interstitial programming, including limited Home Box Office original series, miniseries, films, sports documentaries, special events, licensed theatrical content, and Cinemax original series. Responsible for entering clearance information, i.e., terms and conditions, licensed medium, territory, terms for sound effects and sound design licensed for promotional campaigns and interstitial programming, into internal database SOAP. Important aspect: communicating with operations team, maintaining accuracy in scheduling, exhibition, and distribution of Home Box Office's promotional campaigns and interstitial programming, ensuring United States legal compliance. Implementation and maintenance of new music cue sheet system currently designed by outside agency; work outside system manager to customize format and make sure Home Box Office's requested revisions to software are received and implemented. Work with post-production music supervisors, e.g., Home Box Office original series, Home Box Office films, Home Box Office miniseries, Cinemax original series, Home Box Office documentaries, Home Box Office comedy specials, and live events, to ensure timely delivery of cue sheets to Home Box Office, review cue sheets submitted by production companies, edit and revise as needed, submit final cue sheets to United States performance rights organizations. Clearance and licensing of Home Box Office-owned master recordings and footage from third parties. Regularly communicate, consistently follow up, and monitor pending quote requests and licensing matters, including but not limited to tracking payment due and received, negotiation, preparation, and review of licenses in the United States, ensuring receipt of fully executed agreements and payment of deposit and license fees. Act as liaison with Home Box Office's music publishers and administrators regarding Home Box Office's music copyrights. Analyze public performance royalty statements regarding calculation of profit participation for various composers. Process payments to participants as necessary. Process music and footage payments using Home Box Office's internal system. Additional ad hoc projects assigned by Vice President, Business Affairs.  

Requirements: Bachelor's degree, minimum two years of experience in network or studio music and footage rights clearance. Applicant must have strong communication and organizational skills, ability to multitask, and organize heavy project flow.

normalized_jd:
Housing Preservation and Development seeking Structured Query Language database administrator position, full performance level database administration position managing databases within Housing Preservation and Development operating system environment. Position serves as database administrator for development and production Structured Query Language databases, responsible for new software installations, organization installation support, enterprise relational database management system, multiple applications, multiple environments including hardware network interface implications. Duties include database creation, maintenance, tuning, advanced backup recovery. Selected candidate required to perform case oversight tasks related to database data transformation activity. Agency duties include limited modeling, developing, designing, implementing, enhancing, maintaining, analyzing databases, multiple software systems, legacy applications. Ensure data model and database design conform to overall data modeling standards, guidelines, best practices, approved modeling techniques and approaches. Help maintain enterprise-level data dictionary documenting entity relationships and data attributes. Agency works jointly with team developing data objects and data models to support data services and service-oriented architecture approach.  

Required experience: database management five years, configuration management five years, troubleshooting five years, Structured Query Language Server five years, Oracle Database Management System two years, documentation four years. Prior work experience in database design, implementation, administration using Microsoft Structured Query Language Server 2005 or higher in production environment. Technical expertise in writing optimal Transact-Structured Query Language queries, stored procedures, user-defined functions, views. In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience developing, deploying, maintaining complex SQL Server Integration Services packages. Prior experience in file processing, data import into databases. Keen eye for accuracy, thorough understanding of database maintenance practices including index management, backup strategy, disk space requirements. Experience using the following technology considered a plus: .NET, C#. Four-year college diploma or university degree.  

Key responsibilities: design logical and physical databases, review descriptions of changes to databases, understand changes made and their effects on physical databases, communicate with managerial, administrative, and technical staff to determine information needs and data flow system definitions, manage distribution and retention of data on various storage devices, provide day-to-day advice to users on data structure and terminology, develop policies and procedures related to support and maintenance of database applications, provide input to strategic planning, perform database administration duties including installation, patching, backup, recovery, space management, schema management, startup and shutdown.  

Minimum qualifications:  
1. Master’s degree in Computer Science from an accredited college and three years of progressively responsible full-time satisfactory experience using information technology, computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning, data information processing, user services, area networks, with at least eighteen months of experience in an administrative, managerial, or executive capacity in the areas of computer applications programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning, data processing, supervision of staff performing duties.  
2. Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in item one.  
3. Four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in item one.  
4. Satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to items one, two, or three; however, candidates must have at least a four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in item one, including eighteen months of administrative, managerial, executive, or supervisory experience as described in item one.  

Qualification requirement continued: note the following types of experience are not acceptable — superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation, or management; product use of word processing packages; use of handheld calculators primarily for entering or updating data; system operation of data processing hardware consoles.  

Preferred skills: Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate, seven years working experience administering complex Structured Query Language Server and Oracle environments, experience with cloud Azure Structured Query Language Server, minimum eight years progressive industry experience in the field of database design and data architecture, ability to work with Senior Project Managers, application designers, developers, business analysts, and users to define information needs for the organization, extensive working experience with Third Normal Form database normalization modeling, excellent verbal and writing skills, proficiency in database Structured Query Language language, experience debugging and optimizing Structured Query Language queries, proficiency in Procedural Language Structured Query Language, knowledge and experience with Structured Query Language reporting tools and utilities, good understanding of Extract, Transform, Load concepts, proficiency in transformation tools such as Oracle Data Integrator and Informatica, ability to communicate ideas in technical and non-technical form, highly self-motivated and directed, keen attention to detail, experience working in team-oriented environments.

normalized_jd:
Bureau Information System Technology provides a full range of technology support services for key business functions as part of the charter-mandated responsibility of the Comptroller’s Office. Services include technology strategic planning, website development, graphic design, disaster recovery, system development, network administration, audiovisual services, business process reengineering, change management, program management, security administration, help desk, computer operations, telecommunications, document management, and direction from the Executive Director.  

Application Development Database Developer is responsible for developing and maintaining databases across the office and is also involved in planning and development of databases as well as troubleshooting issues. Job duties and responsibilities for the position include, but are not limited to, the following: developing Structured Query Language Server Integration Services packages, Extract, Transform, Load, and Structured Query Language Server Reporting Services report generation; designing and deploying data table structures, forms, reports, and queries; controlling access permissions and privileges; developing, managing, and testing backup and recovery plans; developing and maintaining database stored procedures, views, and functions for hosted web applications; modifying database structures as necessary based on information given by application developers; producing ad hoc queries; developing reports to support business needs; creating and maintaining technical documentation; implementing data dashboards to display data in differing formats; and performing related functions and special projects as may be required.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
1. A master’s degree in computer science from an accredited college and three years of progressively responsible full-time satisfactory experience using information technology in computer application programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning data information processing, or user services in the area network, including at least eighteen months of experience in an administrative, managerial, or executive capacity in the areas of computer application programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning data processing, or supervision of staff performing these duties.  
2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in item one.  
3. A four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in item one.  
4. A satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to items one, two, or three; however, candidates must possess at least a four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or a recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in item one, including eighteen months of administrative, managerial, executive, or supervisory experience as described in item one.  

Qualification requirement continued: Note the following type of experience is not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation, or management of product use; word processing packages; use of handheld calculators; primarily entering or updating data; system operation of data processing hardware consoles.  

Preferred skills: clearly demonstrated experience as a database developer or administrator working in a team environment; one to two years of experience serving as a database developer or administrator in a Microsoft Structured Query Language Server environment version 2008 or higher is strongly preferred; strong Structured Query Language Server Integration Services, Extract, Transform, Load, and Structured Query Language Server Reporting Services report generation experience; data modeling and database design; well-versed in Structured Query Language Server best practices; experience creating and maintaining extraction, transformation, and loading processes from source systems, files, and databases; ability to extract data manually or in an automated fashion according to specified requirements, business logic, and output formats; strong communication skills required; ability to plan and organize work on multiple tasks simultaneously.  

Additional information: certain residency requirements may apply. We appreciate every applicant’s interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Note: vacancy notices must be posted for at least five workdays before being filled. To apply, please click the apply button. Residency requirement: New York City residency is required for this position.

normalized_jd: Database Administrator Foundation exciting full-time position responsible for comprehensive database administration for the foundation. The successful candidate ensures donor data is collected, stored properly, and used by member organizations. Database cleanup, complex query export, report data entry including gift processing and gift acknowledgment. Position conducts reconciliation with the foundation finance department, research of current and prospective donors using a web-based database wealth screening service, and preparing written donor profiles. Minimum three years of hands-on experience in database management and information technology. Associate of Arts degree required; equivalent combination of education and experience considered. Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel; advanced Microsoft Excel skills preferred. Experience with Blackbaud Raiser’s Edge NXT preferred. Experience with Customer Relationship Management systems strongly considered. Experience with Crystal Reports a plus. Must be detail-oriented, possess excellent organizational skills, and have the ability to prioritize, multitask, and juggle multiple assignments and deadlines. Ability to maintain confidentiality.

normalized_jd:
job description Oracle Microsoft SQL Database Administrator responsible for implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical Microsoft SQL and Oracle Server systems to ensure availability and consistent performance in production IBM Sterling B2B Integrator systems. This is a hands-on position requiring solid technical skills as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively. Responsibilities include configuring and maintaining database server processes including monitoring system health and performance to ensure high-level performance, availability, and security; applying data modeling techniques to ensure development, implementation, and support efforts meet integration and performance expectations; independently analyzing, solving, and correcting issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end; refining and automating regular processes; tracking issues; documenting changes; assisting developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement; providing 24x7 support for critical production systems; performing scheduled maintenance; supporting release deployment activities after hours; sharing domain and technical expertise; providing technical mentorship and cross-training to peer team members.  

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related discipline; four to eight years of Microsoft SQL and Oracle Server administration experience required; experience with performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools; experience with backups, restores, and recovery models; knowledge of high availability and disaster recovery options for database servers; experience working with Windows Server and Linux; excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to organize and plan work independently; ability to work in a rapidly changing environment; ability to multitask and context switch effectively between different activities in a team.  

Additional information: Information kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunity guidelines.  

Sample benefits and perks offered: comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage; matching 401(k); generous paid time off policy; commuter benefits; happy hours; fun events; game breakroom; Bagel Wednesday.

normalized_jd:
Oracle Database Administrator III 3DJR6 Description Oracle Database Administrator III Buffalo New York Function Effectively installs, configures, patches, operates, supports, documents, maintains, analyzes, tunes, and troubleshoots database systems. Ensures Oracle Database system-related procedures adhere to organizational standards. Reviews and analyzes basic Oracle Database performance issues and makes performance tuning suggestions to management as needed. Trains new members in basic department procedures and workflow.  

Key skills: Oracle, Oracle 12.1, Oracle 12.2, Data Guard, Fast-Start Failover, Oracle Enterprise Manager 13c, Oracle patching, role privileges, Recovery Manager, Real Application Clusters exposure, UNIX knowledge specifically Linux and AIX, excellent problem determination and resolution skills, excellent communication skills verbal and written.  

Responsibilities: Responds to and resolves helpdesk escalations, creates trending information on system issues, creates documentation and procedures, works on order requests based tasks, problem solves advanced technical incidents, analyzes and isolates issues, uses advanced diagnostic tools to troubleshoot issues, completes maintenance following Standard Operating Procedures, patching, health checks, update validation, and changes. Maintains operational configuration standards, researches options when anomalies occur, identifies recommendations, reviews with Senior staff, schedules maintenance changes to reduce operational risk, participates in project work with cross-functional teams, leads technical teams within projects, provides input to design efforts, coaches less Senior staff on processes and technology.  

Shift responsibilities: Scheduled to initiate and create documentation and procedures for maintenance tasks needing automation, improves Standard Operating Procedures for maintenance tasks, understands and adheres to company risk and regulatory standards, policies, and controls in accordance with company risk appetite, identifies risks related to issues needing escalation to management, promotes an environment that supports diversity and reflects M&T Bank brand, maintains M&T internal control standards including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with issues raised by external regulators as applicable, completes related duties as assigned.  

Required qualifications: Six years Oracle Database Administration experience, experience includes related education and work experience, ability to read and digest technical information, attention to detail, written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate technical information within team and immediate Manager, strong customer focus including ability to manage customer needs and multiple work priorities, demonstrated desire to improve current skills and learn new skills, knowledge and experience with Microsoft SQL and Oracle Database.  

Preferred qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in technology field or related field, seven years experience including related education and work experience, certification or special training related to technology, takes initiative, strong communication skills verbal and written, ability to use Microsoft Office products including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Encouraged candidates with relevant military experience to apply.  

M&T Bank strives to be the best place its employees ever work, the best bank its customers ever do business with, and the best investment its shareholders ever make. Looking to advance your career? Look to M&T Bank, a top twenty United States bank holding company and one of the best performing regional banks in the country. Offers a wide range of performance-based career development opportunities for talented professionals, a longstanding tradition of careful, conservative, and consistent management, and a strong commitment to the communities it serves. Continues to grow with a focus on the future.  

Primary location: New York, Amherst, John Glenn Drive  
Job field: Information Technology  
Schedule: Full-time  
Job posting: July 16, 2018, 9:44:59 AM  
Posting date: Ongoing

normalized_jd:
Summary Senior Database Administrator serves as a technical resource managing production Structured Query Language environment reporting data across various business areas. Responsible for leading database support and development, reporting status. Full-time location: 160 Elmgrove Road, Rochester, New York. Department: Information Technology. Schedule: Monday–Friday. Participates in a 7x24 on-call rotation.  

Attributes: Bachelor’s degree required. Three years of experience in Information Technology required. Experience with Microsoft Structured Query Language, Structured Query Language Server Reporting Services preferred. Experience with Business Intelligence reporting tools Qlik, Tableau, Power BI preferred. Experience in Agile environment and common scripting language PowerShell.  

Responsibilities: Database support and development, production support for large 7x24 Structured Query Language databases supporting multiple applications. Troubleshoot production Structured Query Language problems, partner within team to identify and address problems, perform performance monitoring related activities to ensure maximum availability and Service Level Agreement compliance. Manages scripting, database monitoring, automated tasks, data management tasks, Extract Transform Load processes, data warehousing, tuning Structured Query Language code, Structured Query Language queries, reporting. Create production-quality reporting and ad hoc reporting based on individual requests, obtaining business requirement input from end users. Project management: run moderately sized projects utilizing resources from parts of the organization, build requirements, develop project plans, implement tactics to meet project goals.  

Rochester Regional Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran.

normalized_jd:
Database Administrator II responsible for providing full system development life cycle database service for the company. Individual handles day-to-day database maintenance and support activity. Individual is responsible for working with the implementation team and business owner group to ensure database systems are implemented properly, compliant with applicable regulations, and maintained according to best practices. Database Administrator II is responsible for tracking and resolving database-related incidents and requests within Service Level Agreements, reviewing service-related reports, for example database backup maintenance and monitoring on a daily basis, to ensure service-related issues are identified and resolved within established Service Level Agreements.  

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following duties, which may be assigned: administers Microsoft SQL Database Server instances; administers Oracle Database Server instances; responsible for full Software Development Life Cycle database systems including specification, selection, implementation, validation, monitoring, tuning, optimizing, backup, and decommissioning; periodically audits databases to ensure compliance; assists developers with stored procedures, functions, and views; troubleshoots and resolves database issues; performs database health checks and optimization; performs backups, restores, and recovery model management; performs index management and statistics maintenance; maintains database firewall software; performs periodic database management including updates, patching, upgrades, tuning, optimization, and archiving; maintains and develops and implements policies and procedures ensuring security and integrity of databases; plans and conducts structured testing of database design to confirm functionality and performance; performs routine and customary operational monitoring activities to ensure the database environment is stable and capable of meeting ongoing business needs.  

Education and experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems or equivalent knowledge required. Equivalent knowledge may be obtained through current Microsoft and Oracle training and certification. Must have worked at least four years with SQL and Oracle databases, with a minimum of two years’ experience with Microsoft and Oracle database systems. Required experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Experience working with third-party database monitoring and security systems.  

Supervisory responsibility: None.  

Qualifications: Strong understanding of Microsoft SQL technology; experience in database administration for Microsoft SQL Server 2005 and higher; experience in database administration for Oracle 10 and higher preferred; good communication and documentation skills; previous experience troubleshooting SQL code; basic Microsoft .NET knowledge; Visual Basic .NET knowledge; high availability and disaster recovery options for Microsoft SQL Server.  

Computer skills: Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite; must be proficient in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio; must have basic knowledge of SQL Profiler; familiarity with SQL Server Database Engine Tuning Advisor preferred.  

Certificates, licenses, registrations: One of the following certifications preferred: Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist, Microsoft Certified Professional, Project Management Professional, Visual Professional.  

Skills and abilities: Experience implementing operational automation using scripting; performs duties independently in a highly dynamic, fast-paced business environment; demonstrates attention to detail; excellent written and verbal communication skills; exhibits superior customer service skills; excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required; ability to manage day-to-day operations as well as project work.  

Physical demands: Physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Position requires minimal travel, with average travel for the position being five to ten percent, with variation based upon demand and business imperatives.  

Work environment: Work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the job. Specific work demands must be met to perform the job successfully. Individual must be able to perform the essential duties satisfactorily. Requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

normalized_jd:
Responsible for integrity of donor database, including working closely with the Development and Fiscal Department to ensure the database runs smoothly and efficiently to support reaching department and team goals. Responsibility to maintain and manage day-to-day operation of Children's Aid constituent database Raiser’s Edge, enhancing accuracy, integrity, and security. Work closely with Development, Finance staff, department, and vendor to provide required data utilizing Raiser’s Edge query, export, and report, including advanced level Microsoft Excel. Recommend and maintain Raiser’s Edge database standards, develop institutional standard guide, and maintain database policy and procedure. Create reports, queries, and purge accurate data. Gather and analyze statistical data, generate reports to support and drive fundraising efforts. Train staff on necessary procedure changes. Develop and serve as driver for mailing pulls, review suppressed donors, creation of donor segmentation, and solicitation purposes. Continue implementation of methods to track fundraising progress internally compared to externally and divisional budget. Assist in reconciling donations and online fundraising streams. Provide expertise and technical support to end users for Raiser’s Edge issues. Identify, research, and resolve technical problems, work with outside vendor technical support as needed. Apply creative thinking and strategic planning to database processes and policy decisions.  

Qualifications: Three to five years of experience with Raiser’s Edge database, demonstrated ability in project management, ability to juggle multiple tasks, exercise sound judgment, prioritize work, strong attention to detail, respect for privacy and confidentiality. Skilled in Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook. Appreciation for serving in a team focused on achieving goals advancing the Children’s Aid mission. Strong interpersonal skills, customer service, patience, and outstanding organizational skills.  

Location: Manhattan  
Activation date: Thursday, August 9, 2018  
Expiration date: Friday, December 7, 2018

normalized_jd:
New York City Emergency Room seeking highly skilled hand Database Administrator with extensive experience on IBM DB2 LUW and Microsoft SQL Server. Database Administrator, part of Database Administration team, will work closely with other areas to ensure maximum data quality and availability. Responsibilities: Candidate must have extensive experience with DB2 LUW and Microsoft SQL Server, serve as Subject Matter Expert in software development best practices, data migration, conversion, data integrity, system integration, system performance tuning, and mentor development staff integrating new database technology into new and existing systems. Design and build data services, integrate with Enterprise Service Bus for data sharing. Need to develop, design, configure, and document database architecture including software, hardware, and physical layout. Perform best practice database troubleshooting, fix data corruption, perform backup and disaster recovery, perform daily Database Administration tasks, manage distributed databases, SQL Server Integration Services packages, SQL Server Reporting Services, participate in functional, performance, and security testing, assist developers and end users with implementation of best practices, handle special projects and initiatives as assigned.  

Minimum qualification requirements: Professional vendor certification. Education and experience requirements: On the last day of the application period, must have current professional vendor certification. In addition, on the last day of the application period, must have one of the following:  
1. Master’s degree in Computer Science or related computer field from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the United States Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), plus twelve months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized database administration and development experience including database administration, data modeling, database design, testing, technical writing, and version control.  
2. Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the United States Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA), plus twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized experience as described in item one.  
3. Four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or recognized accrediting organization, plus twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized experience as described in item one, plus forty-eight months of Information Technology experience as described in the task inventory.  
4. Satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to item three. Education may be substituted for Information Technology experience on the basis of thirty semester credits from an accredited college or university accredited by a regional, national, professional, or specialized agency recognized by the United States Secretary of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation (CHEA) being equivalent to twelve months of experience, to a maximum of forty-eight months. However, to qualify under options two, three, or four, must have at least a four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a state department of education or recognized accrediting organization, and at least twenty-four months of satisfactory full-time classroom-based specialized Information Technology experience as described in item one of the task inventory.  

Online, you may read the task inventory by clicking the task inventory button in the online notice of examination. Read the task inventory carefully to make sure your work experience meets the minimum qualification requirements.  

Preferred skills: Successful candidate will possess the following: Seven years of experience with DB2 Database Administration, with six years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server Database Administration. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to discuss technical and functional data security and managerial information clearly and concisely to ensure both technical and non-technical parties understand. Must be familiar with SQL data, JavaScript Object Notation, and Extensible Markup Language. Experience with database security auditing, experience monitoring multiple databases, advanced knowledge of database performance management and tuning, experience performing database migration, experience analyzing current database performance and making projections for future growth in Central Processing Unit usage as well as storage growth.  

To apply, please click the apply button to submit resume and cover letter, and indicate agency tracking number 9185.  

Residency requirement: New York City residency required for this position.

normalized_jd: National Subrogation Service is seeking a Document Management Administrator for the Long Island office. The ideal candidate is a self-starter able to manage multiple priorities with excellent technical, organizational, and communication skills. Responsibilities include expert database management. Primary job functions include accessing and moving documents electronically within client claim databases and captive systems, phone and email communication with clients, and basic clerical and administrative duties as assigned. Qualifications: one to two years of office clerical experience required; insurance experience preferred; experience with document control software ImageRight and insurance content management; use of scanner imaging preferred; ability to work in a detail-oriented environment; must be proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat; strong analytical and communication skills, initiative, thoroughness, and accuracy in all areas; must be proactive, work well as part of a team, operate well under pressure, and work well in a fast-paced environment; customer service-oriented professional demeanor required; courteous communication with vendors, clients, and staff in all areas. Cozen O’Connor is an equal opportunity employer including disabled veterans.

normalized_jd: Exciting work environment position based at Delaware North’s new global headquarters, a state-of-the-art twelve-story mixed-use building in downtown Buffalo, New York. Headquarters facility reflective of value integrates latest advances in environmental energy conservation and office design. Opportunity to perform normal database administration tasks, monitor performance, maintain databases, implement upgrades as needed, keeping current with changes in vendor security platform releases. Administer collection of two hundred fifty servers and six hundred point-of-sale workstations running Microsoft SQL Server housed on physical servers on-premise and virtual appliances in Amazon Web Services cloud. Install and configure new database servers including Microsoft SQL Server on Amazon Web Services Relational Database Service. Manage production environment to ensure high availability, good performance, and sufficient capacity. Perform system support and maintenance functions. Develop and maintain standard documentation of system configuration. Support and maintain database schema, query logic, and report definitions for various in-house developed focused applications. Manage vendor relationships, work closely with vendors to complete projects and resolve problems. Ensure database servers are backed up in a way that meets business Recovery Point Objective. Test backups to ensure they meet business Recovery Time Objective. Provide direction and guidance to design, integrate, and implement systems supporting company system initiatives. Ability to participate in business meetings, collate asset budget raw data, make annual budget recommendations, and present to business leadership. Participate in preparation efforts and implementation of annual Payment Card Industry audit. Investigate and remediate reports of sensitive data stored unencrypted in databases or throughout the computer file system. Document, maintain, and provide strategic changes to company database standards and best practices. Document company database environment. Identify and design new database architectures for new systems brought in-house. Install and harden database environments to meet project application industry standard specifications. Provide on-call twenty-four-seven support for databases including after-hours and weekend cursory troubleshooting and resolving database performance issues ranging from indexing issues, system misconfiguration, and application coding issues. Work with application vendors to configure SQL Server monitoring utilities to minimize false alarms. Oversee junior resources as needed. Requires three to five years of experience with Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Amazon Web Services Relational Database Service, Amazon Redshift, Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud, and Amazon Simple Storage Service, VMware, PowerShell, Python scripting language, automation development, and Development Operations experience. Take your career beyond ordinary to extraordinary at Delaware North. You will love where you work as each workday unfolds, whether at a sporting venue, casino, airport, national park, iconic hotel, or premier restaurant. There is no telling where your career will ultimately take you. Empower great work at a company with one hundred years of success, stability, and growth. Drive and enjoy the thrill of making things happen. Share our vision and grow with us. Delaware North is one of the largest and most admired privately held hospitality companies in the world. Founded and owned by the Jacobs family for nearly one hundred years, Delaware North is a global leader in hospitality and food service operations at sports venues, travel hospitality, restaurants, catering, parks, resorts, gaming, and specialty retail industries. Delaware North has annual revenue exceeding three billion dollars and sixty thousand employee associates. Learn more by visiting us. Applicants are subject to pre-employment background checks and may be subject to pre-employment drug tests depending upon position and client requirements. Delaware North Companies Incorporated and its subsidiaries consider applicants for positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any legally protected status. Delaware North is an equal opportunity employer.

normalized_jd:
Position summary: Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator role largely responsible for providing operational database service to the organization. Primary responsibility of the role would include owning, tracking, and resolving database-related incidents and requests, fulfilling requests, resolving incidents within Service Level Agreements, reviewing service-related reports, i.e., database backup, maintenance, and monitoring on a daily basis to ensure service-related issues are identified and resolved within established Service Level Agreements, responding to database-related alerts and escalations, and working with database engineering to come up with strategic solutions to recurring problems.  

Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator role requires a service-oriented mentality, a high sense of ownership of problems and requests assigned, focus on managing and resolving issues in alignment with Service Level Agreements, establishing and maintaining communication with technology customers to keep them updated on the status of requests, initiating and performing changes to production systems, proactively escalating issues not resolved within the established time frame.  

Position requirements: Looking for a candidate with eight years of experience in database administration in a Microsoft SQL Server environment, two to five years of experience troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, and security issues. Experience in performance tuning and optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools such as Performance Monitor and SQL Profiler. Ability to monitor and troubleshoot SQL Server-related CPU, memory, I/O, disk space, and resource contention. Strong knowledge of backups, restores, recovery models, database shrink operations, Database Console Commands, clustering, database mirroring, and replication. Knowledge of High Availability and Disaster Recovery options for Microsoft SQL Server. Experience in implementing operational automation using scripts. Strong knowledge of indexes, index management, integrity checks, configuration, patching, and statistics. Work with indexes and stored procedures created and managed effectively.  

Experience working with Windows Server including Active Directory and proper disk configuration. Good communication and documentation skills. Preferred candidate possesses the following skills: experience in SQL development, ability to write, troubleshoot, and optimize SQL code, design experience is a plus, knowledge of cloud server configuration, knowledge of third-party database administrator tools and applications, certifications are a plus (Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist, Microsoft Certified IT Professional, Microsoft Most Valuable Professional).  

What is in it: Competitive base salary, excellent benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), vacation, paid sick time, flexible schedule, and many great perks. Qualified candidates should apply right away for immediate consideration. Candidate must be available for in-person interviews. Medium Service is an equal opportunity employer and will consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal history in accordance with the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. Medium Service will relocate and sponsor visas.

normalized_jd:
Job summary: Experienced Database Administrator to assist in the maintenance and improvement of the current database infrastructure, also handling interaction with multiple outside data sources. Responsible for database performance tuning, security, developing high availability solutions, replication solution strategy. The Database Administrator will work closely with the Basketball Analytics Department and members of the Basketball Operations staff. Principal duties, responsibilities, and essential functions: Monitor databases, optimize database performance and resource use, physically implement databases, address a variety of database integration issues including migration, disparate database integration, maintenance, conversion, capacity planning issues, and new application processes. Maintain data feeds from various sources via Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interface, Extensible Markup Language, JavaScript Object Notation. Load National Basketball Association, National Collegiate Athletic Association, G League data. Maintain availability and integrity of databases with multiple access schemes, facilitate sharing of common data, handle proper key and index management, maintain data dictionary. Lead development and documentation of database features, change management software. Regularly meet stakeholders to review data integrity. Monitor and run database backups, logs, journals. Install, maintain, and upgrade database software. Restore and recover data as required. Create, procure, and maintain various database-related documents, manuals, programmer handbooks. Support Basketball Operations tasks as required.  

Required skills, experience, and abilities: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Programming, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Computer Engineering. Experience with Structured Query Language Server 2012. Must have experience with Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interfaces, data warehousing, processing large JavaScript Object Notation and Extensible Markup Language files. Experience with varied programming and scripting languages: Python, C, Java, Ruby, R. Experience in performance tuning and optimization. Experience with cloud-based Structured Query Language library management software documentation. Knowledge of basketball data and basketball statistics. Experience working with high availability database systems.  

Preferred skills, experience, and abilities: Experience with cloud-hosted servers, e.g., Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services. Front-end development experience is a plus. Required experience with Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services, cloud Application Programming Interfaces, Office 365, Power BI, Power Apps, SharePoint, OneDrive, Office Graph.  

Equal Opportunity Statement: The Los Angeles Clippers are an equal opportunity employer. The Clippers desire and intend that employees enjoy a professional business working environment free from discrimination and harassment.

normalized_jd: Lead completes task independently with attention to detail under pressure, works in a team collaborative environment, demonstrates excellent judgment, problem resolution, negotiation, and decision-making skills, as well as the ability to work under continual deadline pressure. Identifies, analyzes, and drives problem resolution, handling complex issues simultaneously, effectively communicating across the team, and effectively communicating technical actions and expectations to the appropriate audience. Delivers customer service excellence by identifying appropriate technical solutions and meeting or exceeding service expectations. Possesses knowledge in two relevant areas including, but not limited to, cloud computing, internet security, hardware systems, networking systems, storage technologies, data warehousing, business intelligence, data center facilities, and e-commerce platforms. Desired and required strong experience with Amazon Web Services Relational Database Service MySQL, Amazon Aurora, MariaDB, Amazon Web Services Elastic Compute Cloud MySQL Galera, Proxy Structured Query Language, PostgreSQL, solid Shell, Bash, and PowerShell scripting experience, Python, and Ruby. Plus multiple years of experience with MySQL. Familiarity with five to six required experiences using Amazon Web Services Elastic Compute Cloud, Amazon Web Services Relational Database Service Aurora, Amazon Web Services Database Migration Service. Must have knowledge of different replication and clustering strategies, experience setting replication between two hosts across regions and data centers, architecting and implementing security compliance across data platforms, Payment Card Industry, and Personally Identifiable Information. Experience setting highly available solutions, load balancing, connection pooling, query partitioning, and performance tuning skills. Understanding Structured Query Language execution plans, ability to proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve live database system issues. Experience automating tasks, deployment, and patching. Experience monitoring database system performance using enterprise monitoring tools such as Amazon CloudWatch, Datadog, and New Relic. Strategies for performant, non-impactful backup and restore of high-volume live site databases. Structured Query Language development experience with stored procedures, functions, and extensions. Online Analytical Processing data load. Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field preferred, or corresponding number of years of experience in technical operations or software engineering. Four years of experience in relational database management systems focused on Microsoft Structured Query Language Server, Always On, Amazon Web Services services. Two to four years of experience in configuration, troubleshooting, performance tuning, and security procedures. Experience with Linux. Two years of operational experience supporting medium e-commerce, gaming, or online business in a 24x7 production environment. Expertise in relational database administration including configuration, implementation, data modeling, maintenance, redundancy, high availability, security, troubleshooting, performance tuning, upgrading databases, data server migration, Structured Query Language expertise, configuring, implementing, and supporting high availability and redundancy strategies, systems including replication, clustering, log shipping, and mirroring. Expertise in relational database design, architectural principles, and methodologies. Expertise in disaster recovery planning and implementation. Demonstrated experience troubleshooting system issues and effectively diagnosing problems. Excellent knowledge of hardware, enterprise cloud storage, Redundant Array of Independent Disks disk subsystem technology pertaining to database management systems. Familiarity with Storage Area Network technology desired. Excellent system documentation and diagramming skills. Experience with project management methodology and handling complex projects. Experience with relevant scripting languages and programming frameworks desired: JavaScript, Python, Perl, C, PowerShell, .NET. Plus knowledge and understanding of Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol fundamentals, Domain Name System, File Transfer Protocol, Secure Shell, general networking technology, Amazon Web Services Virtual Private Cloud stack, network architecture, and connectivity troubleshooting. Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related field preferred, or corresponding number of years of experience in technical operations or software engineering. Disney storyteller making the impossible possible by utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology, pushing the envelope to bring stories to life in movies, products, interactive games, parks, resorts, and media networks. Chance to join a talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world. Senior Database Administrator position works in the central team of database engineers and administrators supporting database management systems, data transformation services, development teams, and customers. Primary focus is to support relational database management systems for customer internet sites and applications. Key responsibilities include cloud Amazon Web Services data migration, upgrade, installation, optimization, tuning, scripting, programming, data load, extract-transform-load automation, security management, encryption, backup, recovery, issue troubleshooting, advanced replication implementation, disaster recovery, high availability design, and additional tasks as assigned. Ideal candidate possesses excellent technical expertise in relevant state-of-the-art relational database system technology design. Four years of experience focused on MySQL Galera, Amazon Web Services Relational Database Service Aurora, PostgreSQL relational database management systems. Experience with Microsoft Structured Query Language Server is a plus. 580,751
