normalized_jd:
Children’s Institute Incorporated Children’s Institute is looking for a dedicated Database Coordinator to join our outstanding team. The Database Coordinator ensures the Early Childhood Education database system is kept up to date to meet the needs and goals of the program, configures and maintains the database, performs quality assurance checks on database entries, manages staff training on the database system for Early Childhood Education, and provides database technical support services to Early Childhood Education staff.  

Responsible for planning, direction, organization, and execution of information technology functions, Children’s Institute is a compassionate, innovative leader in the field of trauma-focused treatment, youth development, early childhood, and family support services. Twenty-four hours a day, zero child and family in Los Angeles underserved communities benefit from Children’s Institute’s commitment to developing and maintaining an investigative learning approach to work. Children’s Institute strengthens across many disciplines and program structures in order to positively affect the lives of children and families in Los Angeles.  

Responsibilities:  
1. Maintains the integrity of the Early Childhood Education database system, including but not limited to ChildPlus, Learning Genie, DRDP Tech. Ensures support for program needs and goals listed.  
   a. Performs regular audits and conducts weekly quality assurance of the database.  
   b. Manages creation, implementation, and review of database policies and procedures.  
   c. Manager link for ChildPlus, Learning Genie, DRDP Tech. Utilizes knowledge of system platforms to monitor proper performance.  
   d. Adds new users and provides appropriate access to users.  
2. Completes rollover uploads at appropriate times in order to ensure the database is ready for the following program year.  
3. Ensures program reporting requirements are met: DRDP Tech uploads, Learning Genie uploads, PIR ChildPlus rollover.  

Position requires three years of database management experience. High school diploma or General Education Degree required.  

We offer competitive salary, opportunity for advancement, access to continuous training and development, free medical, dental, vision HMO, life insurance, tuition reimbursement, 403(b), generous paid time off, company-sponsored team building events, and always something on the horizon (e.g., Spartan Race, team bowling, Fit Club).  

Children’s Institute Incorporated shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender expression, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, or any other protected activity or operation.

normalized_jd: Fab Fit Fun seeking Database Administrator to optimize, manage, and design the database persistence layer in a newly created role as a technical thought leader. Questions like stored procedure versus use of Amazon DynamoDB versus Amazon Aurora. Database Administrator to optimize, tune, and refactor the data persistence layer operating at high scale and availability. Work closely with the engineering pod to direct data model design. Collaborate with Development Operations to provide database tuning and provide thought leadership on topics like stored procedure versus Structured Query Language code as appropriate. Work closely with the data team to ensure appropriate Extract, Transform, Load solutions are in place. Provide guidance on appropriate storage solutions given needs, i.e., use of key-value store versus relational database. Bring Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent focus, eight years of relevant work experience, expert Structured Query Language experience with Amazon Aurora, PostgreSQL, and MySQL, strong understanding of Amazon Web Services hosted data architecture and tooling. Get amazing benefits including medical, dental, vision, Flexible Spending Account and 401(k), unlimited paid time off, catered meals, kitchen stocked with great snacks and drinks, free Fab Fit Fun subscription, and quarterly credit for add-ons store.

normalized_jd:
SpaceX founded on the belief in the future of humanity exploring the stars is fundamentally exciting. Today SpaceX is actively developing technology to make possible the ultimate goal of enabling human life on Mars.  

Database Administrator, Enterprise Data Architecture team, responsible for designing and developing enterprise database architecture, data warehouse, and reports, part of a larger group called Enterprise Information System. Writes software to build rockets that power SpaceX, responsible for software for the factory floor, warehouse, financial systems, restaurants, and even the public homepage. Elon called us the nervous system of SpaceX, connecting teams at SpaceX to ensure the entire rocket building process runs smoothly.  

The successful candidate will be responsible for enterprise integration and report development, starting with gathering business requirements, development, testing, and deployment. The successful candidate must also have the ability to effectively communicate with business and technical resources. Responsibilities include developing code to automate tasks in Structured Query Language, PowerShell, SQL Server Integration Services, setting up database monitoring, developing stored procedures, optimizing queries via Transact-SQL, developing detailed test conditions and test cases to ensure quality queries and reports, researching and troubleshooting data questions, and collaborating on problem resolution, team decisions, and project planning.  

Basic requirements:  
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering  
- Three years of experience monitoring and tuning databases to provide high availability services  
- Three years of experience managing internal and external Microsoft SQL Server database security  
- Three years of experience fine-tuning SQL queries and data replication  

Preferred skills and experience:  
- Experience with SQL Server Always On Availability Groups, replication, log shipping, and mirroring  
- High degree of accuracy and attention to detail  
- Excellent oral and written communication skills  
- Strong interpersonal skills  
- Ability to meet deadlines  
- Strong knowledge of manufacturing business processes  
- Experience working with Enterprise Resource Planning systems  
- Experience with Team Foundation Server  
- Big data experience  

ITAR requirement: To conform to United States Government space technology export regulations, applicants must be United States citizens, lawful permanent residents of the United States, or protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorization from the United States Department of State.  

Learn more at SpaceX.  

Equal Opportunity Employer: Employment at SpaceX is governed on the basis of merit, competence, and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status. Applicants wishing to view a copy of SpaceX’s Affirmative Action Plan for veterans and individuals with disabilities, or applicants requiring reasonable accommodation in the application or interview process, should notify the Human Resources Department at (310) 363-6000.

normalized_jd:
Coordinator Database Foundation Raiser Edgelon004223 Description Database Administrator responsible for comprehensive database support and analysis for the annual fund, major planned gift, marketing communication, event, Memorial Medical Center Foundation. Memorial Medical Center Foundation Database Administrator is part of a high-performing team working together to implement a comprehensive development program identifying, cultivating, soliciting, and stewarding annual and major planned gift donor prospects, restricted and unrestricted, in support of the Memorial Medical Center Foundation mission.  

Essential Job Outcome Function:  
Database management: coordinate all aspects of the database including posting and acknowledging gifts, updating records, updating actions, generating reports, analyzing data, working with the database vendor, implementing import and export projects, coordinating data cleansing projects, controlling code table maintenance including managing appeal, fund, and campaign system coding.  

Data support: provide support related to donor lists, reports, events, annual giving, direct mail projects, major gift, planned giving prospects. Develop and review data management and data processing systems to promote and support donor prospect strategy goals, including timely movement tracking in the donor prospect pipeline, evaluation, and cultivation steps. Perform prospect research requests and documentation. Assist foundation staff in identifying data to capture and record in Raiser’s Edge. Assist the Director of Annual Giving in determining the best structure, creating, testing, and implementing standard queries for Raiser’s Edge users to run at their discretion, as well as queries to ensure the integrity of the database in a timely and efficient manner.  

Develop Microsoft Excel spreadsheet tools to manipulate data when Raiser’s Edge tools are insufficient. Interact with necessary departments and divisions, particularly Finance and Hospital programs, to analyze and gather report requirements, generating criteria and output. Liaise with database users to recommend and assist in the implementation of new and improved processes.  

General Development Support: provide vision and support for information deployment and technical enhancements to the foundation infrastructure, fundraising activities, and initiatives. Provide general support to fundraising staff. Keep abreast of fundraising database field developments through appropriate listservs, blogs, websites, publications, webinars, conferences, and seminars. Share with development staff. Perform duties as assigned.  

Qualifications:  
Work Experience: two to three years of experience working in nonprofit development. Proficiency using donor databases, preferably Raiser’s Edge NXT. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Understanding of development fundamentals; healthcare fundraising experience is a plus. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to explain highly technical concepts and processes clearly to team members. High attention to detail and data entry accuracy. Ability to meet deadlines. Ability to manage multiple complex tasks and projects simultaneously while maintaining composure under pressure. Strong organizational, writing, and analytical skills. Ability to develop complex analytical documents, graphs, and dashboards. Strong individual work ethic as well as being a team player.  

Education, Licensure, Certification: Bachelor’s degree preferred. Certification or advanced training in database management desired.

normalized_jd:
Member Development Service Team Application Database Administrator IIDB II responsible for developing and maintaining Structured Query Language based database solutions. Responsibilities include installing and upgrading Structured Query Language Server, monitoring database server health, tuning for optimal performance, ensuring proper use of storage space, meeting patching requirements, ensuring backup and recovery, and managing database security. Works with developer team members to assist in overall database design, tuning queries, assigning proper indexes, reviewing execution plans, creating triggers and stored procedures, including best practice recommendations applicable to team members. Provides a high degree of coordination with bank colleagues, technical staff, and application team to ensure effective database management and product availability. Operates with substantial latitude for independent action and requires an individual capable of decision making and establishing and enforcing Structured Query Language best practice standards relating to database management. Performs related duties and projects as business needs require under the direction of management.  

Basic qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience, minimum three years Structured Query Language Database Administrator experience. Skills and knowledge: three years Structured Query Language Database Administrator experience required, strong Transact Structured Query Language development skills, experience with Structured Query Language Server high availability options including Always On Availability Groups, database mirroring, log shipping, and replication. Experience with Microsoft Structured Query Language Server 2012, 2014, 2016, and 2017. Understanding of database requirements for Microsoft BizTalk plus good understanding of Microsoft Windows operating system, Windows failover clustering, and general understanding of network architecture. Experience with Oracle Database Structured Query Language plus experience with UNIX/Linux operating systems is a plus. Excellent organizational, analytical, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to establish and maintain a high level of colleague trust and confidence, group knowledge, and concern for colleagues’ business needs.  

Represents basic qualifications for the position. To be considered, the position must at least meet basic qualifications. City National Bank is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer: minority, female, individual with disability, veteran. Note: the preceding job description is designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. Note: candidates are advised that City National Bank does not pay interviewee travel expenses or relocation expenses unless previously agreed. Equal opportunity employer: minority, woman, protected veteran, disabled.

normalized_jd:
Database Administrator design, create, manage, and tune production database servers, participate in database-related initiatives in alignment with core values. The ideal candidate is able to apply experience and knowledge of Microsoft SQL databases, industry-standard best practices, as part of the enterprise infrastructure team. The team is responsible for enterprise application infrastructure in the primary data center, supporting numerous business offices and facilities located throughout the country. The successful ideal candidate is able to utilize experience with common industry tools to manage, maintain, and enhance enterprise operations, as well as identify opportunities to bring new skills and methods to the team, address issues as they arise, and contribute to plans and policies for production management.  

Critical large enterprise database design includes creating and maintaining automated processes using Microsoft SQL Server, gathering and presenting data methodically, analyzing data changes in the environment critically, determining weaknesses and errors in processes, and showing competency in troubleshooting with the ability to consult and communicate effectively with internal customers, vendors, and enterprise infrastructure teammates. The candidate must be adaptable to new tools and processes, share learned tools and processes with teammates, and have a desire to learn and share essential skills.  

Qualifications: Seven to ten years of contiguous recent Microsoft SQL Server Database Administrator experience, having worked in medium to large-sized enterprises as an operational Database Administrator as part of a non-call rotation. After-hours and weekend work is required. Experience installing, configuring, managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting SQL Server 2008, SQL Server 2012, SQL Server 2014, and SQL Server 2016. Experience in performance tuning, index tuning, Very Large Database experience, data warehouse, SQL Server Integration Services, cube, and report server. Proven experience with backups and restores, participation in disaster recovery drills, familiarity with trend and capacity planning tools and processes.  

Knowledge of scripting languages including Transact-SQL, VBScript required; PowerShell is a plus. Knowledge of high availability technology and disaster recovery including Always On, mirroring, log shipping, database partitioning, replication, and clustering. Demonstrated experience developing and implementing SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Server Analysis Services, and SQL Server Agent is a plus. Strong communication and customer service skills, both written and verbal. Solid understanding of network storage, tiered application environments, and security. Healthcare experience and experience with Sarbanes-Oxley and Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act regulations are a plus.  

Proficiency in technical documentation creation and knowledge base article writing. Experience with data center migration is a plus. Demonstrated initiative and ability to implement change effectively. Ability to use corporate work ticketing systems, for example, ServiceNow. Must be able to work in a support team environment as well as work independently. Attention to detail, ability to multitask in a fast-paced, fluid environment. Good team player and leader, flexible, willing to share knowledge, help others, and collaborate well within and outside the team.

normalized_jd:
Verifies content database is consistent among different system Database Administrators, provides expert knowledge required to ensure database integrity and database replication, main lead troubleshooting problems and inconsistencies causing system errors, provides twenty-four-seven, three hundred sixty-five immediate call support with System Operations Manager site, performs database operation and maintenance activity, monitors database daily to ensure database is performing properly and available with System Operations Manager network customer, monitors database space, Central Processing Unit resource allocation, reallocates resources to meet government-specified resource criterion, monitors and evaluates database software problems, determines cause, coordinates problem identification and resolution with personnel identified in Performance Work Statement, writes, modifies, and executes shell scripts and Structured Query Language scripts, performs routine and special system procedures, supports developers, Relational Database Management System related or similar tool problems, maintains data files, documents procedures involved in performing previously mentioned tasks.  

Requirements: Required skill types of databases include but are not limited to Oracle, Conference Data System, Language CODASYL, Microsoft Structured Query Language. Knowledge of software baseline management includes planning, identification, Command status accounting, verification, audit, creation, and release of software builds associated with configuration documentation. Leads Configuration Control Board review and disposition of software changes, automates, maintains, and executes processes and procedures to support routine administrative tasks, assists in capacity planning and performance management of supported service technology, develops and maintains appropriate control documentation ensuring compliance with regulatory audit requirements, develops, maintains, and executes processes and procedures to ensure ongoing disaster recovery readiness. Active Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmented Information preferred.  

Skills: Ability to obtain and maintain program access required.  

Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics discipline from an accredited university and six years of experience, or Master’s degree with a minimum of four years of relevant experience. In case applicant has no degree, an additional two to two years of experience is required.  

Preferred experience: Experience providing database administration on one Western System Operations Center.

Wilshire Associates Incorporated, a global investment advisory firm, offers customized institutionally based solutions to meet the investment needs of clients. Wilshire Fund Management, the Wilshire Associates Incorporated division, is dedicated to providing customized investment solutions in the areas of asset allocation, manager research, portfolio construction, and risk management.  

Seeking to identify a Senior Database Developer to join the Operations Technology team. The successful candidate will be responsible for analysis, design, and developing complex systems and applications for portfolio management processes. The individual will be involved in all aspects of the project lifecycle, including design, programming, testing, implementation, maintenance, and documentation, and will provide support for business systems, developing, maintaining, and enhancing existing web client-based applications, reengineering programs to conform to system changes, and solving complex customer and third-party data issues.  

Key responsibilities:  
- Database installation and upgrading  
- Database management, tuning, and monitoring performance  
- Database optimization  
- Database backup, recovery, and restoration processes  
- Implementation and administration of user database permissions  
- Creation of technical documentation  

Desired skills and background:  
- Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science  
- Zero to three years of programming experience  
- Experience with Transact-SQL and Microsoft SQL Server  
- Knowledge of SQL Server 2008, 2014, and 2017  
- Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Reporting Services, and SQL Server Integration Services  
- Experience implementing, maintaining, tuning, and deploying in development and production environments  
- Experience creating tables, views, stored procedures, and functions  
- Understanding of database system concepts, security principles, and practices  
- Database Administration principles and practices  
- Research methodology and data analysis  
- Extract, Transform, Load and data analysis experience  

We offer an international, dynamic, entrepreneurial work environment and a competitive compensation package, including bonus opportunities, three weeks of vacation, eight paid holidays per year, 401(k) and Roth 401(k), medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.  

Visit for additional company information. Wilshire Associates Incorporated is an equal opportunity employer: minority, female, disability, veteran. Wilshire Associates Incorporated is a Securities and Exchange Commission registered investment adviser and is required to track certain political contributions under Rule 206(4)-5 and may be required to disclose prior political contributions.  

No phone calls.  

Required skills and required experience.

normalized_jd:
Job requirement: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer, Telecommunication, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent. At least one year of working experience in a related field is required for the position, preferably staff, non-management, non-supervisor, specialized in Computer Software, Financial Service, Banking, or equivalent. Working with Linux and Windows-based infrastructure, good teamwork and communication skills, understanding programming languages Python, Shell, PHP, Java, experience supporting containerized workloads Docker, Kubernetes, working knowledge of various tools, open-source technology, cloud services Alibaba Cloud, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, awareness of critical concepts DevOps, Agile principles, ability to define scalable Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment pipelines, strong problem-solving and analytical skills, proficiency in cross-platform scripting languages and build tools Python, Groovy, sound knowledge of administrative best practices for application servers, database servers, third-party appliances, experience with automated testing solutions including unit testing, integration testing, system testing, expertise in Security Information and Event Management applications, performance monitoring and alerting systems, strong knowledge of high availability systems, cloud security principles and best practices, expertise in DevOps tools Jenkins, Git, expertise in monitoring tools Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Kibana, experience with transactional databases MySQL, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server configured for high availability and redundancy, experience with web-based Application Programming Interfaces and Representational State Transfer services, experience with configuration management using Ansible, ability to multitask, work well under pressure, prioritize work with competing deadlines and changing business priorities.  

Job description: Implementing cloud Alibaba Cloud and also cloud servers from other providers, configuring and maintaining infrastructure defined as code, experimenting, analyzing, implementing security, performance, and availability, handling issues, experienced in Elasticsearch, database engines MySQL, PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, managing and troubleshooting systems based on Linux and Windows, approaching risk management, clustering, load balancing, failover, building strong relationships with the development team, understanding code dependencies and infrastructure, running builds, maintaining systems, monitoring all aspects of application infrastructure, assisting the development team with deployment strategy and capacity planning across development, Quality Assurance, staging, and production environments, responsible for providing technology assessment, supporting automation, migrating to cloud, building and maintaining operational tools for deployment, monitoring, and analysis of application infrastructure systems, responsible for developing, driving improvement, and maintaining monitoring for production and non-production systems, ensuring platforms perform with maximum efficiency and security, automating business continuity and disaster recovery.

normalized_jd:
Looking for an experienced Microsoft Windows application desktop developer to be part of the team coding high quality software using distributed computing, messaging, microservice, performance tuning, and memory resource management techniques. Developing data-driven solutions for a range of clients, both frontend as well as backend, collaborating within a cross-functional international Agile team, testing, debugging, retesting, coordinating Quality Assurance, and validating software ready for shipping. Reviewing code and acting as a subject matter expert for junior team members.  

Already have two years of experience as a .NET developer with a minimum diploma or degree in a relevant field. Excellent knowledge of either C#, Visual Basic .NET, or C++ with experience in desktop application technology such as Windows Forms, Windows Presentation Foundation, Service-Oriented Architecture using Windows Communication Foundation, Entity Framework, Hibernate, Relational Database Management Systems, SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, and SQL Server. Well-versed in best practices of Object-Oriented Programming.  

Nice to have working experience developing applications using the .NET platform on Windows, working experience with SQL databases, MongoDB, practical design patterns, and data-driven design. Comfortable using Git or Team Foundation Server in a Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment environment. Self-organized and able to work unsupervised.  

Candidates with experience aligned to the criteria are encouraged to send a resume along with a work sample link or online portfolio. Resumes submitted without access to a work sample will not be considered. The team will review resumes and work samples, and qualified candidates will be sent an invite to test for the position. Make sure your phone number is always active during working days for contact via email.

normalized_jd:
Global player SEW Eurodrive drives the world, constantly developing pioneer technology, individually tailored solutions, drive automation technology, technical advice, and service included.  

Job purpose: Responsible for the full set of accounts complying with Indonesia Accounting Standards, International Financial Reporting Standards, tax statutory compliance, internal and external reporting. Assist in setting up the accounting function, internal control, and accounting system for a new entity.  

Key responsibilities: Recruit, train, and develop suitable candidates for the new accounts team. Manage month-end closing including daily General Ledger operations, reviewing corporate tax, developing and presenting cash flow, budget, forecast, insurance management, and analysis. Manage analytical reporting requirements, group management, intercompany recharges mechanism, ensuring compliance with transfer pricing policy. Assume overall responsibility for ensuring Indonesia entity statutory tax compliance, statistical filing, and audit. Manage audit and tax requirements.  

Requirements: Hands-on company setup, honesty, self-motivation, degree holder in Accounting or Finance, qualified Certified Public Accountant, Association of Chartered Certified Accountants, or equivalent. Minimum three to five years of relevant experience, multinational company manufacturing industry preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, working experience with SAP an advantage. Strong knowledge of Indonesian direct and indirect tax regulations, financial reporting standards, International Financial Reporting Standards a must. Fluent in written and spoken English language. Preferably with professional accountant certification.

Job requirement: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor degree in Accounting or Finance from a reputable university. At least one year of working experience in a related field is required for the position. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply. Good knowledge of financial reporting and fluency in English.  

Job responsibility: Review various financial activities related to the business unit. Update common foreign currency data. Perform cash stocktaking. Assist in making financial reports in the General Ledger program. Perform bank reconciliation. Set up the schedule for financial statements and monthly closing periods related to the business unit. Take note of revenue, accounts receivable, and accounts payable.

Cash flow management ensures availability of funds for operational activity and investment planning. Creating weekly and monthly cash flow reports. Directly responsible for the company cash basis profit and loss, capital expenditure report, net cash position, and insurance. Creating financial planning, financial projection, and financing analysis for the Board of Directors. Preparing and presenting periodic financial reports, activity reports, financial report consolidation reports, and analysis. Creating cash flow financial report projections for the following year considering aspects of company business targets and government policy related to the economy. Creating bank guarantees, asset guarantees, and loans. Evaluating, updating, and coordinating implementation of financial procedures. Creating periodic annual budget reports. Searching for potential sources of financing from external parties, funding, and investment together with related departments. Preparing return on investment analysis related to company business expansion. Conducting feasibility studies for ongoing projects. Coordinating payment from customers according to schedule. Maintaining good relationships with financial institutions, banks, insurance companies, and investment institutions. 

Qualifications: Minimum education Associate Degree or Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Banking, or equivalent. Minimum three years of experience in a position of responsibility. Strong analytical skills, leadership skills, creativity, ability to work under pressure, good time management, and willingness to work. Kara Wang.

normalized_jd:
Minimum education Bachelor majoring in Law, Management, or Psychology. Must have a minimum of five years of work experience in the position. Good communication and leadership skills. Speak good and correct Indonesian and English is an added value. Understand manpower regulation and ministerial decree. Adapt well, high integrity, honesty, discipline, and responsibility.  

Job description: Develop Key Performance Indicators, Operational Reward and Punishment Program to support performance, cooperation, and work discipline. Plan, monitor, and implement industrial relation activity to create harmony in work relations internally and externally. Plan action checking, Plan-Do-Act-Check monitoring, Human Resources and General Affairs activity in accordance with applicable government regulation. Determine and achieve quality targets. Support talent management and employees. Ensure work related to Human Resources and General Affairs runs well. Actively prepare new concepts regarding Human Resources and General Affairs work system and procedure. Carry out ad hoc task responsibility.  

Placement: Pluit, North Jakarta.

normalized_jd: Looking for opportunity in Human Resources department, would like to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment. Interesting offer, main tasks include processing and monitoring salary structure and benefits, maintaining and distributing personnel record systems, ensuring payroll transactions are processed efficiently, collecting, calculating, and entering data in order to maintain and update payroll information, maintaining and updating employee attendance, maintaining and archiving Human Resources documents and personal employee documents, assisting recruitment activity. Qualification requirements: maximum thirty-two years old candidate must possess at least a Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Psychology, or equivalent. Required skills: PPh Twenty-One, salary structure, BPJS Health, BPJS Employment, Employment Creation Law. At least three years working experience in related field required for position. Comprehensive knowledge of a wide range of compensation: base pay, long-term incentive program, annual incentive program, sales compensation program, reward and recognition program, budget planning, experience handling and maintaining Human Resources Information System program, strong communication skills, proficient in Google Workspace, digital literacy, willing to work in South Jakarta. normalized_jd:
Looking for someone with experience working across many spectrums of the Human Resources field and projects, wanting an opportunity to lead a growing team. Retired from a mundane cubicle job, wanting to join a friendly, passionate team with limitless potential. We would love to meet.  

Specific requirements for the role:  
To date, projects are designed to accelerate performance achievement within the organization. Here, coordinate stages of the hiring process including posting job openings, reviewing and screening applications, conducting interviews, onboarding new employees, developing recruiting strategies to hit headcount goals, maintaining a robust pipeline of qualified candidates, designing and implementing training and development programs, arranging training sessions for new hires, refresher workshops for existing employees, delivering performance management communication strategies aimed at creating awareness, managing filtration, development, and evaluation of talented potential staff within the company, analyzing business structures, procedures, processes, and utilization of resources, addressing employee conflicts, completing investigations as required, working with managers to administer employee discipline and corrective actions as needed, assisting employee engagement and retention, actively working to identify, analyze, and improve problematic areas, performing various administrative tasks accurately, processing paperwork, counseling staff on Human Resources policies, practices, and procedures to achieve maximum productivity.  

Need colleagues with the following abilities:  
Candidates must possess at least a Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Psychology, or equivalent relevant experience in a Human Resources role. At least two years working in a related field is required for the position, preferably as a Supervisor or Coordinator specializing in recruitment, talent acquisition, food and beverage business, good data analysis and reporting, leadership skills, strong leadership, excellent written and verbal communication skills, competency in Microsoft Office business management presentation tools, competency in performance management tools, Bachelor of Science in K Pio Kris is an advantage, competency in ODTMVUCABANIRUPT preferable, excellent administrative skills, COVID vaccination.  

Area: Must be placement in Jakarta.

normalized_jd:
Job desk:  
1. Develop and manage human resource planning and various procedures related to staff in the company.  
2. Plan, organize, and monitor activities and actions in the Human Resources department.  
3. Responsible for development and planning of Human Resources objectives as well as system procedures implementation.  
4. Implementation and revision of the company wage program.  
5. Create and revise job descriptions for the department.  
6. Conduct annual salary surveys.  
7. Development, analysis, and update of the company salary budget policy.  
8. Development, analysis, and update of the company evaluation program.  
9. Development, revision, and recommendation of policies related to staff.  
10. Management of company operational standard procedures related to Human Resources.  
11. Supervision of the recruitment process in the department, including creation and placement of job opportunity advertisements.  
12. Management of onboarding programs for new employees and employee counseling.  
13. Supervision of resignation interviews.  
14. Management of report archives in the department.  
15. Participate in meetings.  

Qualifications:  
- Recommend new policies, new approaches, and new procedures aimed at developing the company.  
- Maximum age: thirty years.  
- Minimum education: Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Management, or Law.  
- Three years of experience as a Human Resources Manager.  
- Understand manpower law, BPJS, and industrial relations.  
- Understand psychological test tools.  
- Occupational Safety and Health (K3).  
- Good network and relationships with government agencies and institutions related to employment.  
- Proficient in fostering industrial relations and wise in resolving disputes.  
- Integrity, assertiveness, leadership, and responsibility.  
- Accustomed to working under pressure.  
- Proficient in using Microsoft Office.  
- Neat, communicative, and systematic.

normalized_jd:
Software engineer role: design, execute, and troubleshoot software programs and applications, including configuring, coding, developing, and documenting software specifications throughout the project lifecycle. The software engineer also oversees system startup in a timely and accurate fashion and provides support to departments as required. The software engineer is responsible for building state-of-the-art healthcare applications to empower doctors, administrators, and patients in the healthcare delivery process. Responsible for the design and development of web-based Electronic Health Record and practice management solutions as part of an Agile software development team.  

Job responsibilities: collaborate with analysts and designers in the development initiation of new software programs and applications; oversee quality assurance program logic, data processing, and error resolution; develop awareness of programming design alternatives; take an active role in cross-departmental projects as needed; direct research into emerging application development software products, languages, and standards; support procurement and development efforts; interact regularly with managers, clients, vendors, and agencies to field queries and questions; research, document, and implement program requirements and specifications; consistently write and translate code for software programs and applications according to specifications; run and monitor performance tests on new and existing software for the purpose of correcting mistakes, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging; administer diagnostic analysis of test results and deliver solutions to critical areas; cultivate and disseminate knowledge of application development best practices; gather statistics and prepare written reports on the status of programming processes for discussion with management and team members; determine, develop, and maintain user manuals and guidelines; install software products for end users as required; liaise with company software and hardware suppliers for prompt rectification of problems in emergencies; liaise with network administrators, system analysts, programmers, and software engineers to resolve defects in company systems; write and delete programming scripts to enhance the functionality and appearance of the company website and web applications as necessary; recommend, schedule, and perform software improvements and upgrades for optimal performance of company workstations; responsible for end-to-end development of application features; design, develop, and maintain web-scale applications and services; document proposals and designs; ultimately code so others can understand and incorporate work into larger platform architecture; perform peer code reviews and provide feedback to team members; keep quality, patient safety, and privacy as top priorities; embrace opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.  

Required qualifications: three-plus years of experience in web application development or similar experience; expertise in Java and JavaScript languages; strong knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3; development experience working with enterprise databases like Oracle; experience in application performance analysis and tuning; built and tested software as part of larger projects involving continuous integration and frequent delivery; experience working in an Agile environment with Scrum development teams; knowledge of developing and deploying applications using Amazon Web Services; Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or technical school in computer science or a related field preferred; technically fluent in programming languages including SQL, Java, and HTML5; extensive database and operating system experience; competent and proficient understanding of platforms; solid working knowledge of current internet technologies; hands-on software troubleshooting experience; experience working independently in team-oriented and collaborative environments essential; ability to influence developers and stakeholders in research and development regarding practices and procedures.  

Desired qualifications: knowledge and ability to design, develop, and maintain interfaces and linkages between alternative platforms and software packages; knowledge and experience in strategies, practices, and tools for managing version distribution of software product enhancements.  

NextGen Healthcare believes in the strength of diversity and is an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer supporting diversity, disabled, and protected veterans. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status. To accomplish the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the essential functions satisfactorily without reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodation may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. NextGen Healthcare believes in providing a safe work environment and conducts background checks as part of the hiring process.

normalized_jd:
Company profile Morgan Stanley, a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management, and wealth management services. The firm’s employees serve clients worldwide, including corporations, governments, and individuals, in one hundred and two offices across forty-three countries. A market leader, the talent and passion of our people are critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and a strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career—a place where people can learn, achieve, and grow. Our philosophy balances personal lifestyle perspectives with the needs of our business, and this is an important part of our culture.  

Technology  
Technology works as a strategic partner with Morgan Stanley business units. As one of the world’s leading technology companies, we redefine business in an evermore global, complex, and dynamic financial market. Morgan Stanley has made sizeable investments in technology, resulting in quantitative trading systems, cutting-edge modelling and simulation software, comprehensive risk and security systems, robust client relationship capabilities, plus worldwide infrastructure forming the backbone of our systems, tools, insights, applications, and infrastructure that give a competitive edge to our clients’ businesses.  

Position description  
The candidate is expected to take an active role in the design, development, testing, and delivery processes to accommodate business needs for the agency mortgage-backed trading desk. The role also involves extensive interaction with agency traders; the ability to communicate clearly and concisely is essential.  

Developer position  
Management position  
The candidate is expected to code and deliver software daily. The role involves working with HTML5, AngularJS, Java, as well as relational database interaction. Skills required: three years of relevant experience, experience using HTML5 and AngularJS, experience in Java core, ability to pick up quickly when necessary, strong analytical skills, being well-versed in object-oriented patterns and techniques, exposure to multithreaded and concurrent programming, good communication skills, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  

Skills desired: relational database experience, C++ experience is a plus, and experience working in the finance industry.

normalized_jd:
OppenheimerFunds II is looking for a Full Stack Developer who understands the importance of maintainable code, comprehensive testing, and the value of simple RESTful services. Join the Investment Risk Technology team and you will be a critical member of the team working on visible projects with stakeholders. Joining us gives you the chance to help shape the future portfolio management platform at OppenheimerFunds. We take a pragmatic approach to architectural and technology choices and hope to pair program and follow Test Driven Development, which we know delivers remarkable results. 

Core infrastructure runs Spring Boot, Spring Data, and Spring Cloud services. The front end uses React and we deploy applications on Cloud Foundry. 

Responsibilities and deliverables:  
Responsible for frontend development, writing robust front end code using the React framework and library. Automate tests using tools like Selenium, JUnit, Jasmine, Mocha, and Chai, using Test Driven Development frameworks. Develop backend code using Java and Spring Boot.

normalized_jd:
Overview Associate Front End Full Stack Developer Prolific seeking Associate Front End Developer Java capability proven JavaScript framework experience. Successful candidate part of elite consulting team responsible for design, development, and implementation of solutions for global one thousand customers. Key responsibility: develop application components based on Java Angular technology stack as part of global development team, business design sessions, architecture reviews, ensure delivery aligns with expectations, participate in code reviews, support Quality Assurance initiatives to ensure high quality delivery, design and develop solutions using integration design patterns, single page application frameworks, and best practices.  

Skill Qualification Required:  
Strong communication skills, ability to interface directly with clients and analysts to ensure technical requirement delivery alignment.  
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.  
Strong analytical and design skills including ability to understand business requirements and translate into efficient and effective technical designs.  
Work well within large-scale, well-structured enterprise environments.  
Effective communication, presentation, and collaboration skills.  
Excellent troubleshooting skills, ability to quickly identify and document root cause issues, effectively communicate possible resolutions.  
Work independently and effectively in a self-directed manner.  
Angular 2 experience, object-oriented JavaScript, JavaScript framework, TypeScript, CSS, HTML5 experience.  
Angular 2, 4, 5 proven success delivering solutions, framework User Interface design experience specifically for web applications is a plus.  
Java web development, Servlet, JavaServer Pages, Spring Framework hands-on experience.  
Web application development utilizing Java web development primarily for Spring Framework.  
Experience in development of Service-Oriented Architecture applications.  
Good understanding of object-oriented design and design patterns.  
Knowledge of JavaServer Pages, JavaScript essential.  
Experience in Model-View patterned applications using JavaScript frameworks, preferably Angular.  
Spring Cloud experience is a plus.  

Prolific thirty-six years experienced, continued growth, recognition, expertise global service company. Prolific provides end-to-end services including architectural advisement, design, development, deployment, testing, Business Process Management integration, security, content collaboration solutions. Garnered several awards for technical excellence and vision. One of the world’s most admired technology consulting companies delivering competitive advantage for client benefit. Prolific committed to providing competitive, comprehensive suite of benefits to fit the needs of employees. For information on benefits offered, please refer to website.

normalized_jd:
AlphaSight searches five hundred million professionals working in the world today to find a small handful of experts qualified to answer client needs, using insight to drive amazing progress within an organisation. The mission is to provide access to dispersed, hidden, underutilized knowledge. We have made terrific progress working in a new space, but there is still an incredible amount of work; we have only scratched the surface of applying technology to the problem AlphaSight faces.  

Front End Engineer: build features across the ecosystem of products, both internal and client-facing. A Front End Engineer builds ambitious web applications at the edge of what is possible today in the browser. You will work closely with a variety of people in the business to arrive at the best solution, immediately see the impact of your work, and get feedback directly from users. You will be enabled to implement features across the entire stack, from client view to database layer.  

We are looking for people interested in building software systems to incredibly high standards, comfortable working across multiple languages, and able to learn quickly when new technology is introduced. You care about engineering skill versus deep knowledge of a particular language or framework. You will build front end architecture that pushes the boundaries of modern front end engineering, build fast ambitious web applications, and work closely with the product team and engineering team to build features with significant business impact. You will design elegant, intuitive user interface components and drive forward-thinking front end technology at AlphaSight.  

You will implement functionality necessary to power the front end and bring to life back end services. You will work in a small, nimble team, understand business context deeply, and leverage engineering knowledge to propose creative solutions to problems. You might fit if you have a deep understanding of JavaScript fundamentals, experience with Ember.js, and an understanding of the complexity of the Document Object Model and Cascading Style Sheets, especially in how they interact. You can interpret user interface performance metrics and address issues accordingly. You know and understand the implications of the latest developments in ECMAScript. You learn and mentor engineers, reason about trade-offs when discussing front end technology, and can navigate to write back end code.  

Besides JavaScript, you are also proficient in Java, Ruby, Python, or similar languages powering back end services. You are interested in working in a team applying data science to solve challenging business problems. You see yourself as an entrepreneur as well as an engineer, with at least five years of professional experience, having served as a technical lead for a specific application, product area, or level of infrastructure. You balance deep work with cross-team collaboration.  

Do not worry if your experience or background does not match exactly; we believe a broad spectrum of experience provides great perspective for solving problems in new, innovative ways. We would love to hear how you might work with us.  

You will build and schedule multi-party communication under heavy constraints, integrate software with browsers, web email clients, and web calendars to meet user needs, launch new product initiatives to delight clients, and differentiate our service. You will develop innovative search and discovery interfaces for mission-critical knowledge search in business.  

You would join a dynamic, multinational, diverse team that enjoys solving interesting problems in a collaborative environment. We welcome self-taught engineers as well as graduates from top computer science and engineering schools. Your coworkers will include motivated recent graduates as well as experienced industry leaders from companies such as Google and Amazon.

normalized_jd:
United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund work in the world’s toughest places to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children, save lives, defend rights, and help fulfill potential across one hundred ninety countries and territories. Work for every child, everywhere, every day to build a better world for everyone. Never give up. Every child connected world overarching strategic goal United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund Information and Communication Technology Division Information and Communication Technology Digital Innovation Services transform, build partnership with stakeholders, successfully implement United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund programmes globally using innovative technology-enabled solutions. Position situated within Solution Centre Support Information and Communication Technology Digital Innovation Services Centre. Goal: provide adequate, user-friendly, modern business solutions to United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund different departments and stakeholders, as well as providing guidance, governance, and procedures for several enterprise processes, data collection, programme monitoring, digital tools, platforms, and business process optimization throughout the organization. Make a difference. Direction lead Full Stack Web Developer. Incumbent provides backend and frontend web development customization support to United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund external-facing web content management systems and applications tools currently developed and customized in close coordination with Division of Communication used by United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund offices for external digital communication and engagement.  

Requirement: incumbent performs hands-on development and customization activities, makes professional analytical contributions, develops collaborative working environments, maintains effective partnerships with clients, reliably delivers professional quality services and products.  

Key responsibilities: manage and perform hands-on activities to complete application development cycles for United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund website projects; perform requirement gathering, design, development, customization, testing, and implementation tasks for web content management systems OpenText RedDot, Drupal, WordPress following best practices and standards, following product roadmaps; translate user requirements into system specifications; provide first-level maintenance, enhancement, and troubleshooting support for web content management hosting systems and applications; collaborate with Division of Communication global training support lead; provide technical support and assistance to Headquarters and field office staff in the sphere of website issues and related areas; perform enhancement and customization of implemented solutions as required; run and analyze Quality Assurance tests, e.g., unit tests, acceptance tests, regression tests; provide administration, management, and monitoring support for web application-related infrastructure used and supported by the team; assist web administrators in daily web application management and monitoring support activities; Platform as a Service Software as a Service web applications; provide support for installation, configuration, upgrade, and maintenance of content management systems, website hosting environments, log analytics tools, software management, website search software tools, Relational Database Management Systems, website security management software tools; preparation and maintenance of documentation; ensure necessary technical documentation for tools and modules is in place; prepare application documentation, update procedures and processes as necessary; measure and periodically report key performance indicators; research and evaluate new technology; conduct research and make recommendations for web tools, software, and services for external-facing websites; assist in tool and software selection, vendor evaluation, interface with units and organizations; recommend new technology opportunities and assess impact on external-facing web application environments.  

Qualifications: champion for every child; advanced university degree (Master’s or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field required. Combination of first university degree combined with two additional years of relevant professional experience may be substituted for advanced university degree. Minimum two years hands-on development experience with Drupal, including custom module development, key contributed modules, core Application Programming Interface. Fluency in English required. Knowledge of another official United Nations language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian, Spanish) an asset.  

In addition, the following skills and experience are strongly preferred: experience with Drupal 8; proficiency in optimization, maintenance, and administration of Drupal modules and sites; proficiency in Drupal adjunct technologies Linux Apache MySQL PHP stack, HyperText Markup Language, Cascading Style Sheets, jQuery, JavaScript, Software as a Service, Varnish, Solr, Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interface services, multi-development workflows (either frontend or backend focus); experience with Drupal 8 headless configuration and content services; Content as a Service emerging area desired; experience using Acquia infrastructure platform for Drupal; strong hands-on experience with PHP and MySQL databases; working knowledge of development framework Symfony; working knowledge of Search Engine Optimization coding best practices; hands-on experience developing responsive designs and multivariate tests; familiarity with Agile methodology, Scrum framework, version control systems Git, continuous integration systems, automated testing practices.  

Every child demonstrates core values: commitment, diversity, integrity. Core competencies: communication, working with people, drive for results. In addition, the following functional competencies are required for the position: analyzing (level two), applying technical expertise (level two), formulating strategies and concepts (level one), planning and organizing (level one). View competency framework.  

Remarks: United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce and encourages candidates irrespective of gender, nationality, religious or ethnic background, including persons living with disabilities, to apply to become part of the organization. Mobility is a condition of international professional employment with United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund, underlying premise of international civil service.

normalized_jd:
Looking for a dynamic individual to join a fast-paced New York team, leading client in a challenging and rewarding role. The individual will work closely with a Senior member of the Prime Brokerage Equity Swap business and the Global Technology team. Responsibilities include participating in the full Software Development Lifecycle, design, documentation, and deployment, interacting with the Project Manager, Business Analyst, Architect, and stakeholders throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), performing problem analysis, and proposing solutions given business scenarios and requirements. 

Seven years of experience developing front-end desktop and web-based solutions. Experience with Angular JavaScript front-end development environment, expertise in Bootstrap, Jasmine, JSON, REST API, and web services. Exposure to Java/J2EE development, knowledge of developing applications in Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) and microservice architecture domain. Flexible with the right experience. Prime Brokerage experience, prior trading, risk, fixed income, regulatory reporting, and capital market experience highly preferred. Good written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to work effectively in a global team environment.

normalized_jd:
Bel Stone, a fast-growing technology-led merchant bank, drives capital as a private company fueling the economy, creating new jobs, and advancing innovation. The team is comprised of veterans from top global private equity investment banking firms and advanced technologists with backgrounds in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. They work in deep alignment with client partners and make extensive use of proprietary data and software systems to drive top market results. At the heart of operations is a proprietary data stream processing engine used to integrate web-scale structured and unstructured data with Machine Learning to drive insight.  

The team is seeking a Full Stack Developer to build features for a real-time relationship management user interface built using React and Meteor. In this role, you will be designing critical infrastructure strategy and collaborating closely with Senior Management to develop transformative new feature requirements.  

The position is full-time and based in New York. The candidate should be entrepreneurial, creative, and ambitious, and meet the following qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field from a top school, or coursework equivalent experience in data structures and algorithms  
- Fluent in JavaScript  
- Two years of experience in coding languages  
- Worked on real-world web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, Angular, or Ember  
- Specific experience with React and Meteor is a plus  
- Familiarity with unit testing, source control, and good software engineering practices  
- Ability to take high-level tasks, plan steps, implement, and complete steps independently  
- Strong English communication skills  
- Exposure to applied Machine Learning is a definite plus  

To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and GitHub profile link to [email protected] with the subject line “Full Stack Developer Position – Bel Stone Capital” and include your full name.

normalized_jd:
Company description: Quartet is a pioneering technology company connecting physical and mental care to improve people's health and quality of life, building a collaborative technology platform that brings together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive healthcare costs down. The data-driven platform identifies high-need patients and facilitates access to personalized care. Backed by ninety-two million in venture funding from top investors like GV (formerly Google Ventures) and Oak HC/FT, Quartet is headquartered in New York City and currently operating in several markets across Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, Louisiana, Washington, Northern California, and New Jersey.

Role description: Quartet is looking for a Full Stack Engineer who wants to build products that help patients improve their lives through mental health care as part of a cross-functional team. The Full Stack Engineer will work with Product Managers and Designers focused on complex engineering challenges unique to the healthcare industry. The Full Stack Engineer will have a hands-on role developing API-driven web applications. Four years of passion for collaboration stem from a ceaseless desire to learn from team members across disciplines. Experience with React and Node.js has made a mark on your career, and you are always looking for opportunities to broaden your technical skill set. You love finding simple, elegant solutions to complicated problems.

Responsibilities: At Quartet, develop responsive product features in JavaScript for client and server-side applications. Contribute to the codebase and help ensure coding standards and patterns are observed through code reviews and pair programming. Collaborate with the Development Operations team to build and scale tools and libraries that streamline developer workflows and improve developer experience. Feel inspired to refactor and implement changes, developing processes that improve everyone's workflow.

Benefits and perks: Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; enhanced mental health benefits; paid membership to One Medical; pre-tax health, transit, and dependent care flexible spending accounts; fee-free 401(k) program; unlimited vacation and sick leave; competitive family leave policy; amazing office with a stocked kitchen and family room; weekly team lunches; regular company gatherings; and the opportunity to work with talented, mission-driven minds in the industry.

normalized_jd:
Role looking for Full Stack Developer to take a key role in the team. Full Stack Developer must have knowledge of all stages of software development with a focus on Pure JavaScript stack. You will be working alongside engineers and developers, collaborating on various layers of infrastructure for Augmented Reality platform, advertising platform, and 3D asset management platform. Responsibilities include aiding in the design of overall architecture for various software products, maintaining quality, ensuring responsiveness of applications, collaborating with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features, maintaining code integrity and organization, and leaving code in better shape. Experience working with graphic designers and converting designs to visual elements, understanding and implementing security and data protection. Highly experienced in backend programming language Node.js preferred. Development experience for mobile and desktop. Work with non-technical teams as well as technical teams to explain terms and solutions in an oriented manner. Maintain and build data pipelines, assist with ad hoc data reporting requests.  

Experience and skill requirements:  
Two years of experience with vanilla JavaScript without frameworks, ECMAScript 6 experience is a plus. Solid understanding of C++ fundamental data types, inheritance, object-oriented versus functional programming, and control structures. Two years of experience working with Node.js. Solid understanding of relational SQL databases. One year of experience working with React, Redux, Hyperapp, Mithril, or similar frameworks. Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3 layouts, and UI/UX. Experience with 3D framework Three.js is a plus. Amazon Web Services experience is a plus. WebXR, ARKit, ARCore experience is a plus. DevOps and Linux experience is a plus. Not afraid to work with Command Line Interface terminal. Ability to communicate clearly with non-technical employees while participating in a friendly team environment.  

Benefits and perks:  
Office five-minute walk from the beach, coffee, espresso, LaCroix, lots of snacks, catered lunch delivered twice weekly at no cost to staff, close to Third Street Promenade in downtown Santa Monica, Metro Expo Line, biweekly happy hour.

normalized_jd:
Age Learning, a leading education technology innovator based in Glendale, California, has a talented team of six hundred individuals including educators, developers, artists, writers, designers, engineers, producers, product managers, marketing experts, and creators. The award-winning ABCmouse.com Early Learning Academy curriculum has been experienced by ten million children worldwide, with three billion learning activities completed to date. Age Learning is committed to helping every child learn through the Education Access initiative, which reaches millions of children by offering the full ABCmouse curriculum at no cost to teachers, community institutions, libraries, Head Start programs, community centers including public housing authorities, and school programs. Age Learning is bringing learning to life.

Summary:  
The marketing team at Age Learning is seeking a full-time in-house full stack programmer. This person will be responsible for assisting with the self-deployment process, which requires a solid background in Git and working knowledge of Jenkins Continuous Integration. Additionally, the person will employ PHP, Node.js, slight shell scripting, HTML5/CSS, JavaScript, and AngularJS to help debug software problems, assist in building internal tools for internal clients, and tackle the myriad challenges that arise every day in a rapidly growing organization.  

Looking for a challenging and rewarding environment, the role may include responsibilities such as debugging server-side and client-side issues, assisting with self-deployment quality assurance and production, building new internal tools used for content creation, and updating and maintaining existing applications.  

Desired skills and experience:  
- One year PHP experience  
- One year CSS/HTML5, JavaScript, AJAX experience  
- Working knowledge of AngularJS  
- Strong skills in analyzing information and quickly finding creative solutions to difficult problems  
- Good attention to detail and rigorous self-testing/code delivery of high-quality work  
- Ability to thrive in a dynamic work environment  
- Product-first approach to building software  
- Ability to communicate effectively and work as part of a team  
- Experience with Git  
- Knowledge of Model-View-Controller frameworks and AngularJS is a plus  
- Experience with Unix commands is a plus  
- Experience integrating third-party Application Programming Interfaces and web services is a plus  

Age Learning does not sponsor work-related visas for this position, which includes limited H-1B visas.

normalized_jd:
Swell Investing is a financial technology startup where investing meets technology, business meets idealism. Swell makes impact investing easy, accessible, and inspiring. Swell is looking for a jack of all trades Full Stack Developer to build features, lead the team, and ensure the product experience is seamless as well as secure. The Full Stack Developer is in charge of building backend data infrastructure and frontend consumer applications to deliver exceptional user experiences. Swell consumers use an agile development strategy and user-centered research to keep Swell on the leading edge.  

Develop and maintain product features, build wireframes, and integrate third-party application programming interfaces, for example financial transactions, ensuring features are secure and user-centered. Refactor code to keep quality high and code easy to understand. Serve as the voice of technology, collaborating with other team members and key stakeholders on overall strategy and the product roadmap, experience design, and marketing strategy.  

Capability to partner closely with product management, design, and engineering team members to develop and iterate platform design and overall architecture. Employ agile development practices as new priorities arise, business goals change, and user feedback on product features is addressed. Play a key role in hiring and onboarding a great team to support the growth and evolution of Swell’s product.  

Requirements: Must be a Full Stack Engineer with React, Redux, Ruby on Rails, Behavior-Driven Development, Test-Driven Development, excited about agile development, with experience and passion for building financial technology products. Passionate about building amazing digital products that delight consumers and drive business performance. Passion for social impact is a plus.

normalized_jd:
Age Learning, a leading education technology innovator based in Glendale, California, has a talented team of six hundred individual educators, developers, artists, writers, designers, engineers, producers, product managers, marketing experts, and creators. The award-winning ABCmouse.com Early Learning Academy curriculum has been experienced by ten million children worldwide, with three billion learning activities completed to date. Age Learning is committed to helping every child learn through the Education Access Initiative, which reaches millions of children by offering the full ABCmouse curriculum at no cost to teachers, community institutions, libraries, Head Start programs, community centers, including public housing authorities, and school programs. Age Learning is bringing learning to life.

Summary:  
The Enterprise team at Age Learning is seeking a full-time in-house Full Stack Software Engineer. This person will employ PHP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, light shell scripting to help us debug software problems, assist in building internal tools, and tackle the myriad challenges that arise every day in a rapidly growing organization.

Responsibilities:  
Conduct maintenance and development of server-side and client-side applications. Identify root causes of operational issues and implement solutions. Develop tools and scripts to maintain data integrity. Assist in self-deployment, quality assurance, and production. Apply operational knowledge toward development and functional testing. Remain knowledgeable about emerging technology and advocate the use of appropriate tools to perform the role. Participate in development, implementation, and testing activities.

Provide technical skills in one of the following areas:  
- Server-side web application development  
- Web application analysis, including knowledge discovery and data mining  

Required Skills and Experience:  
- Four years of PHP experience  
- Four years of CSS, HTML5, and JavaScript development  
- Solid grasp of efficient relational database implementation  
- Strong skills in analyzing information and quickly finding creative solutions to difficult problems  
- Good attention to detail and rigorous self-testing of code, delivering high-quality work  
- Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment  
- Ability to communicate effectively and work as part of a team  
- Self-organized yet able to work in a collaborative space  
- Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience  

Preferred Skills and Experience:  
- Knowledge of Agile frameworks and best practices is a plus  
- Experience with Git and Jenkins is a plus  
- Knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as Angular is a plus  
- Knowledge of PHP frameworks such as Laravel is a plus  
- Experience with Unix commands is a plus  
- Experience integrating third-party APIs and web services is a plus  

Age Learning does not sponsor work-related visas for this position, but it includes limited H-1B visas.

normalized_jd:
Immediate opening for Full Stack Developer to join team. Prefer Senior Full Stack Developer with minimum three to five years prior experience, preferably enterprise-level web development. Great opportunity to join dynamic team and work on enterprise-level project with high visibility. Dream job for anyone looking for career in stable company.  

Responsibilities: Manages multiple front-end and back-end projects with timely deadlines. Communicates frequently with client management detailing progress of development effort. Evaluates and implements changes to tools or modules based on needs of client.  

Skills: Proficiency in front-end development with JavaScript. Familiarity with prevalent JavaScript library and framework including React, Node.js, Bootstrap, Angular. Experience with Java framework, MySQL, Java 2 Platform, Enterprise Edition application server along with proficiency in Java 2 Platform, Enterprise Edition elements including Servlets, Enterprise JavaBeans, Bean-Managed Persistence, and Message-Driven Beans. Experience building and using JSON-based RESTful APIs is a plus. Knowledge of virtual assistant application development for Google Home and Amazon Echo is a plus. Previous experience with this technology is a plus. Experience developing dynamic data-driven sites and ability to hand-code quality, clean HTML.  

Compensation: Full-time position with solid potential for career growth. Provides excellent 401(k) benefits with full matching, medical, dental, and vision benefits. Casual work environment and much more.
