normalized_jd: November Information Management Limited Liability Company seeking two Full Stack Developers comfortable with software development, delivery, and processing involving GitHub, Jira, Development Operations, Apache Spark, Cassandra, in a leading role in the company supporting data system implementation, operation, and program for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration California Institute of Technology Jet Propulsion Laboratory Pasadena, California. November Information Management provides science and engineering support to government important data systems impacting weather, public safety, and space science. Candidate will provide leadership for November Information Management’s program. Jet Propulsion Laboratory Data Systems Implementation program provides information system development lifecycle including supporting role in system engineering, operation, data management, and archive to augment Jet Propulsion Laboratory workforce supporting flight and non‑flight activity. Expert‑level working experience using Python. Experience with Amazon Cloud Infrastructure including Simple Storage Service, Lambda. Experience at operating system‑level virtualization using Docker. Must be familiar with automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications using Kubernetes. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in a technical or business discipline including engineering, mathematics, computer science, physics, business management, or equivalent experience. Position description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned. Position description is not an exhaustive list of duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, abilities, or working conditions associated with the position. November Information Management offers a competitive compensation package including comprehensive medical, dental, and life insurance, matching 401(k) contribution, and educational support.

Natural History Museum Los Angeles County seeking Junior Web Developer Creative Services Department position responsible for supporting Web Department team in planning, producing, and implementing digital initiatives across web, mobile, and social platforms. Able to design and develop website functionality ensuring strong optimization and best practices. Primary responsibilities for the position include limited work with the development team, overseeing work of digital consultants and vendors, implementing digital project planning, design, analysis, design, and development of website functionality ensuring strong optimization and best practices, delivering updates to all aspects of website and online initiatives for Natural History Museum, La Brea Tar Pits Museum, and William S. Hart Museum, ensuring positive visitor experience. Research site traffic analytics, perform A/B testing, optimize website functionality, assist in creation, editing, publishing, and removal of page templates and sites across development, staging, and production servers. Ensure projects utilize latest industry tools and standards: CSS and CSS3, XHTML and HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, MySQL, PHP. Key deliverables include ability to implement and provide relevant analytics across digital platforms, create and edit template files, create and edit custom modules, administrate Drupal architecture alongside Drupal and WordPress, work with various PHP frameworks, interface with Linux and Apache including SSL and PCI compliance, interact with servers using SSH, FTP, and Telnet protocols, monitor website technical performance, web servers, and web systems, assist with cross-browser Quality Assurance features, record and address bugs requiring fixes.  

Position following requirements: studied Computer Science or related degree program, knowledge of JavaScript, PHP, CSS, HTML, experience with Content Management development, web frameworks Angular.js, React.js, Django, experience with LAMP stack preferred, knowledge of working with source control systems GitHub, Perforce.  

Natural History Museum Los Angeles County seeking employee with demonstrated experience and commitment to working with diverse communities. Salary commensurate with experience plus excellent benefits. Part-time or full-time, temporary or regular, non-exempt position. Cover letter, current resume, and list of three to four references required. Applicant review and application process begin immediately and continue until position is filled. Interested candidates please visit and click link for position of interest. Natural History Museum Los Angeles County is an equal opportunity employer. Please no phone calls, faxes, or emails.

normalized_jd:
Financial, located in New York City, is a leading financial services company providing working capital to small and midsize businesses nationwide. Established in two thousand eight, we support small businesses in need of financing to sustain and grow their enterprises by providing innovative, customized, and flexible working capital solutions. We operate with a consultative approach, listening to customers and providing the best to meet their needs in an ever-changing financial market. To date, Financial has funded twenty-two thousand individual transactions for fifteen thousand unique customers. The company has funded seven hundred fifty million in working capital solutions for small businesses since inception.  

Position Summary:  
We are looking for a talented Full Stack .NET Software Engineer with solid experience, good communication skills, and an eye toward detail to help us take our outstanding web-based lending platform to the next level. Come join a team that values excellence, teamwork, and integrity to produce exceptional financial technology solutions using the latest technology. Financial is a place to develop your career and help develop the next generation of financial products.  

Base salary range: seventy thousand to one hundred ten thousand depending on experience, includes a competitive benefits package. Conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan near New York Penn Station, Port Authority Bus Terminal, and several subway and bus lines. Full-time permanent position. No visa sponsorship or transfer. No corp-to-corp or third-party candidates.  

Day in the Life:  
As a Full Stack .NET Developer, you will work with team members on the design and implementation of core platform technology, integration with financial services, authentication, rule engines, data models, and workflows. You will design, implement, and test external-facing application programming interfaces to facilitate external integration with the platform. You will integrate with a SQL Server backend using proprietary tools.  

Requirements:  
- At least three years of significant C# and ASP.NET development experience  
- Solid understanding of Model-View-Controller, View, and Razor  
- Solid command of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript  
- In-depth knowledge of relational databases, SQL Server, and object-relational mapping  
- Ability to work well in a team and also take responsibility for tasks and work independently  
- Adept at writing unit tests and testable code  

Benefits of working at Financial:  
- Good work-life balance  
- Medical, dental, and vision coverage  
- 401(k) match  
- Life insurance at no cost to the employee  
- Generous time-off plan including rollover vacation days  
- Commuter benefits  
- Health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts

normalized_jd:
Searching gifted full stack PHP developer to join engineering team. Position requires developer skills and experience building modern web applications using the latest backend and frontend technology. Must write clean, reusable code with strong emphasis on stability and performance. Must be organized and self-focused on delivering on time according to requirements. The Wonder Sauce development team spans three offices in New York, Columbus, and Los Angeles, comprised of a range of talent focusing on backend and frontend development. Developers are involved in projects from day one, collaborating across disciplines and contributing to the overall success of the project, working closely with strategy and user experience design to come to the best solution for the problem at hand.  

Skill requirements:  
Excellent knowledge of object-oriented PHP. Two years of professional experience, including internships and school projects. Must have version control experience. Required strong knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and related tools and packages. Two years of experience. Strong knowledge of relational databases, i.e., MySQL. Two years of experience. Problem solver and go-getter. Write clean, readable code and test.  

Wonder Sauce is a new breed of advertising agency. We started the agency with the goal of creating a company truly centered on human behavior. Wonder Sauce is focused on the complete customer journey, helping clients understand relevant ways to reach their audience, whether through digital, traditional, social, or mobile campaigns, marketing, point of sale, or video. We specialize in understanding businesses and recommending responsible, cost-effective ways to achieve goals. Wonder Sauce is a proud member of the Made in New York initiative. Society and digital agency work recognized by Time Magazine, Webby, and Site Inspire.  

Equal Opportunity Statement: Wonder Sauce aims to be an equal opportunity employer committed to promoting equal opportunity regardless of religious belief, age, color, race, creed, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, political affiliation, ethnic origin, family status, or disability, subject to exceptions contained in the Human Rights Act 1993. This commitment applies to every aspect of the work environment, employment activity, resource allocation, employment terms and conditions, selection criteria, and procedures. We aim to ensure employees are selected, promoted, and treated on the basis of relevant merit and ability.

normalized_jd:
Consultant company based in Jakarta, Indonesia, Star facilitates customer expertise. Star provides customers the best to achieve goals and develop the best version. PT Indonesia Star Cipta Teknologi focuses on providing professional service consultation for individuals and companies, aiming for a one-stop solution providing consultancy in Customer Relationship Management, Robotic Process Automation, mobile applications, Human Resources, and digital transformation.  

The group company includes Rife, focused on digital marketing; G Focus, focused on system solutions; and one focused on education services. We also endeavor to educate young individuals, developing skills to become professionals who meet current demand in their respective industries in the era of technology.  

Class training events are looking for talented Java developers familiar with backend services, able to be team players and individual contributors in a working environment. Candidates need to be able to perform with Java frameworks such as Spring and Hibernate professionally, and with Representational State Transfer Application Programming Interfaces professionally. PostgreSQL and Oracle are an advantage.  

Mainly, we provide a working place in Jakarta, with a one-year contract system and the opportunity to become permanent talent. Java developers will work on projects already running or projects starting from the beginning. Work is evaluated fairly by management, which appreciates talent with the best performance and career advancement for persons who continue to develop.  

If you are interested in continuing to add insight, knowledge, and skills, and are suitable to join us, we welcome individuals always willing to provide improvement in every work and every project.  

Preferred qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer, Telecommunication, or equivalent  
- Minimum one year of experience in Java Spring Boot  
- Experience with basic operating systems such as Sun Solaris, Unix, Windows, Linux  
- Excellent knowledge of Structured Query Language and fundamental database concepts  
- Familiarity with enterprise database systems such as Oracle  
- Understanding of versioning code systems like GitLab

normalized_jd:
You are looking for career help. Stand, join, and separate to fulfill your potential and passion for the company concerned with software development in the wireless cellular division, especially in telecommunication. Build a team with the best training, tools, and support to make you successful in delivering service.  

We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Project Manager.  

Job description: Responsible for managing assigned projects and ensuring compliance with defined methodology standards. Responsible for converting business requests into project requests. Prepare Senior Management reports on project status. Ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget as per approved scope with a high degree of quality. Able to manage multiple concurrent projects and create a sense of urgency and purpose within the project team. Ensure quality delivery at all stages from project planning to deployment. Manage deliverables with technical engineers, architects, and developers. Proactively identify, track, and manage project risks to avoid adverse effects on budget, delivery, and implementation timelines. Rigorously use and enforce the chosen project methodology, Agile or Waterfall, as needed. Lead the translation of business requirements into system design. Coordinate and communicate project tasks within a cross-functional organization. Develop effective relationships with business users, technical staff, and executive management. Effectively communicate using formal, disciplined communication as well as informal communication with stakeholders to help projects meet goals. Juggle multiple project priorities across multiple platforms. Know when to ask for help. Manage outsourced service provider delivery and ongoing support. Develop and actively manage project budgets. Make day-to-day trade-offs to meet project needs while fully understanding and assessing the importance and consequences of near-term and long-term decisions. Support feasibility studies, project assessments, initiation, scoping, risk management, and estimation. Mentor team members in project management skills.  

Requirements:  
- Five years of project management experience in web and mobile application projects.  
- Background in programming for web and mobile.  
- Strong Agile Scrum skills.  
- Proven track record of adhering to set budgets and tight deadlines.  
- Must have experience working in the telecommunication industry.  
- Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment.  
- Project Management Professional certification preferred.  
- Client-facing and internal communication skills.  
- Written and verbal communication skills.  
- Solid organizational skills, including attention to detail and multitasking abilities.

normalized_jd:
role YAS Project Manager Project Manager responsible for carrying out project planning and implementation, preparing human resource training material, tool distribution channel, parametric agricultural insurance PAN CERT ANI business place initiated YAS to sell and offer agricultural services to farmers, shops, nurseries, mechanization, buying and selling agricultural products, and other parametric agricultural insurance products. Work together with YASI Insurance Company partner. Project Manager coordinates internal and external parties, preparing and monitoring operational procedures, conducting evaluation and improvement to improve performance.  

Scope of responsibility:  
1. Preparing implementation strategy including effective marketing and promotion methods.  
2. Preparing planning and implementation of agricultural insurance distribution project PAN CERT ANI program throughout target area.  
3. Preparing scope of work, objectives, and targets.  
4. Managing preparation and implementation of project.  
5. Preparing standard operating procedures.  
6. Preparing and running training programs.  
7. Collaborating with Manager Agricultural Service, Agricultural Insurance Master, Seed Business staff.  
8. Monitoring and evaluation.  

Detailed job description:  
1. Study and understand program details and existing YAS stream.  
2. Identify cross-program opportunities offering allied programs, especially insurance agriculture PAN CERT ANI.  
3. Planning stage preparation and implementation together with internal and external partners, defining roles, objectives, and targets PAN CERT ANI internal and external parties.  
   b. Creating general project plan according to category of agricultural business type, prepared and implemented PAN CERT ANI.  
   c. Defining needs, preparing knowledge tools, PAN CERT ANI ready market agricultural insurance parametric.  
4. Lead and manage project, provide direction for project implementation members PAN CERT ANI internal team and relevant external parties.  
   b. Monitor preparation and implementation activities.  
5. Implementation operational strategy:  
   a. Prepare effective implementation strategy type PAN CERT ANI business, work with project implementation members, ensure strategy implemented properly, make relevant changes to improve performance.  
   b. Prepare effective operational procedures, tools, capacity building, registration, claim processing.  
   c. Prepare training material, ensure project implementation members training carried out according to plan and target.  
6. Monitor and evaluate implementation, revise strategy and operational procedures to improve performance.  
7. Planning preparation for four-month contract, run implementation in 5th month, ongoing evaluation and implementation.  

Required qualifications:  
1. Experience in project management, willing to present in interview.  
2. Educational background preferably Master in Management, Economics, Agriculture, Insurance, or relevant major.  
3. Minimum three to four years’ experience in project management, management consulting, business development, sales, marketing.  
4. Experience and exposure running project management, sales, marketing programs, experience preparing project incentive programs, marketing.  
   c. Sufficient knowledge of value chain insurance products.  
   d. Sufficient knowledge of general insurance products.  
   e. Sufficient knowledge of agricultural industry.  
5. Good communication skills in speaking, writing, and presentation in English, accustomed to conducting training.  
6. Able to work in a team.  

Job description recruitment process:  
Bachelor’s degree, work-based project basis, one-year contract extended according to need and performance.  
Domiciled in Jakarta, willing to travel to West Java, East Java, Lampung area.  
Reporting to Country Director, intensive work coordination with Agricultural Insurance Manager, Agricultural Service Manager, indirect report.  
Contract YASI Partner Third Party PT DOA.

normalized_jd:
Corning, one of the world’s leading innovators in material science with a one hundred sixty-six year track record of life-changing inventions, applies unparalleled expertise in glass science, ceramic science, and optical physics along with deep manufacturing and engineering capability to develop category-defining products that transform industries and enhance people’s lives. Corning Valor Glass is an example of life-changing innovation, purpose-built to store and protect injectable medicine. Corning is also a global leader in pharmaceutical tubing manufacturing, producing a variety of clear and amber glass tubing converted by customers into vials, cartridges, ampoules, and syringes.  

Passionate about life-changing innovation, from Thomas Edison to a history of working with the world’s greatest innovators to solve customers’ complex problems others cannot or will not, collaboration and creative spirit are among the career development reasons world-class professionals choose Corning Incorporated.  

Headquartered in Corning, a dynamic city in upstate New York, residents enjoy the benefits of a rich art and culture scene, one of the fastest growing wine regions, a family-friendly area, affordable homes, and quality education. Corning is a world leader in specialty glass and ceramics, building and manufacturing keystone components that enable high technology systems. Corning’s history is filled with breakthrough technologies that have played a meaningful role in the way the world works and thrives.  

Solving difficult, commercially relevant problems through a creative, collaborative research and development process, Corning succeeds through sustained investment in research and development, one hundred sixty years of material science and process engineering knowledge, and a distinctive reciprocal culture.  

Day-to-day responsibilities include daily monitoring of events in Cloud Access Security Broker, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Symantec Data Loss Prevention, and Global Information Security tools, assessing and determining appropriate next steps using knowledge of Corning business, Global Information Operations (GIO) and Global Information Security processes. Assist users and business groups in reviewing and resolving events per defined processes. Proactively identify opportunities to improve policies and reduce defects. Configure rulesets and policies in Global Information Data Loss Prevention security tools and systems as appropriate, ensuring policy rules are configured consistently across Data Loss Prevention and Global Information tools and systems.  

Analyze Data Loss Prevention incidents to identify common issues and trends, determine root causes, and summarize and report information security incident findings to Global Information management. Mine data, conduct analysis, and prepare reports based on event trends for Global Information management and business customer alignment. Follow data privacy governance guidelines and inform management of potential loss or threats, escalating information security risks as necessary.  

Support information security management in process improvement efforts. Assist in the creation, modification, and review of technical documentation and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Support workflow in Role Access Control (RAC) for Global Information security tools as appropriate, ensuring procedures are followed, documented, and repeatable. Update documentation when material changes are made. Develop Known Defect (KD) documents to address known issues. Work with Level Two Operations groups to ensure proper understanding and guidance for users.  

Participate in Global Information Data Loss Prevention security system upgrades, pilot testing, and deployment. Collaborate with resources supporting Global Information security tools and systems as well as the cybersecurity team. Participate in business operational reviews and assessments as appropriate.  

Ability to self-direct work and work independently as necessary. Clearly articulate technical concepts and issues to technical and non-technical peers and management. Participate in projects involved in the implementation of information security programs and enterprise data protection project initiatives.  

Hours of work: work schedule is flextime, minimum forty hours per week required. Sign a covenant not to compete and a nondisclosure agreement. Travel requirement: ten percent.  

Required skills:  
1. Keen analytical and decision-making capability.  
2. Foundational understanding of cloud computing, networking, computer systems, and mobile device applications, with willingness to learn new software applications.  
3. Data analysis, data query, mining, and report creation skills using multiple sources, using Microsoft Excel, Structured Query Language (SQL), or similar tools.  
4. Business acumen and knowledge of Corning business processes.  
5. Ability to work with International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) material.  
6. Ability to treat information discreetly.  

Desired skills:  
1. Self-motivated, independent, and flexible.  
2. General security and information security knowledge.  
3. Knowledge of cloud computing, Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office 365, SharePoint, Data Loss Prevention, and Cloud Access Security Control.  
4. Knowledge of mobile device management and identity management capabilities.  

Soft skills:  
1. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation and report writing.  
2. Desire to work in a team environment and be a strong team player.  
3. Ability to multitask.  
4. Ability to translate ambiguity into action.  
5. Ability to perform role with discretion.  

Qualifications:  
Required education: Bachelor’s degree.  
Required experience: Business analysis.  
Optional experience: Information security; security experience is a plus.  

Prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, gender, age, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, or any legally protected status.

normalized_jd:
Distinguishing feature class work involves providing security for computer systems, networks, and health information systems in the Department of Erie County Medical Center Corporation. The incumbent plans and executes security measures to protect computer systems and networks from infiltration, viruses, malware, and cyberattacks. The incumbent monitors computer systems and networks proactively, looking for potentially dangerous threats, determines risk, and performs remediation activities. The incumbent also researches information technology security vulnerabilities and threat trends. Supervision is exercised over lower-level technical and clerical staff. Work is performed under the general supervision of the Healthcare Information Security Officer. Related work is required.  

Typical work activities:  
Monitors enterprise compliance with information technology security policies and procedures for hospital system infrastructure.  
Deploys information technology security controls and processes for hospital system infrastructure.  
Monitors information technology systems and networks, processes security events, and performs risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and security exposures.  
Responds to system and network security-related malicious events and potential computer attacks.  
Coordinates vulnerability management, including virus protection, version control, and patch management.  
Establishes intrusion detection and data loss prevention programs.  
Collaborates in planning infrastructure design, reviewing software acquisition and upgrades to ensure appropriate levels of system and network security.  
Reviews applications and services supplied by cloud service providers for appropriate levels of security control.  
Instructs the workforce on best procedures for information technology security.  
Monitors information technology logs and reports, documents, and monitors security controls, and reports processes.  

Full performance knowledge, skills, abilities, and personal characteristics:  
Thorough knowledge of information security concepts, protocols, and practices.  
Thorough knowledge of information technology security management tools and products.  
Thorough knowledge of enterprise-wide integrated application systems.  
Thorough knowledge of computer security threats and solutions.  
Ability to perform information technology risk assessments and respond to security incidents.  
Thorough knowledge of Erie County Medical Center Corporation policies, procedures, and operations supporting secure data, network systems, and applications.  
Thorough knowledge of Erie County Medical Center Corporation information technology security domains.  
Ability to supervise lower-level staff.  
Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing.  
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a diverse constituency.  
Ability to utilize a variety of electronic software applications.  
Sound professional judgment.  
Capable of performing the essential functions of the position without reasonable accommodation.  

Minimum qualifications:  
Graduation from a regionally accredited or New York State registered college or university with a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a closely related field and two years of experience in systems software, systems analysis, or application programming, including experience in information security;  
OR  
Graduation from a regionally accredited or New York State registered college or university with an Associate’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a closely related field and four years of experience in systems software, systems analysis, or application programming, including two years of experience in information security;  
OR  
An equivalent combination of training and experience as defined within these limits.  

Information security, for the purpose of qualifying applications, is defined as processes designed and implemented to protect information systems and networks from unauthorized access, use, or disruption, utilizing various forms of technology.  

Note: Verifiable part-time and volunteer experience will be prorated toward meeting the full-time experience requirement.

normalized_jd:
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act Information Security Analyst responsible for supporting initiatives at Montefiore Care Management Organization. Individual will work on compliance, creating and implementing relevant policies and procedures to ensure compliant information security processes. Policies provide direction within the organization and are critical for supplying appropriate information for independent security audits by health plans, state, and federal regulatory agencies. Analyst provides outstanding client service and contributes to the organization’s mission utilizing information technology to improve overall user experience while maintaining a Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act secure data environment. Position also assists in performing periodic internal audits to ensure compliance, as well as preparing material for external audits delegated by health plans, state, and federal agencies as needed.  

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, Information Security Analyst level certification preferred, Systems Security Certified Practitioner, Certified Information Systems Auditor, at least five years of experience. Candidate must be well-versed in security concepts and Windows Active Directory. Also requires thorough knowledge of the following operating systems: Windows 10, Windows 7, macOS.  

Department: Care Management Organization Operations  
Bargaining Unit: Nonunion  
Campus: Yonkers  
Address: 100 Corporate Boulevard  
Shift: Day  
Scheduled Hours: 8:30 - 5:30  
Requisition ID: 87820

normalized_jd:
Perkins Coie LLP seeking experienced Information Security Analyst position to perform duties related to keeping Perkins Coie information systems, data, and personnel secure through implementation and maintenance of an effective information security program, specifically Threat and Vulnerability Analyst. Use specialized expertise to implement a proactive program that identifies vulnerabilities in operating systems and applications, incorporates threat intelligence information, and defines a risk-based management program that improves the firm’s security posture. Primary responsibilities include collection, analysis, and reporting of actionable intelligence to the Information Security team, supporting the organization to manage, monitor, and communicate information security risks associated with inherent and residual vulnerabilities that may result in harm or disruption. Work closely with key stakeholders in business support functions to gather requirements, understand priorities, and communicate the impact and context of vulnerabilities. Develop metrics to measure the effectiveness of practices and controls to mitigate threats and vulnerabilities on a periodic basis. Develop dashboards to illustrate the effectiveness of risk mitigation over time. Respond to security incident reports, monitor systems and personnel, and implement appropriate security controls to meet security objectives and standards while allowing flexibility to practice law.  

The ideal candidate must possess work experience in the areas of information security, vulnerability management, application testing, system development, and computer programming, with detailed knowledge of at least one operating system and corresponding security controls, including Microsoft Windows, Apple macOS, and Linux. Candidate must have experience with threat intelligence platform integration, threat information, and vulnerability management programs. Excellent oral and written communication skills are a plus, as well as experience conducting penetration and application vulnerability testing on a variety of platforms. Ability to execute command scripts and programs to obtain desired results is required. Experience with patch management systems such as System Center Configuration Manager and Flexera is needed.  

The position requires two years of information security operations experience. A Bachelor’s degree is preferred. Certifications related to the security domain such as SANS Global Certified Intrusion Analyst or SANS Security Essentials Certification are preferred.

normalized_jd:
Rockstar looking for a dedicated analyst to assist in driving various software security initiatives. The successful candidate is committed to keeping the game service fun for players and defending against cheaters, hackers, exploiters, and troublemakers. If you are interested in creatively building a defensive wall against cheaters, this may be the job for you.  

Job responsibilities:  
Support day-to-day operation of anti-cheat and anti-fraud programs.  
Tune and support security and anti-cheat measures in the game client and supporting backend services.  
Develop solutions and process automation wherever possible.  
Prepare detailed reports related to investigations and intelligence analysis.  
Create tools and utilities to facilitate the anti-cheat program.  
Research and implement new anti-cheat mechanisms.  

Qualifications:  
Technical background in the following: C++, Cheat Engine, Interactive Disassembler.  
Ability to absorb extremely technical information in a limited time frame.  
Knowledge of databases.  
Knowledge of client-server and peer-to-peer gaming architecture.  
Intense thirst for knowledge.

normalized_jd:
X End provides payment infrastructure across South East Asia, focusing on Indonesia and the Philippines, processing payments, powering marketplaces, distributing payroll, providing loans, providing Know Your Customer solutions to prevent fraud, and helping businesses grow exponentially. It serves customers by providing a suite of world-class Application Programming Interfaces for e-commerce platform integration and easy-to-use applications for individuals, entrepreneurs, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises, and enterprises alike. The main focus is building advanced payment rails in South East Asia with a clear goal in mind: to make payments across South East Asia simple, secure, and easy for everyone. 

It serves thousands of businesses ranging from Small and Medium-sized Enterprises to multinational enterprises, processing millions of transactions monthly, and has been growing rapidly since its inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month. Backed by global top ten Venture Capital firms, it is proud to be featured among the fastest-growing companies in Y Combinator. 

The role is to build a fast, reliable, secure, regulation-compliant platform for peer-to-peer merchants in Indonesia. The peer-to-peer payment platform product is expected to build exciting products for peer-to-peer merchants, providing various unique customized features for the peer-to-peer industry. Several challenges add excitement. First, it is expected to comply with financial regulations in Indonesia, placing us in a great position to understand and deliver requirements to stakeholders, peer-to-peer merchants, and regulatory bodies. Second, the current team focuses on integrating and enabling new payment channels, standardizing Application Programming Interfaces to be simpler and more robust, with countless opportunities for software engineers to build the best platform for peer-to-peer merchants in Indonesia. Third, there is a technical challenge to increase the speed, reliability, scalability, and security of the product using various efficient testing and monitoring tools, improving code, reducing technical debt, and designing scalable solutions for the best payment platform. Finally, working with an awesome team of four to five awesome engineers, the team currently has robust process standards to maintain team effectiveness, looking forward to always making continuous improvements to adapt to future situations. 

The team values various cultures, amplifying excitement day-to-day. Outcomes include understanding customer needs and requirements, prioritizing builds based on customer impact, contributing to the team’s technical roadmap execution, making sure the roadmap is delivered on time, producing and ensuring team delivery of high-quality, regulation-compliant products, contributing to team organization, product scalability, reliability, and security improvements, maintaining team documentation, leveraging documentation quality over time, leveraging team engineering skills, knowledge sharing, actively improving knowledge, following best practices, being able to consistently give structured feedback and direction to peers, accepting feedback for the sake of growth, and doing whatever it takes to make X End Group successful. 

Looking for a successful track record in developing quality software products and shipping production-ready software in fast-growing environments, with one year of experience developing, designing, and deploying large-scale applications, and a successful track record of making sure products meet company standards and are delivered on time. Expertise in JavaScript, familiarity with TypeScript, familiarity with Representational State Transfer, Publish–Subscribe design patterns, experience with relational Structured Query Language database schema design and query optimization, experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end test frameworks such as Jest, Mocha, SuperTest, and Cucumber, familiarity with Scrum Agile development methodology, familiarity with cloud computing services such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, and Alibaba Cloud, familiarity with monitoring tools such as Datadog, Sentry, and Splunk, and a strong desire to independently learn engineering skills and share with others. 

Software engineers should love challenges, problem-solving, and care deeply about building for customers and improving customer experience. Product experience includes problem-solving using root cause analysis, experience writing code documentation, strong communication skills, problem-solving in teams, caring to solve for customers first, building what customers want, and thinking from the right customer perspective. The easiest way to demonstrate mastery is to make ambitious goals and execute no matter what stands in the way, taking challenges willingly, being trusted to execute, being trusted to get things done right the first time, quickly hitting deadlines, enjoying work, thinking work is fun, not taking oneself too seriously, measuring oneself against the best, believing feedback is the breakfast of champions, following the golden rule, being remarkable, naturally talking to people, and being awesome. If someone cannot be found, it is unlikely they are the right fit.

normalized_jd:
Essential duty responsibility manage and maintain business systems within Azure-based virtual desktop environment including virtual network, Active Directory domain, server operating system, desktop software application installation, patching, and workstation management. Manage and maintain virtual cloud storage gateway systems offering exceptional customer experience, troubleshooting, resolving, and escalating client problems to completion. Perform change requests based on client needs, utilize case tracking software to create, monitor, update, and close client cases, monitor and remedy server health issues, create and maintain process documentation to support staff involved in internal computer software and network support.  

Required qualification: two to three years related prior technical experience, compassion, positive outlook, excellent troubleshooting skills, experience administering networks in Microsoft Windows Active Directory multi-office environments, excellent knowledge of Windows domain, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, experience with Microsoft DFS, experience with Azure, ability to self-manage and focus on competing priorities, strong written and verbal business communication skills, willingness to learn new skills, night and weekend work may be required for system upgrades and maintenance, ability to lift fifty pounds when moving computer hardware, vehicle, car insurance, and valid driver’s license based on travel requirements, knowledge of Autodesk software licensing is a plus, application packaging, administrative image creation, and patch management experience is a plus, Microsoft certification, Microsoft Most Valuable Professional, Microsoft Certified Solutions Developer is a plus.  

Microdesk, Microdesk Design Technology Consultancy, thirteen offices globally, provides architecture, engineering, construction, and manufacturing industries premiere consulting, implementation, support, and training solutions using today’s leading technology products: Autodesk, Google, IBM, Microsoft. Dedicated to fostering professional growth and development of employees. Microdesk Incorporated is an equal opportunity employer.  

Benefits offered: fast-paced dynamic environment, learning and growing technically becomes part of career, Microdesk dedicated to fostering professional growth and development of employees, Microdesk offers highly competitive salary, comprehensive benefit package including Aetna medical, company-funded Health Reimbursement Arrangement, Ameritas dental, EyeMed vision, health and dependent care flexible spending account, commuter spending account option, company-paid life, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability insurance, Safe Harbor 401(k) profit sharing plan with thirty percent match, generous paid time off and sick time policy. Microdesk is an equal opportunity employer.

normalized_jd:
Align thirty-year, many world-leading firm relied on Align, trusted solution provider, center of excellence, advisory, infrastructure design, build, delivery, managed service, actively seeking innovative minds to establish and strengthen team to deliver high-quality, state-of-the-art technology solutions to enterprise and boutique clients. Seeking challenging projects today, fascinating company leveraging exceptional team, long track record of success, want to hear today.  

Position overview: exciting growth opportunity for motivated entry-level Desktop Support Technician with strong customer service skills, basic desktop troubleshooting experience. Person to perform level-one helpdesk end-user support, install, move, add, change iMac work, installation of monitor arm, desktop, laptop break/fix work, office facility support, administration, maintenance including changing light bulbs, assisting with basic office maintenance, ordering office supplies. Great opportunity for technically savvy entry-level candidate looking to start career in technical support. Person must be willing to also perform office administration and facility functions.  

Learning position reports to Align Managed Service team, Level-One Desktop Support Engineer, based in New York office/site, client site, first shift position Monday–Friday, 8:30–5:30 PM.  

Responsibilities: provide level-one end-user support, disconnect/reconnect workstation, install monitor arm bracket hardware, break/fix support, reset security credentials, order office supplies, answer main phone number, help route calls, greet visitors, responsible for office maintenance, changing light bulbs, basic repair, painting touch-up, coordinating building office upkeep, complicated facility issues. Learn to assist configuration support, help users with mobile device setup, mail, calendar, contacts, assist users to configure dual monitors, configure local network printers, learn to assist remote access support, assign temporary credentials, assist users configuring remote access Virtual Private Network, assist users with web-based email, learn to assist Microsoft Office support, Outlook questions, help users with calendar synchronization, configure offline vs. online folders, help users locate contacts, customize views, user preferences, assist users with spam settings, assist users with business rules, office cleanup, user mailbox direction, help users inserting attachments like documents, images, links, Word questions, Excel questions excluding advanced formulas, macros, Visual Basic for Applications, PowerPoint questions, assist with animation, symbols, pictures, embedded video URLs.  

Incident management: assign ticket category, priority, workflow, update incident troubleshooting steps, follow incident requests, user inquiries, escalate complaints, ensure excellent client service, reference knowledge base, known issues, ask assistance from subject matter experts, schedule callbacks, set appointments, troubleshooting past tickets, request internal resources, named third party iMac conducting physical audit, planning uninstall of computer equipment including peripherals, cables, configuring desktop/laptop network connections, testing scripts, running and reinstallation of equipment to agreed standards, solve technical problems with desktop/laptop computer hardware/software, printers, post-move work, Bloomberg equipment, keyboard terminal along with stock trader interface setup.  

Qualifications: ideal candidate with basic personal computer troubleshooting skills, basic helpdesk install, move, add, change iMac experience would be a plus. Must be tech-savvy, willing to roll up sleeves, perform physical work around office, ability to learn support. Candidate must be willing and able to perform basic facility repairs: changing light bulbs, scheduling maintenance, building touch-up paint on walls, hanging monitors/artwork on walls, cleaning desks for new employees, helping move desks/furniture. Role also includes ordering office supplies, maintaining supply closet, keeping kitchen clean and orderly, ordering coffee. Candidate must be client-focused, comfortable interfacing with clients, able to maintain high level of service, excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to be prompt and courteous. Must have basic knowledge of the following: Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows 10, macOS, Microsoft Office, personal computer hardware terminology, Microsoft Exchange 2010, disk imaging platforms, Virtual Private Network clients, mobile device support, iPhone, Android devices, remote connectivity tools, Ethernet network topology knowledge, ticketing systems, ServiceNow preferred plus, experience rebuilding workstations would be helpful. Able to present positive attitude, end-user focused, client satisfaction, providing solutions, strong problem-solving skills with emphasis on quick problem resolution, attentive, detail-oriented. Must be able to occasionally accommodate flexible work schedules, may include nights, weekends, holidays as required. Ability to focus on multiple tasks simultaneously, ability to determine problems, troubleshoot as needed, take guidance, learn from experienced engineers. Relevant certifications in area a plus. Must be able to lift fifty pounds.  

Align is a dynamic, flexible place to work, offering professional, unparalleled opportunity to train in leading technology, make an impact within industry, control destiny. Flawless track record delivering technical solutions, established longstanding relationships, impressive client list, global Fortune 1000, small and medium business clients, work across diverse list of industries including financial services, life sciences, pharmaceutical, healthcare, retail.

normalized_jd:
System Administrator responsible for effective provisioning, installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of system hardware, software, and related infrastructure. Individual participates in technical research and development to enable continuing innovation within infrastructure. Individual ensures system hardware, operating system software, and system-related procedures adhere to organizational standards and guidelines. Essential responsibility: install new or rebuild existing servers, configure hardware, peripheral services, directory settings, and storage in accordance with standard project and operational requirements. Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures. Contribute to maintaining system standards. Perform daily system monitoring, verifying integrity and availability of hardware, server resources, and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs and backups. Apply operating system patches and upgrades on a regular basis, upgrade administrative tools and utilities, configure and add new services as necessary. Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Configure CPU, memory, and disk partitions as required. Document company’s existing system architecture and technology portfolio, make recommendations for improvement or alternatives, conduct research on emerging technologies, support system development efforts, and recommend technologies to increase cost-effectiveness and system flexibility. Develop, document, communicate, and enforce policies standardizing system software as necessary. Develop and execute test plans to check infrastructure and system technical performance, report findings, and make recommendations for improvement. Provide guidance to junior members of the team. Duties as assigned.  

Required Qualifications:  
Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.  
Experience: Minimum seven years of experience working in the field.  

Preferred Qualifications:  
Higher education, working experience in corporate environments, multi-unit environment experience.  

Required Skills:  
Proven experience in system and network design and development. Solid grounding in core enterprise applications including server virtualization, data center design and management, directory design and maintenance. In-depth technical knowledge of networks, personal computer platforms, and operating systems including versions of Windows Server, Microsoft Active Directory, email systems, and enterprise applications. Working knowledge of cloud environments including Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services. Strong knowledge of software evaluation principles and practices. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills. Excellent written, verbal communication, and presentation skills. Excellent technical support and documentation skills. Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills. Ability to be adaptable, dependable, and handle multiple priorities simultaneously. Ability to conduct research on emerging technology trends, standards, and products as required. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with demonstrated ability to juggle multiple competing tasks. Ability to work independently and in a team environment, maintaining collaborative relationships. Demonstrated ability to show a high level of service responsiveness to internal customers. Must have a proven, consistent track record showing ability to work at all levels within the organization. Must display a high level of energy, self-motivation, be detail-oriented, thorough, and possess exceptional organizational skills.  

Working Conditions:  
Must be available to work nights and weekends as required by business needs. Regular work requires a great deal of sitting for extended periods of time.  

Additional Information:  
The Culinary Institute of America is committed to supporting employees with a substantial and meaningful package of benefits. We believe supporting employees with benefits assists in work-life balance. Benefits offered are based on position type and status. Benefits offered may include medical and prescription drug plans, dental plans, vision plans, life insurance, home, auto, and pet insurance, short- and long-term disability plans, generous paid time off programs including paid holidays, retirement savings plans with 403(b) company contributions, employee assistance programs, and tuition assistance programs.

normalized_jd:
System Administrator responsible for creating and maintaining the company computer system network. System Administrator responsible for determining the organization’s needs in terms of computer network infrastructure and implementing a plan. This involves defining requirements for end-user device connectivity, network services, maintaining hardware systems, and keeping software up to date. The System Administrator is ultimately responsible for business continuity, maximizing system uptime, and ensuring a viable disaster recovery plan is in place.  

Job responsibilities include developing and updating network environment architecture documentation, monitoring and maintaining business-critical network services, troubleshooting software, hardware, and network issues, supporting the help desk system, enforcing required cybersecurity elements, and backing up and restoring the organization’s data and file systems. Directly related contractor and consultant coordination, company site staff, System Administrators, and support specialists are also part of the role.  

Education requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or similar, or significant experience in the role. User support, networking, and security knowledge, skills, and abilities are required. Must be well-versed in computer hardware and software, knowledgeable in network and cybersecurity technology best practices, and equally comfortable with a do-it-yourself or outsourced approach to deployment and problem-solving. Must be a strong communicator in order to effectively communicate and advise staff on network and computer issues, a methodical problem solver with an aptitude for learning quickly and adapting to new skills, patient, resourceful, and able to inspire global collaboration and foster a positive work environment.  

United States citizen. Please note: This description is designed to cover, but not contain, a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, and responsibilities required of the employee. Job duties, responsibilities, and activities may change over time without notice. Oro Lia is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, citizenship, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected category. We encourage veterans and people with disabilities to apply.

normalized_jd:
Primary purpose of the department is to provide an excellent experience to the customer through agile delivery of technology needed for everyday business life. Aspire to be continually recognized as the best operation in the technology sector, delivering strategic objectives of the organization. Forward branch is the client-facing part. Main role is to interact with business users, ensuring provision of application services needed to be able to do the job within Forward. In the Information Technology Project Management, I am responsible for ensuring successful execution of the Dark Matter project using agile methodology. Role includes taking ownership of tasks assigned from the point of assignment to agreement reached, ensuring completion and bringing tasks to logical closure. Communicate and report proactively to colleagues, leadership, and others in the organization using appropriate means of communication. Focus on time management for timely and quick completion of allotted tasks, quick response to communication, and attendance at meetings and appointments scheduled to start on time. Focus on self-development in technical and soft skills, taking initiative, leveraging multiple platforms and opportunities at disposal, and demonstrating continuous improvement in the role. Primary technical interface with the customer to meet and surpass Service Level Agreement expectations. Able to handle close to ninety incident requests and demands for support. Create automation to remove repetitive low-value tasks. Achieve target objectives and first-time fix technology demands. Troubleshoot technical actions and provide technical assistance in response to user demands via portal, phone, and email. Provide first line issue resolution for incidents needing engineering consideration and simple break-fix resolution. Proactively triage trends, changes, and thresholding for tier one incident response and resolution across capabilities. Escalation to Technology Operations and Security Operations for investigation, diagnosis, and solving where possible, escalating and reporting changes to Technology Operations and Security Operations sections. New service requests include providing advanced troubleshooting and resolution, device upgrades, end-user software and hardware, and solving user profile issues. Responsible for patching front-end systems. Responsible for creating shared drives and managing technical escalations. Responsible for granting permission for folder access and managing technical escalations. Responsible for granting access to applications and managing technical escalations. Responsible for resolving issues with file transfers for users and managing technical escalations. Responsible for managing technology tools and managing technical escalations. Build internal solution knowledge base, technical documentation, and manuals and policies in areas of expertise. Coordinate with third-party service providers for timely repair and system maintenance under agreements and warranties. Repair minor flaws in hardware covered under warranty and manage technical escalations. Develop periodic service desk reports on issue trends and statistics in areas of responsibility.  

Required qualifications: To bring the dream to life, you will need a Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Relevant professional certification would be an advantage. Six years of experience in a correlated area. Strong knowledge of general areas within the service desk domain.

Main key responsibility: Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with users and developers, design end-to-end customer journey, illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps, develop user interface mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate applications’ and sites’ functions and appearance, prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders, create and develop design language, identify and troubleshoot user experience problems (e.g., responsiveness), conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback, adhere to style standards regarding fonts, colors, and images. Six arrange and monitor implementation of site marking event together with Site Supervisor and Project Administrator, prepare and submit documents for building permit.  
Eight arrange and monitor implementation of vendor inventory check, results submitted to Purchasing.  
Nine create material request sheet for submission to vendor for materials and services.  
Ten explain to vendor regarding task responsibilities, detailed limitations, work sequence, and targets to be achieved.  
Eleven coordinate creation of shop drawings, check and submit to Designer for approval.  
Twelve coordinate Project Administrator to distribute shop drawings via Trello and hard copy to project.  
Thirteen provide direction and control to Site Supervisor regarding work plan and targets to be achieved.  
Fourteen control and supervise work in accordance with planning.  
Fifteen minimize errors causing extra cost.  
Sixteen hold and lead weekly meeting with vendors involved to discuss realization of last week’s work plan, work plan for next week, obstacles faced, and solutions.  
Seventeen hold weekly meeting with client to discuss realization of last week’s work plan, work plan for next week, obstacles faced related to client, construction management, building management, external contractors, and authorities.  
Eighteen create and distribute minutes of meeting.  
Nineteen create weekly report form with work progress photos according to company format and send to client and construction management via email.  
Twenty create weekly progress form with work achievement weighting value according to company format and send to client and construction management via email.  
Twenty-one conduct periodic check of stages of work in project to ensure work results meet company standards.  
Twenty-two coordinate quality control to check materials and goods made in vendor workshop to ensure materials and goods sent to project meet company standards.  
Twenty-three coordinate Project Administrator to prepare work progress report, request client signature, and submit to Finance.  
Twenty-four submit required documents compiled by Project Administrator for closeout documentation.  
Twenty-five prepare required documents to process return of fit-out deposit.  
Twenty-six record return of company inventory items sent to project.

normalized_jd:
Love to sell and need money? UD Sinar Jaya Company, engaged in the distribution of motorbike spare parts, located in Gading Serpong, Tangerang, requires reliable salespeople to expand the distribution network. Salespersons who like to socialize, like to meet new people, are communicative, have initiative, integrity, high motivation, great selling skills, and want a high commission percentage are welcome.  

Job description:  
Taking orders from shops and outlets according to predetermined categories in the Jabodetabek area. Responsible for achieving monthly sales targets, creating visit and sales reports, developing marketing areas, maintaining good relationships with customers, and looking for new shops or outlets with good sales potential.  

Requirements:  
Young and energetic, maximum age thirty years, high level of mobility, neat appearance, able to communicate well, good motivation, commitment to success, liking challenges, ambition to achieve targets, understanding the field of retail Fast-Moving Consumer Goods general distribution in particular, experience in retail Fast-Moving Consumer Goods sales of at least two years, mastery of salesmanship techniques, presentation skills, communicative, motorbike driving license category C, domicile in the area around Gading Serpong and surroundings preferred.  

Benefits:  
Large commission profit from product sales, quite high compared to similar companies, supported by marketing kits given, price lists, product samples, pictures, promotions, and other things that make selling easier. No risk borne in case of default when a customer fails to pay for the product. Easy to sell, sales proven for years, spread across Jabodetabek.  

Full employment status: permanent, full-time, after passing the probationary period.

normalized_jd:
Nation leading local health department seeks Security Analyst to join award winning innovative technology team revolutionizing public health. New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) uses latest technology for enterprise-wide application solutions and groundbreaking work to promote and protect New Yorkers’ health and improve DOHMH’s business operations.  

Duties include but are not limited to:  
- Lead Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) architecture design and implementation.  
- Create custom alert schema, reports, and custom dashboards.  
- Develop security visibility by reviewing existing applications and conducting comprehensive threat reviews.  
- Evaluate and analyze relevant data points.  
- Resolve client remote access requests.  
- Provide Tier Two and Tier Three support.  
- Conduct security assessments, vulnerability testing, and risk analysis.  
- Perform internal and external security audits.  
- Analyze security breaches, identify root causes, and verify security of third-party vendors.  
- Collaborate to meet security requirements.  
- Document results of security risk analyses and formally present to the agency.  
- Coordinate with business owners, Project Managers, Incident Response Handlers, Digital Forensic Experts, Network Engineers, System Engineers, and Web Application Engineers.  
- Explore and report specific security risk issues in depth.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
- Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and four years of satisfactory full-time experience related to project or policy work required for the particular position, or equivalent education and experience.  

Preferred skills:  
- Two years of experience managing, monitoring, and maintaining Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) technology, including use case creation, dashboard tuning, and log source configuration.  
- Two years of experience supporting enterprise remote access.  
- Experience supporting enterprise antivirus systems.  
- Experience using vulnerability management tools.  
- Experience in large enterprise security planning, design, configuration, installation, troubleshooting, integration, security performance monitoring, product maintenance, security product configuration, and enhancement.  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  
- Excellent presentation skills and ability to present material on information security awareness.  
- Ability to handle multiple tasks under tight deadlines.  
- Network and host Internet Protocol (IP) support understanding preferred.  

Certificates preferred for the position:  
- Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)  
- Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)  
- Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH)  
- CompTIA Security+  

Additional information:  
Important note to candidates: Please note that if called for an interview, you will be required to bring to the interview a copy of original documentation that establishes identity and employment eligibility, such as a valid United States passport, permanent resident card (green card), driver’s license, and proof of education according to the education requirement for the civil service title, current resume, and proof of address for New York City residency dated within the last sixty days (such as a recent utility bill, telephone, cable, or mobile phone bill). Additional documentation may be required to evaluate qualifications outlined in the posting’s minimum qualification requirement section. Examples of additional documentation may include but are not limited to college transcripts, experience verification, and professional or trade licenses.  

If interviewed and selected, candidates will be contacted to schedule a non-boarding appointment. At the time of the appointment, you will be asked to produce original documents along with your original Social Security card.  

Loan forgiveness: The federal government provides student loan forgiveness through the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program (PSLF). Qualifying public service employees working at DOHMH qualify as public service employees and may be able to take advantage of the program if working full-time and meeting program requirements. Please visit the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program site to view eligibility requirements and cancellation information.  

To apply: Apply online with a cover letter. In the Job ID search bar, enter Job ID number 343720. We appreciate your interest. Thank you to all applicants for applying. Only candidates under consideration will be contacted.  

The New York City Health Department is committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and culturally responsive workforce. We strongly encourage people of color, people with disabilities, veterans, women, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and gender nonconforming persons to apply. Applicants will be considered without regard to actual or perceived race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, age, or prior record of arrest, as prohibited by law.  

Residency requirement: New York City residency is required for this position.

normalized_jd:
Exciting opportunity to join a growing organization department located in Endwell, New York. Visions Federal Credit Union, a four billion asset credit union, with locations in New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. Sign-on bonus.  

The successful candidate will use data collected from a variety of cyber defense tools, e.g., Software Engineering Institute, malicious intrusion detection systems, alert systems, firewalls, and network traffic logs, to analyze events occurring within the environment for the purpose of mitigating threats. Investigate, analyze, and respond to cyber incidents within the network environment.  

As a Senior member of the Cybersecurity Incident Response Team, perform assessments of systems and networks within the network environment to measure the effectiveness of defense-in-depth architecture against known vulnerabilities.  

Education, Certification, and Experience:  
1. College diploma or university degree in the field of Computer Science, Information Science, Management Information Systems, or Business Administration.  
2. Two years of related work experience.  
3. Two Information Security certifications administered by Global Information Assurance Certification or Risk and Information Systems Control preferred.  
4. Experience in incident response procedures.  
5. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  

Note: Candidate will be required to take a cybersecurity skills assessment as part of the interview process.  

Male/Female, Disabled, Veteran, Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer.

normalized_jd:
Corporate team may provide direct care and still touch people's lives in a real, substantial way. Service provided contributes greatly to the overall patient and member experience, supporting the reputation for excellence and responsibility. Jackson Health System is seeking an Information Security Analyst, Incident Response, Vulnerability Management, Penetration Testing, Event Management, Security Information and Event Management experience.  

The ideal candidate will be part of the Information Security team and must have a strong technical foundation in interpreting security events, the capability to analyze large sets of data, and a genuine curiosity and passion for information security investigation.  

The individual within this role will monitor, investigate, and interpret Security Information and Event Management logs, Managed Security Service Provider alarms, and information security events; investigate and document gaps in existing controls; create documentation, policies, and procedures as needed; document investigations; participate in incident response activities; analyze and interpret malware, exploits, and threat activity; perform audits of information system controls; and conduct regular vulnerability scans of systems and applications.  

Qualification requirements: Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline or equivalent experience, three years of information technology experience, and one year of full-time information security-related experience. Working knowledge of application and infrastructure security solutions, firewalls, intrusion detection and prevention systems, network security, password management, data encryption, and access control.  

Preferred skills: strong Windows networking and malware analysis background, ability to prioritize competing work assignments, initiative to complete tasks, working knowledge of incident handling, security frameworks, and best practices, experience in vulnerability testing, experience in penetration testing, strong interpersonal and communication skills. Certified Ethical Hacker, Global Information Assurance Certification Incident Handler, Global Information Assurance Certification Certified Intrusion Analyst, Global Information Assurance Certification Security Essentials, or other security certifications preferred.  

Benefits: truly value staff and acknowledge contributions by offering employee and family health coverage, competitive salary, employer-contributed pension plan, generous paid time off, tuition reimbursement, 403(b) retirement plan.  

Connect with us if you are ready to apply. Connect with us to learn about upcoming opportunities and events at Jackson Health System.

normalized_jd:
AutoReqID 153469BR Job Description PepsiCo PepsiCo global food and beverage leader operating in two hundred countries. Product portfolio includes twenty-two world-famous billion-dollar brands Gatorade, Quaker, LIFEWTR, Lay’s. Make hundreds of enjoyable food and beverage products loved throughout the world. Innovation is critical to the way we impact the market as well as the community around the globe. We believe in the value of product, people, and planet, and strive to make a difference by creating solutions that leave a lasting positive footprint. Culture driven by employees, two-day dynamic, full, passionate team embracing new ideas and collaborative spirit. PepsiCo makes us unique and makes us better.  

Functional Description Network Three Zero associates worldwide focus on delivering and supporting capabilities to improve business processes, enable associates to connect and collaborate easily, collect and mine data for analytical insights, and enhance performance across all aspects of the PepsiCo value chain. Expect PepsiCo new hires to be afforded the opportunity for beneficial and meaningful work experience on one of five project groups. Please let the PepsiCo campus representative know the following discipline of interest. You may express interest in one project:  

Coordination Plan: Manages delivery of technology projects.  
Development and Design: Develops, configures, and tests technology solutions to meet business requirements.  
Business Analyst: Uses knowledge of business processes to analyze options, define requirements, and create functional designs for technology solutions to business problems.  
Data Analytics: Develops reporting and analytical solutions to turn data into business insights, includes management of reusable, consistent data foundations.  
Information Security: Plans and implements security measures to protect PepsiCo from cyberattacks and ensure the integrity of PepsiCo data and systems.  

Network available in Plano, Texas location. Take note: final work placement will be in one of the following two locations. Specific location is not guaranteed pre-offer; actual working location will be determined and identified at the point of offer: Plano, Texas or Purchase/White Plains, New York.  

Qualification Requirements: Looking for candidates currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Business Engineering focus, or related majors may be considered. Minimum GPA 3.0. Related experience is a plus. Ability to learn new technology and process information quickly. Ability to adapt to changing timelines and sequences. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  

Minimum Qualifications: Candidates are expected to be completing their final year of undergraduate study and to hold a Bachelor’s degree prior to the intended full-time start date. Legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future work authorization or visa sponsorship. Employment is contingent upon passing a drug screen and background investigation.  

Relocation Eligible: Eligible for standard relocation. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an equal opportunity employer. Female, minority, disability, protected veteran, sexual orientation, and gender identity.  

If you would like information on Equal Employment Opportunity rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available Equal Employment Opportunity Law and Equal Employment Opportunity Law Supplement documents. To view the PepsiCo Equal Employment Opportunity policy, please view the Pay Transparency Statement.
