normalized_jd:
Information Governance Analyst provides day-to-day service support for firm client needs relating to assuring electronic information is secured and monitored. The Electronic Information Governance Team is responsible for assessing and monitoring group processes, administering access, and transferring electronic information. Review of privileged environments is a key operational responsibility, focusing on assuring secure processes are in place for firm-critical third parties around electronic information management. Relevant processes include review of client information storage, access management, privileged access review, legal hold management, and inventorying data processes. Workflow operations relate to compliance with client regulatory requirements. Responsibilities directly provide services relating to governance assurance in handling firm electronic information, including assessing and handling matters specific to information within various areas of the firm. Periodic review of business unit administered access management, periodic review of privileged access groups, and periodic review and assessment of third-party privileged access to firm client information are required. Ownership and upkeep of data maps, that is, workflows within the firm handling personal information, review and monitoring of sensitive data flows to ensure requirements are legitimate, and review of outside client guidelines relating to requirements for information security and information management are included. Coordination with various teams ensures compliance. Legal hold management is responsible for implementation of legal holds, managing related legal hold archiving systems, and processing data management. Attorneys move data transfers and assist with information governance compliance needs for firm clients as needed.  

Required skills: Bachelor’s degree required, at least four years of direct experience working in information governance, information assurance, and compliance, and at least five years of experience in a legal professional services environment. Information assurance and compliance certification preferred. Expertise in principles and best practices of information governance assurance, broad knowledge of compliance tools and processes, experience writing policies and procedures, and knowledge of relevant laws and best practices relating to information assurance are required. Experience responding to internal and external client audits, ability to handle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously, professionalism, client service orientation, attention to detail, sense of urgency, and superior analytical and problem-solving ability are necessary. Work requirements include on-site presence during normal working hours, availability as necessary outside normal working hours, and a flexible schedule as required. Required to monitor and respond to email and phone calls after hours and on weekends.  

Disclaimer: The preceding job description is designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job. Required experience applies.

normalized_jd:
Information Security Analyst role you will collaborate on initiatives related to Information Security compliance. You will have the opportunity to work with a progressive, forward-thinking team that is comprised of a core group of Security Compliance professionals as well as an extended network of teammates throughout the organization. You will work with others to identify and remediate risk on the front line of a rapidly evolving Software-as-a-Service offering, while helping to continuously improve and mature a security program whose mandate is to mitigate risk and demonstrate compliance at speed and scale.  

Interaction with peers as well as professional development opportunities will expose you to new normal application architecture and operations, including Development Operations methodology, cloud service adoption, automation, and security controls. You will be part of a security team that strives to maintain ongoing partnerships focused on safely achieving business objectives, rather than a security team that is seen as a blocker by the rest of the organization.  

Specific duties: The primary mission is to work with Product Management, Engineering, Infrastructure, and Operations teams in order to identify potential risks to the confidentiality, integrity, and security availability of customer data and systems. You will collaborate on potential risk treatment plans as well as projects to improve the security posture of the company. You will also serve as a resource to others regarding security compliance requirements, fostering a culture of security throughout the organization.  

You will work with compliance-focused members of the team as well as engineering teammates to evaluate and continuously improve monitoring and response mechanisms underpinning the security strategy. Responsibilities include the following: coordinate and manage all aspects of vulnerability identification and remediation, including network and application penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and findings surfacing as part of the Software Development Life Cycle; emerging threat and possible exposure within the CommerceHub environment; third-party software security updates; coordinate with product teams and infrastructure to ensure periodic and ad hoc security patching is implemented in a timely and comprehensive manner; monitor and maintain company-hosted source security event information; serve as the primary point of contact for outsourced capabilities; identify monitoring changes necessitated by expansion, alteration, or decommissioning of systems; identify findings from manual and automated reviews of various logs; coordinate security incidents per the CommerceHub incident response plan; operate the Information Security training program, including annual security awareness training, security incident response training, training orientation for security advocates, secure development training for software engineers, internal awareness campaigns across multiple channels (blog, online, in-person training, posters), and social engineering exercises.  

Assist Information Security teammates responsible for the vendor risk management program to ensure access to CommerceHub systems by internal personnel, third-party contractors, and vendors is managed effectively. Monitor access management processes and identify opportunities to automate and streamline security monitoring and controls, working with technical resources to implement solutions.  

Requirements: The successful candidate for this position must meet the following requirements: driven, polished, technology-proficient professional with hands-on experience collaborating with extended teams in fast-paced environments; results-oriented and able to motivate others; demonstrated ability to create clarity and action in ambiguity; challenge assumptions; familiarity with basic methodologies associated with vulnerability scanning and penetration testing; familiarity with enterprise cloud service security best practices; familiarity with enterprise logging and monitoring platforms in mixed Windows and Linux environments; familiarity with information risk control frameworks.  

Education and experience: Bachelor’s degree in Information Assurance or related discipline, Business degree with similar focus; three to five years of experience working in Information Technology or Information Assurance-related fields; strong multitasking and effective time management skills; strong written and verbal communication skills.  

Additionally, knowledge and/or experience in the following is a plus: Certified Information Systems Security Professional or equivalent certification; knowledge of customer technology challenges within the retail e-commerce industry; experience designing and driving implementation of security controls in Software-as-a-Service web application delivery models; project management experience.

normalized_jd:
Civil Service Title Investigator Two Discipline Bureau Network Technology Telecommunication Service Nippon Telegraph and Telephone aim to provide Department of Health and Mental Hygiene program staff, external partner, provider, and citizen relying on system service with a highly reliable and available network infrastructure service for voice and data, resilient centralized data center service, application hosting, database, customer service-oriented secure computing environment, and delivery of information technology products and resources designed, engineered, and implemented to support and facilitate agency initiatives.  

Responsibilities include performing sensitive investigations and studies concerning administrative misconduct or incompetency in the childcare field, inspector compliance with security policy, internal security, conducting security surveys of childcare field operations, equipment, and facilities, developing security plans for childcare field inspectors, planning and coordinating investigation schedules and assignments, performing imaging and encryption on desktop computers, laptops, tablets, iOS, and Android devices, performing computer diagnostics and troubleshooting processes to resolve network hardware and software errors, performing personal computer maintenance, hardware and software installation and upgrades, system support, equipment salvage, inventory tracking, network engineering, systems engineering, and web application engineering.  

Explore and report specific security risks and issues in depth.  

Minimum qualification requirements:  
1. Four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent and four years of satisfactory full-time experience in one of the following fields: accounting, auditing, correction administration, criminal justice administration, planning, forensic science, inspection, investigation, law enforcement, personnel administration, police science, security, or major operational area of the agency.  
2. Appointment may be made with a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and three years of education and experience equivalent.  

Preferred skills:  
- Ability to travel throughout the five boroughs  
- Operating system knowledge: Windows, iOS, Android  
- Local Area Network, Wide Area Network knowledge  
- Help desk experience  
- Verbal communication and phone skills  
- Customer service  
- Personal computer, laptop, and mobile device network proficiency  
- Voice over Internet Protocol phone installation and troubleshooting  
- Network system support  
- Understanding of Tier Two and Tier Three support experience in large enterprises  
- Security planning, design, configuration, installation, troubleshooting, integration, security performance monitoring, product maintenance, security product configuration, and enhancement  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills  
- Excellent presentation skills and ability to present material around information security awareness  
- Ability to handle multiple tasks and tight deadlines  

Additional information:  
Important note to candidates: Please note that if called for an interview, you are required to bring to the interview a copy and the original documentation of documents that establish identity and employment eligibility (valid United States passport, permanent resident card/green card, driver’s license), proof of education according to the education requirement, civil service title, current resume, proof of address and New York City residency dated within the last sixty days (recent utility bill, telephone, cable, or mobile phone bill). Additional documentation may be required to evaluate qualifications outlined in the posting’s minimum qualification requirement section (for example, limited college transcript, experience verification, professional trade license).  

If interviewed and selected, candidates will be contacted to schedule a non-boarding appointment. At the time of appointment, you will be asked to produce original documents along with your original Social Security card.  

Loan forgiveness: The federal government provides student loan forgiveness through the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program for qualifying public service employees. Working for the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene qualifies as public service employment. You may be able to take advantage of this program if working full-time and meeting program requirements. Please visit the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program site to view eligibility requirements and cancellation information.  

To apply: Apply online with a cover letter. In the Job ID search bar, enter Job ID number 356184. We appreciate your interest. Thank you to applicants who apply; candidates under consideration will be contacted.  

The New York City Health Department is committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and culturally responsive workforce. We strongly encourage people of color, people with disabilities, veterans, women, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and gender nonconforming persons to apply. Applicants are considered without regard to actual or perceived race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, age, or prior record of arrest, as prohibited by law.  

Residency requirement: New York City residency is generally required within ninety days of appointment. However, city employees in certain titles who have worked for the city for two continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of the interview.

normalized_jd:
Autoreqid 154122 BR job description PepsiCo PepsiCo global food and beverage leader operating in two hundred countries. Product portfolio includes twenty-two world-famous billion-dollar brands Gatorade, Quaker, LIFEWTR, Lay’s, making hundreds of enjoyable food and beverage products loved throughout the world. Innovation is critical to the way we impact the market as well as the community around the globe. We believe in the value of product, people, and planet, and strive to make a difference by creating solutions that leave a lasting positive footprint. Our culture is driven by employees, a dynamic, full, passionate team embracing new ideas and a collaborative spirit. PepsiCo makes us unique and makes us better.  

Functional description: Network 3.0 Associate worldwide focus delivering and supporting capabilities to improve business processes, enable associates to connect and collaborate easily, collect and mine data for analytical insight, and enhance performance across all aspects of the PepsiCo value chain. Expect students to be afforded the opportunity for beneficial and meaningful work experience on one of five project groups. Please let the PepsiCo campus representative know the following discipline interests. You may express interest in one project:  

Coordination plan: Manages delivery of technology projects.  
Development design: Develops, configures, and tests technology solutions to meet business requirements.  
Business analyst: Uses knowledge of business processes to analyze options, define requirements, and create functional designs for technology solutions to business problems.  
Data analytics: Develops reporting and analytical solutions to turn data into business insight, including management of reusable, consistent data foundations.  
Information security: Plans and implements security measures to protect PepsiCo from cyberattacks and ensure the integrity of PepsiCo data and systems.  

Network available Plano, Texas location. Take note: final work placement will be in one of the following two locations. Specific location is not guaranteed pre-offer; actual working location will be determined and identified at the point of offer: Plano, Texas or Purchase/White Plains, New York.  

Qualification requirements: Looking for candidates currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Business Information Systems, Business Engineering focus, or related majors may be considered. Minimum GPA 3.0. Related experience is a plus. Ability to learn new technology and process information quickly. Ability to adapt to changing timelines and sequences. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  

Minimum qualification: Candidate expected to graduate with a Bachelor’s degree within one year of internship completion. Legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future work authorization or visa sponsorship. Employment is contingent upon passing a drug screen and background investigation.  

Relocation eligible: Eligible for relocation. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. PepsiCo is an equal opportunity employer. Female, minority, disability, protected veteran, sexual orientation, and gender identity.  

For more information on Equal Employment Opportunity rights for applicants under the law, please download the available “EEO is the Law” and “EEO is the Law” supplement documents. View the PepsiCo EEO policy. Please view the Pay Transparency Statement.

normalized_jd:
B&H Photo Video Incorporated job description  

Job title: Information Security Analyst Level Two  

Division/Department: Information System Security  

Job overview:  
Information Security Specialist Level Two supports day-to-day Information Technology security operations and event investigations. Responsible for security data analytics, Security Operations Center second-level support, threat intelligence, and security risk reporting. Specialist is involved in employee technology onboarding and offboarding, logical access control, and access entitlement review for internal and cloud systems.  

Role provides Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), log management, security incident management, and forensics. Individual serves a key role providing a holistic view of the organization's security preparedness and response to cyber threats.  

Essential responsibilities:  
Responsible for security data analytics, Security Operations Center second-level support, threat intelligence, and security risk reporting. Lead enterprise vulnerability and patch management initiatives in a manner that advances business objectives and matches business risk appetite. Improve security awareness regarding evolving threats and common vulnerabilities. Assist in examination of security controls, i.e., facilitate internal and external audit compliance reporting and management attestation. Examine operational effectiveness of security control design and automation.  

Perform vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, key control testing, and data leakage detection scanning. Conduct identity and access acceptable use monitoring. Responsible for employee technology onboarding and offboarding, logical access control, and access entitlement review for internal and cloud systems. Prepare reports for management regarding risk findings and remediation progress.  

Develop cybersecurity analytics and threat intelligence using multiple data sources and SIEM. Provide second-level support for the Security Operations Center (SOC). Configure security tools and sensors to alert on certain risk conditions. Examine cyber adversary techniques in order to develop defensive methodologies. Explore security event alerting and auditing capabilities for various technologies, e.g., Microsoft Windows, Structured Query Language (SQL), email, firewall, Internet Protocol (IP), antivirus applications. Establish configuration standards. Assist the Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) in cyber threat detection and prevention.  

Additional responsibilities:  
Recurring reporting to management demonstrating operational effectiveness of security controls. Assigned by Manager.  

Specific knowledge, skills, and abilities:  
General knowledge of Information Technology including Microsoft Windows, Linux, and office automation (e.g., Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Outlook), email, and databases. Understanding of networking concepts and technologies including routing, switching, and Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) model. Knowledge of common information security concepts: antivirus, logical access control, firewall, intrusion prevention, least privilege, and separation of duties. High-level analytical and problem-solving ability. Aptitude to learn new technologies, products, and concepts. Ability to manage multiple projects and multiple deadlines in an organized fashion. Interest in learning scripting languages, macro programming, and regular expressions. Understanding of basic data analysis and management concepts. Ability to communicate clear calls to action verbally and in written form. Desire to learn new products and techniques to safeguard information systems and data. Ability to work independently on advanced daily duties as well as collaboratively with multiple teams on advanced projects.  

Experience with Splunk analytic development, data mining, data visualization, and machine learning is also helpful. Experience with data warehouse and Business Intelligence (BI) tools is desired.  

Required abilities:  
Ability to author technical and management risk reports.  

Preferred education, experience, and licenses:  
Minimum education required: Associate degree in Information Assurance, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business Administration, or related field, or equivalent job-related experience and education.  
Desired: Bachelor’s degree in Security Management, Information Assurance, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Information Systems Audit and Control Association (ISACA), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), or other professional certifications preferred.  

Five years of experience in a role requiring regular use of Information Technology and data management. Two years of experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) products, e.g., Splunk, ArcSight, LogLogic, preferred. Experience in retail is desired.  

B&H Photo Video Pro Audio is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

normalized_jd:
State University of New York System Administration seeks applications for an entry-level Network Analyst in the established Business System Operation within the Network Planning and Operation team in the Office of Information Technology. The position resides in the State University of New York System Administration Central Office in downtown Albany, New York. The Network Analyst reports to the Manager of Network Planning and Operation, providing local technical support for network infrastructure within State University Plaza in the local Albany office, in addition to remote technical support for offices located within Syracuse, New York City, and others.  

Responsibilities of the Network Analyst:  
The successful candidate will supplement the existing team of analysts in planning, designing, troubleshooting, and managing local and wide area networks for the State University of New York System Administration office. Additionally, the candidate will provide network design consultation and implementation for wide area network support for SUNYNet service, which establishes secure wide area networking between State University of New York campus data centers throughout New York State.  

The position focuses on several key technology services: Cisco Systems Catalyst, RASA, Firepower devices, Extreme Networks wireless infrastructure, Network Access Control (NAC), Netsight, Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall series, public Domain Name System (DNS) services, SolarWinds Orion platform including Network Performance Monitor (NPM), Server and Application Monitor (SAM), and Network Traffic Analyzer (NTA). The successful candidate should anticipate hands-on experience with these technologies over time.  

The candidate will be exposed to business processes, project leadership, and service management. This position is entry-level, and the candidate should anticipate progressive and extensive job training.  

Required qualifications:  
- Bachelor’s degree from an accredited higher education institution, preferably in a related field.  
- Familiarity with key networking technologies including routers, switches, and firewalls.  
- Familiarity with Microsoft Windows operating systems and Microsoft Office software.  
- Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to explain technical concepts in non-technical terms.  
- Willingness to learn and adopt new technologies as needed to support and maintain university business objectives.  
- Ability to lift fifty pounds.  

Preferred qualifications:  
- Familiarity with DNS, Active Directory, and networking in Windows environments.  
- Familiarity with Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) best practices or similar service management processes.  
- Previous experience in an office environment, including internships or work experience.  

Salary: Forty thousand to forty-five thousand dollars annually, with excellent fringe benefits.  

Interested candidates are invited to apply online. The search committee will begin reviewing applications immediately and will continue until the position is filled.

normalized_jd:
Primary location United States New York Long Island City  
Education None  
Job function Technology  
Schedule Full time  
Shift Day job  
Employee status Regular  
Travel time  
Job ID 18,047,755  

Description  
Citi is a leading global bank with approximately two hundred million customer accounts and business in one hundred sixty countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.  

Core activities include safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments, and accessing capital markets on behalf of clients. Citi’s mission and value proposition explain Citi’s leadership standards and mission to serve as a trusted partner to clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Citi strives to earn and maintain client and public trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact in the communities it serves.  

Leadership standards are a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how employees work every day and successfully strengthen the ability to execute strategic priorities. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength. Citi serves clients from every walk of life, every background, and every origin. The goal is for the workforce to reflect diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, individuals are promoted based on merit, value is demanded, respect for others is upheld, and opportunities to develop are widely available.  

Job description  
The position of Mainframe Analyst acts as a liaison between branch, call center, commercial business operations, and technology users. Responsibilities include analyzing and setting business user mainframe access using Top Secret and Resource Access Control Facility (RACF) security complexes, Eclipse oversight, and entitlement work for branch, call center, commercial business operations, card, Loan Collection System (LCS), Money Laundering (ML) risk management, fraud, International Personal Banking (IPB), Automated Housing System (AHS), private bank, Private Wealth Management (PWM), executive response unit, and collection users.  

Tasks include analyzing and setting Eclipse roles, mainframe access, and RACF security complexes, understanding mainframe resource profiles, and labeling procedures in Top Secret and RACF. The analyst assists units in Identity and Access Management (IAM) enterprise role efforts, user application analysis, project management tasks, and mainframe resource cleanup projects.  

The job function includes resource profiling, managing projects with proper processes according to Citi Project Management Office (PMO) standards, and using Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile. Knowledge of retail banking business and commercial business applications is required, along with hands-on experience in user entitlement management and provisioning automation. The analyst provides entitlement expertise for major projects, investigations, internal audits, analysis, and documentation procedures.  

Responsibilities include reviewing mainframe requests from retail and commercial staff members in branches, call centers, and various back-office units within retail, as well as requests from outside retail and Citibank, N.A. (CBNA) for access to retail banking applications, Private Banking Group (PBG), Private Wealth Management (PWM), International Personal Banking (IPB), related card, and commercial collection systems. The analyst reviews Eclipse requests from retail CBNA staff members and outside CBNA for access to PBG, PWM, IPB, related card, and commercial systems.  

The analyst conducts and facilitates functional business meetings using Webex, takes detailed notes, reads back and distributes minutes, keeps track of follow-ups, prepares work releases, and performs weekend entitlement checkouts. The analyst is prepared to support night calls as needed and must have the ability to run mainframe Eclipse reports.  

Qualifications  
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required.  
Excellent influencing, facilitation, and partnering skills.  
Exemplary written and oral communication skills leveraged consistently to succeed in business interactions.  
Retail CBNA commercial application knowledge and user production support experience.  
Microsoft Excel knowledge is a must.  
Knowledge of Planview, Rational Team Concert (RTC), Jira, and Microsoft Office.  
Support project management activities.  
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.  
Knowledge of RACF and Top Secret mainframe security complexes is a must.  
Must know Microsoft Project.  
Project Management Professional (PMP) and Project Administrator (PA) certifications are a plus.  
Knowledge of Information Security Center for Internet Security (CIS) standards.

normalized_jd:
Summary provides support to end users for a variety of issues, responds to telephone calls requesting technical support, identifies, researches, and resolves technical problems regarding software and computer equipment, tracks and monitors problems to ensure timely resolution, and keeps end users apprised of the status of requests. Utilizes Five Diamond customer service skills in interactions. Job responsibilities include answering user inquiries regarding computer software and hardware operation, resolving problems, troubleshooting issues, properly diagnosing user problems, and applying understanding and knowledge of information systems, products, and services to assist internal users with routine matters. Serves users according to Five Diamond service standards, utilizing prescribed problem-solving procedures to determine the first step in resolution based on the nature of the user issue, for example, escalating to personnel management. Instructs users in operating basic hardware components, for example, disk drives, monitors, mice, and printers. Resolves issues and problems at user workstations, may research situations to provide expedient resolutions as necessary, and works in conjunction with team members and the user base to fulfill service requests and accomplish projects of small and large size. Follows service requests, ensuring end users receive detailed information regarding the status of requests and timeframes for resolution, and keeps management apprised of problems that may need escalation. Documents help desk activity, identifies repeat patterns that may need to be addressed with alternative processes to meet service level expectations, and responds to tickets within required time frames. Installs standard desktop software, for example, Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Office. Assists in assigning and deleting user logins and network resource definitions, printer setups, user password resets, and equipment setups for employee use, ensuring proper installation of cables, operating systems, and appropriate software base loads on computers with working image distributions. Installs software on laptops and desktops, updates according to established policies and procedures, and maintains documentation. Makes recommendations for changes to procedures for problem reporting and resolution as appropriate. Maintains records of peripheral and software storage.  

Qualifications: Associate degree in Computer Science or Microsoft certification may substitute for an associate degree. Bachelor’s degree and two-plus years of experience preferred. One year of experience working in a network environment and one year of experience providing desktop support. Complex problem-solving and critical thinking skills, ability to multitask across multiple ticket issues, excellent communication skills in dealing with end users, sense of urgency, judgment, and decision-making skills, knowing when to escalate issues, strong attention to detail, active listening, ability to train and instruct, service orientation, and time management. Basic skills in Microsoft Windows operating systems including Windows 7 and Windows 10. Basic Microsoft skills including Office, Outlook, and Skype including online versions. Ability to troubleshoot system issues for users, determine causes, and provide resolutions. Able to troubleshoot video conferencing issues in Skype meetings. Good working knowledge of laptops including Wi-Fi connectivity, Virtual Private Network connections, authentication, Okta, docking stations, laptop maintenance, and operation. Basic skills in Active Directory including setting up accounts, disabling accounts, and managing security groups. Demonstrated familiarity with printers, monitors, multiple screen displays, and peripherals. Proficiency in troubleshooting base load systems, updating virus software, and working knowledge of antivirus and malware software including McAfee. Microsoft Office 365 user management, mailbox setup, and troubleshooting for both on-premises and online versions.  

AAA Northeast is one of the largest and most innovative membership organizations in North America, a multi-business organization comprising sixty locations in a six-state area, providing valuable roadside service to five point one million members as well as many specialized services including financial services, loans, insurance, travel discounts, auto glass, and driver training. AAA is a key advocate on issues impacting the traveling public, highway safety, road maintenance, and related legislation. With a unique organizational model and many businesses among the largest and most sought in the industry, AAA Northeast employees help serve a way of life with a one hundred-year legacy of service and stewardship. Employees make valuable contributions to the workplace and the communities surrounding us. In order to continue the mission, the organization is expanding and needs talented people to work alongside us in creating the next one hundred years.

normalized_jd:
Give career-best treatment, ready to be part of the first largest pediatric hospital in Southern California, Children's Hospital Los Angeles, a place to make a real difference in the life of a patient and family. Big responsibility? Absolutely. You are the challenge lookout. Amazing professionals join an elite team of talented individuals to continue a high level of care.  

Information Security Analyst II responsible for Information Security policy development and maintenance, design of security policy education, training and awareness activity, monitoring compliance with Children's Hospital Los Angeles security policy and applicable law including Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act and Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health Act, coordinating investigation and reporting of security incidents, working with the Information Services Department. Analyst monitors assets, participates in review of Children's Hospital Los Angeles business continuity and disaster recovery program, assists in performing network penetration tests, application vulnerability assessment scans, risk assessment reviews. Responsible for managing and monitoring regular activity service tickets assigned, Information Security dashboard metric reports, coordinating and executing security projects for the hospital, assisting in project planning. Role requires monitoring and reporting of Information Security issues related to systems and workflows at Children's Hospital Los Angeles, ensuring internal security controls at the hospital are appropriate and operating as intended, conducting hospital-wide data classification assessments, security audits, assisting in remediation plans, developing and publishing Information Security policies, procedures, standards, and guidelines based on research, knowledge, best practices, and compliance requirements used as the foundation for security awareness education at Children's Hospital Los Angeles.  

Minimum experience required: four years progressive experience in computing and Information Security including experience with Internet technology security issues, preferably in a healthcare environment. Experience to include security policy development, security education, audit review, application vulnerability assessment, risk analysis, compliance testing.  

Knowledge, skills, and abilities required: knowledge of Information Security standards, e.g., International Organization for Standardization 17799, 27002, rules and regulations related to Information Security and data confidentiality, e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act; desktop, server, application, database, network security principles; risk identification and analysis; knowledge of business process standards and policies, Information Technology Infrastructure Library, Lean Six Sigma; strong analytical and problem-solving skills; excellent communication (oral, written, presentation), interpersonal and consultative skills.  

Equal Opportunity Employer Affirmative Action.

normalized_jd: Risk Compliance Analyst, innovative, self-driven team player, able to educate, provide guidance, and help drive risk appreciation and Information Security compliance throughout the company. Individual business partner and enabler, seen as trusted adviser and partner to various departments including Legal, Finance, Internal Audit, and business unit teams. Responsibility to provide support for Governance, Risk, and Compliance management program to achieve certification in ISO 27001, ISO 27002, HITRUST, National Institute of Standards and Technology, Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard, and others as appropriate. Conduct security risk assessments across the organization, rank security risks, articulate risks in terms of business impact, and suggest reasonable strategies to mitigate risks. Liaise closely with J2 Global Internal Audit team, business leaders, external auditors, and customers. Conduct acquisition target and vendor security risk assessments, provide risk-based recommendations, and evaluate company risk posture. Serve as company representative to prospective customers and partners, assisting in completing security questionnaires, assessments, and audits. Provide Information Security consulting, security awareness education, and business development. Maintain and enforce strong Information Security policies, procedures, and position papers as required. One to two years of System Information Assurance experience preferred. Bachelor’s degree preferred. Demonstrated experience working with regulatory requirements and standards including Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard, Statement on Standards for Attestation Engagements, Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, International Organization for Standardization, Business Software Alliance, General Data Protection Regulation, and Open Worldwide Application Security Project framework. Ability to communicate complex security risks to non-technical staff. Strong work ethic, attention to detail, organizational skills, ability to multitask, and manage priorities in a fast-paced environment. Ability to collaborate in a team setting as well as work independently. Relevant certifications preferred, e.g., Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control, Certified Information Systems Security Professional, Certified Information Security Manager, Certified Information Systems Auditor, Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge. Big Four consulting experience preferred. Experience in on-premises and cloud environments preferred. Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed.

normalized_jd:
Successful candidate will aid advancement of the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security engineering team effort to provide information security service support to the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California charter associate members. Primary responsibility of the position is to work as a security team member to improve the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security architecture, perform proactive and reactive security analysis, respond to and resolve security incidents, and provide technical expertise especially in the area of network, system, and data protection. In addition, participation is expected in all aspects of information security to enable the mission of the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California charter associates, including participation in uncovering computer network vulnerabilities, reducing risk incurred by vulnerabilities, infusing new security technology into the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security architecture, promoting a security culture, consulting, training, and interpersonal skill development.  

Ability to work effectively in a distributed team environment is a must. Specific responsibilities include serving as a member of the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security group, performing varying security duties including threat awareness, proactive network traffic analysis, incident response, forensic analysis, and resolution of security incidents. Collaborate with the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security working group, Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California segment leaders, and security experts around the state to develop plans for an appropriate security operations center, integrating knowledge of network protocols, services, threat and vulnerability mitigation strategies, and hardware capabilities to build a security environment that reduces and mitigates risk, allowing the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California open science mission to succeed.  

Evaluate a wide range of data including Bro logs, NetFlow data, centralized syslog, authentication logs, and others to detect security incidents and take timely action as appropriate, block problematic traffic, send alerts, and investigate suspicious activity detected. Develop new methods to detect and mitigate security attacks. Communicate with internal and external security personnel and system administrators. Respond appropriately to internal and external complaints, for example scanning, hacking, and spamming. Promote a strong security culture throughout the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California internal network. Consult with Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California management staff.  

Ability to be on call outside regular business hours on a regular recurring basis is a key success factor. Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. Experience using host intrusion detection systems, intrusion detection by hand, and network packet-level examination using tools such as TCPdump and Wireshark. Working knowledge of regular expressions and data/text manipulation tools such as AWK and SED. Familiarity with logging environments such as the Elasticsearch Logstash Kibana stack and Splunk. Experience with programming languages C, C++, Python, Ruby, and other popular languages. Working knowledge of administering Unix/Linux operating systems such as Red Hat, CentOS, and FreeBSD variants.  

Able to work on multiple tasks and respond to rapidly changing priorities. Ability to serve as a consultant with a long-range vision for the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California security architecture. Able to identify, support, recommend, and implement security enhancements to maximize the security profile of the Corporation for Education Network Initiatives in California sensitive mission. Ability to formulate, organize, and present ideas in an effective manner. Self-motivated with demonstrated ability to work highly independently requiring little direct supervision. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Ability to lead a team to reach consensus.  

Key skills desired: certification and training in technical security specialties, for example Information Assurance Certification, Certified Information Systems Security Professional, and Security+. Familiarity with software development and coding using a security-centric approach. Understanding of macOS and Windows operating systems. Knowledge of public key and private key encryption techniques including Data Encryption Standard, Rivest–Shamir–Adleman, Pretty Good Privacy, and GNU Privacy Guard. Understanding of Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol networking. Understanding of Internet Protocol version 6. Knowledge of Layer 2, wireless, switching, and routing protocols. Familiarity with securing virtualized environments. Familiarity and experience working with research and education networks.

normalized_jd:
Deluxe Entertainment Service Group Incorporated, global leader in medium entertainment service, film, video, online content capture and consumption since one thousand nine hundred fifteen. Deluxe is a trusted partner to the world’s most successful Hollywood studios, independent film companies, television networks, exhibitors, advertisers, and others, offering best-in-class solutions in production, post-production, distribution, asset and workflow management, and new digital solutions based on technology operations in Los Angeles, New York, and around the globe. The company employs eight thousand six hundred talented, highly honored, and recognized artists and industry veterans worldwide. Deluxe is a wholly owned subsidiary of MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Incorporated. For information, please visit.  

Currently opening Analyst, Information Security position located in Burbank, California.  

Summary: Provide information security services to Deluxe business units worldwide with special emphasis on system and network security, incident response, vulnerability assessment, penetration testing, malware analysis, software reverse engineering, computer forensics, reporting, and metrics.  

Responsibilities: Perform application and web-based security vulnerability assessments and penetration tests in accordance with industry-accepted methods, protocols, and tools. Prepare operational test environments, network penetration, and network attack scenarios. Develop detailed work plans, schedules, and resource plans for recurring vulnerability and penetration tests. Prepare post-test analysis and reporting of penetration and vulnerability testing activities. Manage day-to-day activities of threat and vulnerability management. Identify risk tolerance and recommend treatment plans. Research and document global threats. Communicate residual risk to the team. Perform static and dynamic analysis, reverse engineering, and debugging of malware samples using industry-recognized tools, including defeating anti-debugging, packing, and obfuscation techniques. Forensically secure, preserve, capture, and analyze data from volatile memory and physical disks from laptops, desktop computers, servers, and mobile devices. Perform in-depth forensic analysis of captured data, network traffic, volatile memory, and host images to identify indicators of compromise and develop actionable threat intelligence. Monitor and analyze enterprise network and host-based sensor data originating from Intrusion Detection Systems, Intrusion Prevention Systems, Security Information and Event Management, domain controllers, endpoint security solutions, email and network devices, and firewalls. Perform additional information security-related duties as assigned.  

Qualifications: Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science in Computer Science preferred. One year experience in an information security-related role. Offensive Security Certified Professional, Penetration Case Certified Examiner, EnCase Certified Examiner preferred. Certified Expert Penetration Tester, GIAC Web Application Penetration Tester, GIAC Penetration Tester, Certified Reverse Engineering Examiner preferred.  

Requirements: Network security subject matter expert. Experience and knowledge in application, web, and network penetration testing and associated methodologies, including vulnerability assessment, attack vectors, and industry-recognized open-source and commercially available tools. Strong knowledge and experience with Windows operating system internals, kernel, registry, file systems NTFS and FAT, Windows APIs. In-depth knowledge of Linux and Unix operating systems; Kali Linux experience is a plus. In-depth knowledge of networking, communication protocols, and devices including routers, switches, and firewalls. Strong proficiency in x86 assembly, Python, PowerShell, Bash, EnScript, and C preferred. Strong proficiency in EnCase forensic software. Strong proficiency in development Integrated Development Environments including Visual Studio Code, Code::Blocks, Eclipse, PyCharm. Strong proficiency in debugging platforms including IDA Pro, OllyDbg, x64dbg, GDB. Strong proficiency in vulnerability scanning tools including Burp Suite, Nexpose, Nessus. Proficiency in virtualization technology including VMware and VirtualBox.  

Core Competencies: Excellent written and verbal communication, organized thought process, polite and respectful to others, adapts presentation to audience, aware of confidential nature of information, thoroughly thinks and evaluates alternatives, innovative problem resolution, proactive approach and initiative to resolve problems, produces high-quality oral and written work products, presents complex technical matters clearly and concisely, excellent problem-solving skills, works with little direction or supervision, timely completion of projects, makes time for unplanned assignments, adapts to changing priorities, perceived fairness, tolerance, honesty, confidentiality, consistent application of policies and procedures.  

We offer competitive pay and benefits programs including medical, dental, and vision coverage, vacation, sick leave, and 401(k). Deluxe’s policy is to provide equal employment opportunity to applicants and employees. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law, regulation, or ordinance. Deluxe will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state, and federal law. Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done to ensure equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship. Please inform.

normalized_jd: Overview Western Asset views Information Security as one of the top risks the firm must manage. Developed a program to identify and address Information Security challenges facing the firm, achieved by deploying industry-leading technology and a comprehensive program to safeguard Western’s information systems, assets, and data. Experienced Information Security Analyst, key player in the program, responsible for ensuring governance and risk assessment elements of the program are operational and mature, providing key input to day-to-day operations, essential security oversight, expanding scope and effectiveness of controls. Responsibility includes broad involvement in the security program, with a role focused specifically on risk assessment, conducting risk assessments, interfacing with the enterprise risk program, holding risk owners accountable for remediation actions, monitoring and assessing risk, collaborating and interacting with parts of the organization including the parent company and affiliated companies, cyber practices, projects, third-party security, conducting due diligence on business partners and vendors, security initiatives coordination, coordination of security business initiatives impacting Western’s security, execution of ongoing security projects and programs, policy management input, supporting the overall security program, drafting, reviewing, and keeping current policies and regulatory requirements, staying current with legislation and regulatory requirements impacting security, including performing gap analysis, guidelines, and practices. Audit interface includes audit processes such as internal audits, external audits, and client-based audits, reporting input, and support for management reporting. Competency must include familiarity with International Organization for Standardization ISO/IEC 27001, ISO/IEC 27002, National Institute of Standards and Technology NIST Cybersecurity Framework, security frameworks, and industry best practices. Must be an excellent communicator, able to build and maintain effective working relationships, must have experience conducting risk assessments, must have experience developing Information Security policies, familiarity with fixed income business processes and technology services. Certified Information Systems Security Professional CISSP would be an advantage. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field required.

normalized_jd:
Department of Health Service  
Filing Date: August 10, 2018  
Need Service Met  
Subject: Closure Without Prior Notice  
Exam Number: Y4593I  
Type: Recruitment Open Competitive Job Opportunity Announcement Bulletin  
Reopen Examination Update Salary Information  

Persons who applied within the last twelve months need not reapply but may submit additional information if they wish. Information must include the correct examination title and examination number.  

Definition:  
Researches, analyzes, and makes recommendations regarding the use, deployment of resources, implementation, refinement, and operation of programs with department-wide impact within the Department of Health Service.  

Essential Job Functions:  
Analyzes department services and makes recommendations for services.  
Develops policies and procedures to ensure compliance with various rules and regulations.  
Negotiates with state and federal agencies to obtain grant funding and to justify or persuade grantor officials to permit expenditure of funds for purposes contrary to the original grant.  
Represents the department regarding healthcare-related issues.  
Collaborates with various community stakeholders and members of the health care team.  
Ensures recommended changes to department programs resolve operational problems and increase efficiency and effectiveness of deliverable services.  
Participates in studies of complex and difficult problem areas.  
Participates in implementation of recommended procedures and programs.  
Acts as team leader for analysts as necessary.  
Performs special assignments and projects as directed.  

Requirements:  
Selection Requirement Option I: Four years of experience in a staff capacity analyzing and making recommendations for solutions to problems in organization, programs, procedures, budgets, or personnel at the level of Administrative Assistant III or higher.  
Option II: One year of highly responsible administrative staff experience at the level of County of Los Angeles class Assistant Staff Analyst, Health Services, or higher.  

License:  
A valid California Class C Driver License or the ability to utilize alternative methods of transportation when needed to carry out job-related essential functions.  

Physical Class: II – Light. Light physical effort may include occasional light lifting (10-pound limit), bending, stooping, squatting, and considerable walking may be involved.  

Special Requirement Information:  
Experience at the level of Administrative Assistant III in the County of Los Angeles is defined as analyzing and making recommendations for solutions to highly complex operating, budgetary, financing, and management problems in a County department and participating in implementation of solutions.  
Experience at the level of Assistant Staff Analyst, Health in the County of Los Angeles is defined as assisting in research and analysis and making recommendations regarding the use, deployment of resources, implementation, refinement, and operation of programs within a health care setting.  

Desirable Qualifications:  
Additional credit will be given to applicants who possess desirable qualifications in excess of the selection requirements:  
A Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited college or university in one of the following areas: Business Administration, Public Administration, Public Health, Healthcare Administration, or a closely related field.  

In order to receive credit for the type of college degree (Bachelor’s degree or higher), applicants must include a legible photocopy of the degree or official transcript from an accredited institution showing the area of specialization at the time of filing or within fifteen calendar days of filing online.  

Additional Information:  
Examination Content:  
The examination will consist of an evaluation of experience based upon application information and desirable qualifications weighted 100%.  
Candidates must achieve a passing score of 70% or higher on the examination in order to be placed on the eligible register.  

Eligibility Information:  
Applications will be processed on a “as received” basis and those receiving a passing score will be promulgated to the eligible register accordingly.  
Names of candidates receiving a passing score on the examination will be added to the eligible register and will appear in the order of score group for a period of twelve months following the date of eligibility.  
Persons may compete in this examination every twelve months.  

Special Information:  
Appointees may be required to work shifts including evenings, nights, weekends, and holidays.  

Vacancy Information:  
The resulting eligible register from this examination will be used to fill vacancies within the Department of Health Service. Available shifts vary.  

Application Filing Information:  
Applications must be filed online. Applications submitted by U.S. mail, fax, or in person will not be accepted.  
Apply online by clicking the green “Apply” button at the top right of the posting.  
You can also track the status of your application using the website.  

Information Subject to Verification:  
Applications may be rejected at any time during the examination or hiring process, including after an appointment is made, for falsification of information. This may result in disqualification or rescission of appointment.  
Utilizing verbiage from class specifications and selection requirements to serve as descriptions of duties is insufficient to demonstrate that you meet the requirements and may result in an incomplete application, which may be disqualified.  

The examination will remain open until the need for service is met and application filing may be suspended at any time without advance notice.  
Fill out the application completely. Acceptance of the application depends on whether it is clearly shown that you meet the requirements.  
Provide relevant education, training, and experience in the space provided to evaluate your qualifications for the job.  
For each job held, give the name and address of the employer, job title, beginning and ending dates, number of hours worked per week, and a description of work performed.  
Applications that are incomplete will be rejected.  

Applications must be electronically received by 5:00 p.m. Pacific Standard Time on the last day of filing to be accepted.  
Note: If you are unable to attach the required documents, your application will be considered incomplete.

Position summary: Provide technical leadership, design, development, installation, and maintenance of hardware and software for school Internet and Intranet applications, desktop computing, and server systems in a diverse, complex computing environment.  

Qualification required: Education – Bachelor’s degree preferred; education – advanced degree or professional certificate in Computer Science required. Experience – three years of relevant experience or equivalent combination. Must have experience in UNIX system administration including installation, maintenance, support, problem identification and resolution, security planning and implementation, performance measurement and tuning, and system design and configuration planning.  

Required skill, knowledge, and ability: Excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills; demonstrated ability to write proposals and papers and make presentations; proven ability to provide technical leadership and manage projects; knowledge of Internet-based applications, Solaris, Linux, Windows, UNIX shell scripting.  

Additional information: Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority, Female, Veteran, Disabled, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity.

normalized_jd:
Group rapidly growing mission driven healthcare company provides affordable evidence based treatment for opiate addiction model in the United States. Two powerful tools for recovery are group therapy and medication assisted treatment with buprenorphine. The approach takes the best parts of Alcoholics Anonymous accountability and community, and combines them with the latest medical science and technology.  

System Administrator position is part of the team responsible for supporting systems across a distributed national organization. The position enables efficient operation of clinics and a seamless modern patient experience. The role works with the operations team and reports to the Operations Manager. The role is a distinctive opportunity for an aspiring professional seeking professional development in an innovative high growth startup building an organization to scale to meet the size of the epidemic. Systems make growth possible and sustainable.  

The position supports email, network, phone systems, asset management, and electronic medical record systems across main areas of operations support. Provide technical troubleshooting assistance related to computer hardware, software, mobile devices, cloud, printers, and network infrastructure. Perform regular security monitoring to identify possible concerns. Create, change, and delete user accounts per request. Configure and update hardware, peripheral services, settings, directories, and storage in accordance with standard project operational requirements. Assist with new hardware and software system rollouts, account provisioning, and setup. Test new user accounts to ensure new employees are onboarded efficiently. Troubleshoot new employee issues to ensure smooth organizational system introduction.  

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree, ideally in a technical major such as engineering or computer science. One to two years of system support or system administration experience preferred. Flexible to juggle multiple tasks and priorities. Thrive in an environment of ambiguity and rapid change without breaking a sweat. Patience to work with a diverse group of people with varying degrees of technical facility. Helpful, friendly demeanor. Great at prioritizing, separating what really matters from noise, prioritizing ruthlessly, and not getting distracted by what is not mission critical. Well-rounded, creative problem solver excited to tackle a range of problems from remotely troubleshooting a network outage to effectively teaching an employee to use a new system on an average Monday morning. Passionate about the mission and looking to join a mission driven team culture. Willing to go beyond to get the job done. Ability to travel infrequently as needed. Ability to work remotely.  

Ideal candidate experience: Google Admin Service, Chrome OS, Zendesk, audio-visual endpoint software, experience with Windows and Mac management, comfort and familiarity with network Wi-Fi router, Virtual Private Network, Internet Service Provider configuration, knowledge of Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act related security requirements, experience with multisite operations, remote support experience, electronic medical record systems, and clinical application support is a big plus. Excellent troubleshooting skills.

normalized_jd:
General duty Senior Associate performs highly complex professional work in a technology-related discipline area. Specialization may vary. Typically, Senior Associates perform a range of work in development, programming, communication, technical support, or similar functions depending on the needs of the Information Technology area. Reports of work tasks include diagnosing, evaluating, overseeing, and resolving highly complex projects with wide latitude for independent initiative and judgment. May serve in a lead role on complex programs or projects. Serves as direct supervisor of a unit or group. Senior Associates demonstrate mastery in one technology-related discipline and decision-making ability in situations related to that discipline, and are able to serve as a resource in the area. May contribute to decisions on policy and technical standards. Job is classified under the City University of New York Civil Service. Full specification is available on the website.  

Contract title: Senior Associate  
Fair Labor Standards Act: Exempt  

Campus-specific information: Office of Computing and Information Services at the City University of New York supports the telecommunication needs of the City University of New York’s twenty-four colleges. The Office of Computing and Information Services supports enterprise applications, develops new technology to advance the university’s mission, builds and upgrades, maintains the university network, operates the university data center and helpdesk, develops disaster recovery and business continuity plans, and leads the City University of New York First Enterprise Resource Planning project which integrates twenty-five university systems covering student administration, financial management, and human resources.  

Within the Office of Computing and Information Services, the Storage Virtualization Unit maintains and develops service platforms and applications shared across the university, reporting on Windows and Linux systems. The Manager and System Administrator deploy enterprise applications on complex Wintel-based systems, manage systems, support Local Area Network services, maintain security systems, and upgrade server system infrastructure.  

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  
- Administer and manage large physical and virtual Microsoft Windows environments including file servers, print servers, web servers, and other servers.  
- Manage Active Directory objects including users, groups, and Group Policy Objects.  
- Deploy and update servers.  
- Monitor and troubleshoot system issues.  
- Install and manage software, antivirus, backup, and monitoring tools.  
- Required Microsoft and third-party applications.  
- Develop, maintain, and follow system policies, procedures, documentation, and diagrams.  
- Maintain, test, and execute disaster recovery and business continuity plans.  
- Responsible for support ticket and email resolution.  
- Provide consultation and technical guidance to end users.  
- Represent the team in meetings and discussions on projects.  
- Provide technical feedback and guidance to engineering support.  
- Perform related duties as assigned.  

Job duties require schedule flexibility and willingness to work evenings and weekends as required for system-related tasks.  

Minimum qualifications:  
1. High school diploma or General Educational Development equivalent.  
2. Equivalent of ten years’ experience post-high school meeting one of the following:  
   - Ten years of full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position.  
   - Associate degree plus eight years of full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position.  
   - Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution plus six years of full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position.  
3. Demonstrated English language proficiency.  
4. Motor vehicle driver’s license valid in New York State may be required for certain positions.  

Title has three levels. In addition to minimum qualifications, to qualify for levels two and three, additional qualifications in education, experience, or certification relevant to the area of specialization are required.  

Preferred qualifications:  
- Microsoft Certified System Administrator or related certification.  
- Experience managing domain controllers, fixing replication corruption issues, and Domain Name System issues.  
- Experience deploying and managing virtual servers in VMware ESX environments.  
- Experience with security practices, network segmentation, and zoning in multiple server environment application tiers.  
- Experience in change management control.  
- Working knowledge of PowerShell, batch files, and Python scripting language.  
- Proactive, detail-oriented, with high aptitude for solving complex problems and rendering sound resolutions.  
- Ability to work productively as an individual contributor or collaboratively as a team member in a fast-paced, time-sensitive, customer-responsive, team-oriented environment.  

Compensation: Eighty-four thousand three hundred forty-five dollars.  

Benefits: The City University of New York offers a comprehensive benefits package to employees and eligible dependents based on job title and classification. Employees are also offered pension and tax-deferred savings plans. Part-time employees must meet weekly and semester work hour criteria to be eligible for health benefits. Health benefits are also extended to retirees who meet eligibility criteria.  

Application: For full consideration, submit a cover letter and résumé online via the City University of New York web-based job system, addressing experience and credentials that fulfill the responsibilities and qualifications outlined. Direct link to job opening is available from external sources.  

Closing date: Open until filled. Review of applications begins May 22, 2018.  

Job search category: City University of New York job posting in Information Technology and Technical.  

Equal Employment Opportunity: The City University of New York encourages people with disabilities, minorities, veterans, and women to apply. Italian Americans are also included among protected groups. Applicants and employees are not to be discriminated against on the basis of legally protected categories including sexual orientation and gender identity. Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action, Veteran, Disability Employer.

normalized_jd:
Thin X Incorporated small agile team go-getters value opinion shape size unique presence make immediate impact company bottom line contribute long-term success. We have big plan underway. You will have opportunity to work directly with design, growth marketing, digital product, engineering, operations, content, and customer experience team to provide real menstruating human best innovative period solution product. Bottom line: tight-knit team passionate people working toward common goal.  

Administrator responsibility: overseeing timely delivery of high-quality service. Organization requires knowledge of software, hardware, and systems utilized: Apple, Windows, Canon printer, Verizon, Spectrum Internet Service Provider failover, Synology Network Attached Storage, networking, firewall, infrared television, voice, cloud-based Software as a Service software, domain server, building access, video security, as well as strong project management and interpersonal communication skills.  

Responsibility: identify, diagnose, and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues reported by team members. Manage all aspects of network including switching, routing, firewall administration. Proactively and continuously monitor health of network Local Area Network, Wireless Local Area Network, Wide Area Network, Virtual Private Network, security devices, power sources, voice circuits, bandwidth utilization, physical and virtual appliances, as well as supporting infrastructure to ensure continuous uninterrupted availability of resources critical to operational needs of business. Implement and oversee compliance with company security policy, standard procedures, user password rules, and access roles. Implement and maintain business directory services, identity management systems, monitoring applications, malware protection, and key access to various software systems locally and Software as a Service cloud-based. Responsible for system backup, recovery, and retention of data on Synology Network Attached Storage. Maintain inventory and assignment of laptops, telephones, and peripherals related to technology equipment. Set up laptops for new team members with appropriate software image. Hard drive laptops repurposed. Specify and requisition laptops and related technology equipment. Keep systems up to date. Monitor health and access of servers, domain, and droplets currently hosted and maintained on Oku, Digital Ocean, GoDaddy, Namecheap, Amazon Web Services.  

Qualification: two years of experience. Looking for level of interest in scaling infrastructure team in rapidly growing organization. Strong understanding of Software as a Service-based software, creating and maintaining access roles across dozens of services, creating and running helpdesk systems. Strong experience with macOS, Windows 10, Canon printer, Synology software, card door access systems, video security environment. Intermediate understanding of network protocol technology: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol, Domain Name System, Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol, Virtual Private Network, Voice over Internet Protocol, Simple Mail Transfer Protocol.  

Personal characteristics: strong written and verbal communication skills, analytical problem solver, detail-oriented, comfortable talking about periods and urination, keep up to date with latest technology trends, thrives in agile fast-paced environment, working in small team wearing many different hats. Interest in start-ups, e-commerce, software engineering, data analytics preferred.  

Thin X mission: Thin X creates innovative period solutions to empower people and sustain the planet, breaking taboos around menstruation and reproductive health everywhere. Innovation: period-proof underwear recognized by top industry publications — Fast Company Innovative Company 2017, Entrepreneur Magazine One Hundred Brilliant Companies 2016, Time Magazine Top Twenty-Five Inventions 2015. Icon mission: eliminate anxiety and raise awareness of pelvic floor health. One in three women urinate a little when they run, jump, dance, cough, or sneeze. Patented pee-proof underwear lets women kick panty liners and lame stigma of bladder leaks to the curb. Icon innovative underwear is absorbent, washable, a wee bit sexy, and equally committed to helping sisters around the world in partnership with Fistula Foundation. Every pair of Icon sold helps fund life-changing surgery for women in developing countries.
