normalized_jd: Network System Administrator responsible for maintaining network uptime, managing critical network hardware at vessel landings, troubleshooting network issues, and creating network security stability across the New York City Ferry platform. Essential duties and responsibilities include designing and installing local area network cabling systems and equipment such as routers and switches, monitoring active network server infrastructure, managing and maintaining vessel landing networks, performing routine preventative maintenance on equipment, troubleshooting network issues, administering network security measures to prevent system interruptions or breaches, and providing technical support for ticket vending machines across New York City Ferry landings. Creates wiki articles documenting tasks, hardware, and software to build an internal knowledge base, provides lists of asset tags, locations, and user deployments or moves, and provides Tier Three technical support to internal New York City Ferry staff working on assigned tickets inside the Jira ticketing system. Troubleshooting workstation software configuration and setup, assisting with ongoing maintenance of end-user personal computer desktop hardware, software, and peripherals, imaging laptops and desktops, utilizing Active Directory for password resets, account unlocks, and new user creation, managing the New York City Ferry Active Directory organizational unit for users and computers, managing and maintaining network printers, installing software, requesting software for users from appropriate sources, prioritizing incoming support requests, escalating issues or concerns when necessary, providing after-hours support on a rotating on-call schedule, presenting a professional level of customer service and appearance to internal and external parties, demonstrating respect and value consistent with guest hospitality behavior to internal and external riders, holding crew accountable for environmental safety, security, quality, and respect for system organization, and working to support the Health, Safety, and Quality Engineering team in implementing system plans, controls, records, and documentation. Qualifications include strong technical knowledge, efficient troubleshooting capability, relevant infrastructure architecture knowledge, and experience with multiple operating systems including Windows 7, Windows 10, Linux Ubuntu Server, Linux CentOS Server, macOS, Windows Server 2012, and Windows Server 2016. Knowledge of server applications such as Active Directory, Remote Desktop Protocol, SQL Server II, and VMware. Understanding of concepts and protocols such as Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol, Domain Name System, Virtual Private Network, and Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. Strong knowledge of network hardware and software including Cisco, Cradlepoint, Ubiquiti, patch panels, and uninterruptible power supplies. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong customer service skill set, and knowledge of Jira Service Desk Plus. In addition to New York City Ferry service, Hornblower Group operates Hornblower Cruises and Events with sixty vessels in Northern California, Southern California, and New York, two ferry service concessions for the United States National Park Service (Alcatraz Cruises and Statue Cruises), boat service to Niagara Falls Gorge in Canada, and a cable car transportation company in San Francisco. New York City Ferry by Hornblower is a proud equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and does not discriminate based upon race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. New York City Ferry by Hornblower is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans during the job application procedure. New York City Ferry by Hornblower participates in the E-Verify program.

normalized_jd:
Proficient clerical experience relates to entering and verifying data within Microsoft Excel along with good computation skills. Learn to play a key role as a Data System Administrator at ICON Laboratory Service dedicated exclusively to central laboratory testing. Associate service in clinical trial data system administrator role within ICON. Data System Administrators perform data entry and analysis related to clerical activity, ensuring data is collected, verified, analyzed, and processed completely and accurately using client reports to support preclinical, clinical, and bioanalytical studies. Data System Administrators verify analytical data calculation correctness, traceability, basic level quantitation, data compilation, and editing of minor analytical reports as needed. Perform and also support administrative functions as needed, for example, word processing, spreadsheet work, filing, scanning, photocopying, and pagination.  

Benefits of working at ICON provide Data System Administrators with resources for successfully supporting lines of business. In addition, we offer a strong benefits package that includes a comprehensive health plan, retirement plan, competitive pay, vacation, and an annual incentive plan to reward performance.  

To succeed, you must possess a high school diploma, intermediate Microsoft Office skills in Word, Excel, and Access, relevant administrative, clerical, or accounting experience, the ability to function independently, attention to detail, and good math skills.  

We invite you to review the opportunity. What is next? Following your application, you will be contacted by one dedicated recruiter. If successful, they will be able to provide details of the opportunity. ICON is an equal opportunity employer: minority, female, disabled, veteran.

normalized_jd:
TransCore TCI subsidiary Roper Technology Incorporated New York Stock Exchange ROP seeking full-time System Administrator II to join team in New York City. Essential duties and responsibilities include the following duties which may be assigned: receives, configures, installs requested personal computers, provides troubleshooting and repair, moderate network solutions, recommends changes to operating procedures, hardware standards, and software standards warranted by new technological changes or operating conditions, evaluates interface between user, hardware, and software operational performance requirements for overall desktop systems, maintains server user accounts, file and print permissions as required for internal and remote users, performs daily system maintenance, reviews system logs and antivirus server logs, performs backups, provides monitoring reports on operational status of Local Area Network Wide Area Network environment as needed, interacts with vendors, installs and configures computer equipment, recommends acquisition of new hardware and software as needed, assists in installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting company product software.  

Required skills: strong knowledge of Windows 7, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, good knowledge of Linux systems, good knowledge of virtual environments including Hyper-V, VMware, iSCSI, Fibre Channel, knowledge of Windows domain administration including Microsoft Windows infrastructure including Active Directory implementation, domain administration, Group Policy, Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol, Domain Name System, security patch testing and deployment for servers, workstations, and network devices, antivirus, antispyware, intrusion detection and prevention system management, management and configuration of Cisco routers and switches, Layer 2 and Layer 3 functions, management of network security configuration, routing protocol configuration, diagnosis and correction of network outages.  

Desired skills: strong analytical, organizational, and documentation skills, ability to work well independently with minimal supervision, excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  

Required education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or similar preferred.  

Special qualification: Cisco Certified Network Professional desired.

normalized_jd:
Maintains computing environment by identifying system requirements, installing upgrades, and monitoring system performance. Responsible for installing, maintaining, and upgrading server or software. Ensures appropriate data is backed up. Ensures server applications are secure from unauthorized access. Responsible for effective provisioning, installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of system hardware and software. Manages activities related to the operation and maintenance of company computer peripheral equipment. Establishes schedules and procedures for maximum utilization of systems. Analyzes operating instructions and user needs to establish operating procedures and best practices. Installs, maintains, troubleshoots, and upgrades computer hardware and software, personal computers, networks, printers, and peripheral equipment. Provides and implements recommendations regarding hardware and software acquisition. Participates in company business recovery planning objectives.  

Education and experience: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education and experience. Four to six years in the Information Technology field. Industry certification preferred.  

Skills and abilities: Basic knowledge of networking practices. Demonstrated knowledge of server hardware, peripheral software, and de-rated knowledge of Microsoft application software, i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Understanding of network security auditing best practices. Demonstrated understanding of Microsoft and Linux personal computer server operating systems. Basic project management skills. Ability to effectively manage workload, adjusting priorities as necessary to resolve unexpected issues. Ability to communicate effectively in either verbal or written format, as well as teach applications to peers and end users. Understanding of virtual environment management.  

Unique job requirements and characteristics: Valid driver’s license required. May include night and weekend work.

normalized_jd: System Administrator responsible for implementing, maintaining, and upgrading system software, application, and hardware in accordance with established procedures, working collaboratively with Project Director, Project Manager, as well as Source Owner. System Administrator develops project plan, establishes project timeline, tasks, and milestones in collaboration with vendor, as well as serves as liaison between internal and external hospital departments, outside clients, and vendors. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, participating in workflow redesign in relation to system functionality, evaluating issues, making recommendations as appropriate, preparing and maintaining application test scripts, integrated test scripts, and regression test scripts, assisting in development and evaluation of effectiveness of system downtime procedures, developing, monitoring, troubleshooting, and supporting multiple system interfaces including laboratory instruments, Health Level Seven interface, external systems, multiple billing systems, and remote laboratory systems. Administration support includes ad hoc reporting, coordinating and assisting in training staff, developing end user training materials, appropriate training materials, and data monitoring. Progress implementation includes providing end user support including Tier Four support, reporting project status information as requested. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree and three years of relevant experience, preferably in a laboratory, clinical, or health care setting, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Must be self-directed with strong interpersonal, communication, analytical, and computer skills. Experience supporting Laboratory Information System, Licensed Medical Technologist experience in laboratory preferred. Workday Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., occasional holiday on-call rotation. Job category: Management Professional, Information Technology. Job open date: August 9, 2018. Job close date: Open until filled. Recruiter: Darci Cook.

normalized_jd:
Associate performs moderately complex professional work in a technology-related discipline area. Specialization may vary. Typically, associates work in areas such as development, programming, communication, technical support, or similar functions depending on the needs of the Information Technology area. Reports work tasks including resolving complex technology problems and serving as a technical resource with considerable latitude for independent initiative and judgment. May have supervisory responsibility. Associates demonstrate mastery in one technology-related discipline. Job City University of New York classified civil service full specification available on the website.  

Contract title: Associate  
Fair Labor Standards Act: Exempt  
Campus-specific information: Office of Computing and Information Services, City University of New York supports telecommunication needs of the City University of New York’s twenty-four colleges. Office of Computing and Information Services supports enterprise applications, develops new technology to advance the university’s mission, builds and upgrades, maintains the university network, operates the university datacenter, helpdesk, develops disaster recovery and business continuity plans, and leads the City University of New York First Enterprise Resource Planning project (Enterprise Resource Planning).  

Within the System Storage Virtualization Unit, maintains and develops service platforms and applications shared across the university, reporting Windows and Linux systems. Manager and Linux System Administrator perform moderately complex system administration tasks, serve as technical resources for the Windows and Linux team within the System Storage Virtualization Unit.  

Key responsibilities include:  
- Limited administration of physical and virtual Red Hat Linux servers including server deployment, operating system patching, component installation, configuration, and updating packages.  
- Manages server development, testing, and production environments for web application and database tiers adhering to proper change management and security procedures.  
- Manages provisioning and deactivation of user accounts and authorizations.  
- Performs regular audits of system and application security, implements corrective actions as required, identifies and remedies inefficiencies in system procedures.  
- Develops and maintains system documentation and run books consistent with industry best practices in system administration.  
- Collaborates with members of divisions within the Office of Computing and Information Services to facilitate processes, projects, installation, and formulation of operating policies and procedures for enterprise applications and central office Local Area Network services.  
- Performs related duties as assigned.  

Job duties require schedule flexibility and willingness to work evenings and weekends as required for system-related tasks.  

Minimum qualifications:  
- High school diploma or General Educational Development equivalent and seven years of experience post high school in one of the following: seven years full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position; Associate degree plus five years full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position; Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution plus three years full-time work experience in a computer technology-related position.  
- Demonstrated English language proficiency.  
- Motor vehicle driver’s license valid in New York State may be required for the position.  

Job has three levels. To qualify for Level Two or Level Three, additional qualifications in education, experience, or certification in relevant areas of specialization are required.  

Ideal candidate possesses the following knowledge, skills, and abilities:  
- Linux Red Hat-related technology certification.  
- Experience working in Linux or Unix environments including administration, maintenance, and running Linux servers.  
- Experience with scripting languages such as Bash and Python to develop automation scripts.  
- Strong working knowledge of the Linux command line.  
- Basic knowledge of virtualization, storage, and networking.  
- Ability to communicate effectively in group discussions and in writing.  
- Exceptionally well organized, able to effectively analyze and resolve complex problems, render sound resolutions, articulate goals, and manage multiple resources and priorities.  
- Ability to work productively as an individual contributor or collaboratively as a team member in a fast-paced, time-sensitive, customer-responsive, team-oriented environment.  

Compensation:  
- Level One: $66,710  
- Level Two: $73,609  
- Level Three: $82,813  

Benefits:  
City University of New York offers a comprehensive benefits package to employees and eligible dependents based on job title and classification. Employees are also offered pension and tax-deferred savings plans. Part-time employees must meet weekly or semester work hour criteria to be eligible for health benefits. Health benefits are also extended to retirees who meet eligibility criteria.  

Application:  
For full consideration, submit a cover letter and résumé online via the City University of New York web-based job system addressing experience and credentials that fulfill the responsibilities and qualifications outlined.  

Direct link to job opening:  
External source: Human Resources Shared Services Global Page Human Resources Shared Services Job Detail Action Job Opening ID 18901 Site ID 1 Posting Sequence 1  

Closing date: Open until filled. Review of applications begins June 15, 2018.  

Job search category: City University of New York job posting in Information Technology Technical.  

Equal Employment Opportunity:  
City University of New York encourages people with disabilities, minorities, veterans, and women to apply. City University of New York Italian Americans are also included among protected groups. Applicants and employees are not to be discriminated against on the basis of any legally protected category including sexual orientation and gender identity.

normalized_jd:
Data Center seeking Security Microsoft Server Administrator to configure and administer Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management Three Hundred Sixty-Five application. Microsoft Windows Server Administrator also responsible for creating and maintaining integration between Microsoft products and third-party tools. Role Administrator collaborates with the technical team to provide expert technical support, strategic planning, design, development, implementation, and ongoing administration and application support. Data Center as enterprise application key responsibility supports cybersecurity efforts, maintains cybersecurity for Windows systems and related hardware, supports tools such as corporate antivirus, antispam, security, and backup solutions. Provides technical expertise in Windows system administration, provides infrastructure solutions to support business initiatives, installs, configures, and administers multiple Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management Three Hundred Sixty-Five environments, deploys customizations, migrates Dynamics Customer Relationship Management Three Hundred Sixty-Five applications, drives application upgrades, installs backups, migrates Customer Relationship Management organizations, leads change management requests, creates new cloned environments, administers Customer Relationship Management security, manages user roles across the organization, coordinates various operational activities, supports Customer Relationship Management data management, data archival, and disaster recovery.  

Taking and passing Civil Service Examination is necessary to maintain employment with the City of New York. Please check the Department of Citywide Administrative Services website for important examination filing information. Please ensure you are either a permanent employee in a Civil Service title listed in the posting or file for the examination during the open filing period. For information regarding the Civil Service process, please visit the Department of Citywide Administrative Services website.  

Minimum qualification requirement:  
1. Master’s degree in Computer Science from an accredited college and three years of progressively responsible full-time satisfactory experience using Information Technology in computer application programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning, data and information processing, user services, or area networking, with at least eighteen months of experience in an administrative, managerial, or executive capacity in the areas of computer application programming, systems programming, computer systems development, data telecommunications, database administration, planning, data processing, or supervision of staff performing these duties.  
2. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college and four years of experience as described in item one.  
3. Four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a State Department of Education or recognized accrediting organization and six years of experience as described in item one.  
4. Satisfactory combination of education and experience equivalent to items one, two, or three. However, candidates must possess at least a four-year high school diploma or educational equivalent approved by a State Department of Education or recognized accrediting organization and must possess at least three years of experience as described in item one, including eighteen months of administrative, managerial, executive, or supervisory experience as described in item one.  

Qualification requirement continued: Note the following types of experience are not acceptable: superficial use of preprogrammed software without complex programming, design, implementation, or management of product use; word processing packages; use of handheld calculators; primarily entering or updating data; system operation of data processing hardware consoles.  

Preferred skills: Four years administering Microsoft Windows Server Two Thousand Twelve or higher, two years of experience administering Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management Three Hundred Sixty-Five, Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant field, Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate, Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert Microsoft certifications preferred, excellent communication skills.  

To apply, please go to the current New York City employee portal and search Job ID Three Hundred Fifty-Four Thousand Thirty-Five. Phone calls, faxes, or personal inquiries are not permitted. Note: Candidates under consideration will be contacted. Residency requirement: New York City residency required for the position.

normalized_jd:
Dual headquartered in New York and London, Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary, and research dedicated to providing value beyond ratings with independent, prospective credit opinions. Fitch Ratings offers a global perspective shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. Additional context, perspective, and insight provide help for investors to make important credit judgments with confidence. Fitch Solutions delivers credit market data, analytical tools, and risk services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, Fitch Solutions distributes ratings, research, and financial data from Fitch Ratings via a variety of flexible platforms. Innovation and experience are behind every solution. Fitch Solutions helps financial professionals meet diverse and evolving needs in today’s global market. Fitch Ratings, Fitch Solutions, along with Fitch Learning and BMI Research, are part of Fitch Group, a global leader in financial information services operating in thirty countries. Fitch Group is majority owned by Hearst. Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers complying with laws governing employment in jurisdictions of operation, providing equal opportunity to applicants and employees. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or status protected under applicable law.  

Department Overview: Fitch Ratings is seeking an Intermediate System Administrator to join the Infrastructure Operations team within Fitch’s Site Infrastructure Group. The Infrastructure Operations Group is responsible for the day-to-day operations of computer, storage, and networking infrastructure, including server patching, monitoring, backup and recovery, and configuration management database (CMDB).  

Job Description: The Intermediate System Administrator is involved in evaluating, executing, and scheduling system patches, upgrades, and changes. The Intermediate System Administrator determines the root cause of complex network and system problems. Responsibilities include resolving escalated trouble tickets, performing server maintenance updates, replacing hardware as needed, updating operating systems, performing PC imaging as required, assisting with maintenance calls relating to workstation software, server troubleshooting, resolving server event log communication system issues, participating in the implementation phase of projects, documenting and tracking model and serial number inventory, tracking, developing, and maintaining preventative maintenance checklists. The individual is also responsible for managing the Citrix Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) environment.  

Position Requirements:  
- Working knowledge of Windows operating systems  
- Working knowledge of Linux operating systems  
- Working knowledge of Citrix  
- Effective problem-solving skills  
- Experience with VMware ESX  
- Five years of experience with Amazon Workspaces  
- Basic scripting and coding skills  

The candidate must possess the following skills and experience:  
- Minimum four years of Microsoft technology experience  
- Experience with Microsoft Windows Server  
- Experience with enterprise backup and recovery procedures  
- Experience with system performance monitoring tools  
- Minimum three years of Citrix experience  
- Experience with monitoring tools such as SolarWinds  
- Solid background in network storage and Domain Name System (DNS) services  
- Strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills  
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills  
- Demonstrated ability to work well in collaborative, cross-functional teams  
- Solid interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with people at all levels of information technology expertise and a wide range of constituencies  
- Organizational relationship understanding  
- Project management tools, techniques, and methodologies including Agile  
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience preferred  

Fitch is committed to providing the global securities markets with objective, timely, independent, and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interest or the appearance of conflicts of interest. As part of the successful recruitment process, Fitch Ratings will ask candidates to declare securities holdings that may present potential conflicts, including those of family members, prior to commencing employment. Family member holdings that may conflict with work responsibilities must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and family members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds.

normalized_jd: System Administrator provides administrative technical support for Arc Onondaga agency system infrastructure applications and system client end users. Primary duties include deploying and supporting strategic initiatives. The individual must be capable of working hands-on to support complex environments. Arc Onondaga site environments support agency multifunctional programs for individuals with developmental disabilities, resulting in evolved capabilities to meet associated business challenges, providing health services across various agency programs. The candidate for the position needs to be able to contribute and learn many different disciplines: end user computing, personal computer Windows administration, email administration, domain administration, security administration, network management, server management, mobile device applications, voice and data including collaboration. The successful candidate will bring two to four years of experience in a similar technical role. Initial primary focus areas are system administration and end user deployment support skills. Support role required. Consideration for the position requires a minimum two-year degree in a discipline. Benefits: Arc Onondaga provides a generous benefits package including competitive salary, health benefits including medical, dental, vision, paid time off for vacation, sick, personal, and holiday, 401(k) employer contribution, Health Savings Account employer contribution, life insurance, and tuition reimbursement.

normalized_jd:
Primary responsibility of the position is to provide Level Three support within a private school in Manhattan. Qualifications include years of experience, certifications plus recognized intelligence, ability, and potential. Far more important is being proficient in designing, building, migrating, and maintaining business network systems including hardware, Windows Server, Active Directory, Domain Name System, secure redundant infrastructure, Security Information and Event Management, antivirus, firewall, Group Policy Object, high availability solutions, Microsoft Exchange email security filtering solutions, Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity infrastructure, Network File System, Server Message Block, File Transfer Protocol, Secure Shell, Internet Information Services configuration.  

Technical facets and detailed requirements of the position may include but are not limited to: managing and executing projects to meet deadlines and client expectations, guiding Level One and Level Two System Engineers, remote and field engineering teams, configuring and managing Microsoft Server Exchange 2003, 2008 R2, 2012 R2, PowerShell expertise, administering, configuring, maintaining, and upgrading various VMware technology including but not limited to vCenter Server, vCenter Converter, vSphere, vMotion, Virtual SAN within 4.0, 5.5 environments, administering, configuring, maintaining, and upgrading Citrix XenApp, XenDesktop environments, administering and configuring Network Attached Storage and Storage Area Network technology from various vendors including Aberdeen, Buffalo, EMC, Hewlett-Packard, EqualLogic, implementation, troubleshooting, training, Mimecast, various anti-spam technology, installing, configuring, and troubleshooting network equipment including routers, firewalls, switches, wireless access points, Secure Sockets Layer Virtual Private Network setup from various vendors including Cisco, Extreme Networks, Hewlett-Packard, Meraki, Netgear, SonicWall, UniFi, providing disaster recovery and backup solution support using EVault, Zerto, Veeam, ShadowProtect, and others.  

Main duties include diagnosing and resolving unique nonrecurring problems associated with application software and operating systems, determining the source of problems, classifying level, priority, and nature, maintaining first-class level customer service ensuring customers are treated efficiently and appropriately, maintaining inventory of installed software, managing software licensing, creating policies and procedures, upgrading work hardware and software, vendor verification, ensuring timely product delivery, ensuring new equipment is installed and ready to operate on schedule, documenting procedures, standards, best practices, configuration settings, installation sequences, backup instructions.  

Attributes include being a critical thinker, exhibiting good judgment, strong problem-solving skills, articulate, excellent verbal communication skills, ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues at all levels of the organization, enthusiastic, highly motivated, diligent team player, flexible, ability to manage changing priorities, thoughtful, ethical, respectful, and fair. Looking for a place that is comfortable, challenging, and fun.

We are looking for a skilled, driven System Administrator to work in the El Segundo office to assist with end-user support and build infrastructure. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a high-growth, fast-paced technology startup as a key contributor, wearing multiple hats, with excellent communication skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment and be flexible to jump into various projects as essential. The environment consists of approximately one hundred twenty-five users and is growing, located in the El Segundo office with a handful of remote-based employees, predominantly Mac users, Google Workspace, Jira, Confluence, Amazon Web Services infrastructure, Meraki firewall support, and day-to-day operational needs. The company requires creating and maintaining documentation and working on various security system initiatives. Onboarding users, mobile device management, you will bring experience in Google Workspace management, Meraki firewall access point management, Mobile Device Management, Jamf or similar, Single Sign-On, OneLogin or similar, Virtual Private Network management, ticketing system management, Jira, Confluence. Bonus with experience working in a Software as a Service environment and being passionate about education technology.

normalized_jd:
Job overview: Ability to complete complex problems under pressure with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail, strong problem-solving skills, Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act compliance, Office 365. Looking to fill a regular full-time System Administrator position in Los Angeles, California.  

The System Administrator is responsible for provisioning, installation, configuration, operation, and maintenance of servers, networking devices, backup and disaster recovery solutions, and computer assets. Assists in managing the agency network in collaboration with members of the Network Operations team, providing high-quality customer service. The position ensures system and equipment issues are resolved in a timely manner. The position may require the selected candidate to occasionally work outside normal business hours.  

Key responsibilities:  
**Network responsibilities** – Manages administration, support, and maintenance of Microsoft Windows Server infrastructure, including cloud-based solutions, Office 365, and Azure configuration. Maintains backup and disaster recovery solutions. Responsible for maintaining close to 100% uptime of network resources where possible. Diagnoses and repairs network hardware and software problems for the department. Develops and implements policies, procedures, and protocols for network and computer maintenance, operation, and purchase/use. Performs special projects as assigned by the supervisor.  

**Support responsibilities** – Along with members of the Network Division, provides desktop support to staff, servicing, repairing, and upgrading agency network computers. Analyzes and evaluates current and future computer network data needs of the agency. Recommends, designs, and implements network projects. Creates, organizes, and communicates lessons learned and best practice documentation.  

**Administrative responsibilities** – Recommends and assists in purchasing computer and networking hardware and software. Oversees planning, organizing, and coordination of computer network-related training. Develops relationships with vendors, keeping current with developments in hardware, software, and training. Develops and maintains an accurate equipment tracking system.  

**Duties as assigned**  

**Education, knowledge, skills, and abilities required** – Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science in a technical field. Three to five years of experience or six to eight years of work experience in technical desktop and network support positions. Working experience administering Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016; Microsoft Exchange 2010, 2013, 2016; Office 365; SharePoint. Working experience creating and managing virtual servers using Microsoft Hyper-V. Working experience with Active Directory, including creating Group Policy. Valid California driver’s license and vehicle for frequent visits to facilities in the Los Angeles area, occasional travel to San Diego, San Francisco, Ventura, and Orange County sites.  

Proven project management and requirements gathering experience. Working experience managing backup and disaster recovery solutions. Working experience troubleshooting and repairing network and computer hardware and software-related technical issues. Working experience configuring and installing network operating systems. Good interpersonal skills, ability to work as a team player, ability to work cooperatively and effectively as part of an interdisciplinary team, and independently assume responsibility. Ability to logically break down complex problems, identify root causes, and create sequential actionable resolution tasks. Ability to thoroughly document lessons learned, trouble ticket resolutions, and technical training material. Excellent organizational skills, ability to multitask and juggle multiple priorities, strong problem-solving skills, ability to communicate highly technical information in a clear and concise manner to nontechnical users. High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to communicate effectively by telephone. Ability to complete complex technical tasks under pressure. Ability to recognize and resolve data entry problems as they occur. Professionalism, punctuality, flexibility, and reliability are imperative. Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills. Integrity to handle sensitive information in a confidential manner. Action-oriented, outstanding ability to follow tasks, strong initiative, enthusiasm, and willingness to assist whenever needed. Able to communicate well at all levels of the organization, including working with organizational leadership, high-level representatives, and partner organizations. Able to work within frequently changing project scopes while maintaining overall direction and structured priorities.  

**Desired** – Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar. Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert, Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate, progress towards alternative certification. PowerShell knowledge. Advanced networking knowledge including switching, Virtual Local Area Networks, routing, network monitoring, command-line configuration. Structured Query Language experience.

normalized_jd:
Job summary: Position responsible for maintaining a broad range of enterprise-level server, storage, security, networking, and personal computer equipment. Ideal candidate will have expertise in all aspects of Windows system administration, a strong grasp of networking fundamentals, and previous experience supporting medium to large data centers. An aggressive and detailed approach to problem-solving is required. Candidate must also demonstrate a strong appreciation and knowledge of best practices for maintaining a highly secure environment. A strong background in customer service is required.  

Education, experience, and training:  
1. High school diploma required.  
2. Bachelor’s degree preferred.  
3. Advanced knowledge of Windows Server and desktop operating systems.  
4. Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate certification and Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert certification preferred.  
5. Two to two years of applicable work experience.  
6. Knowledge of server configuration and hardware installation.  
7. VMware ESX, backup technology, and disaster recovery.  
8. Must be able to manage multiple projects.  
9. Must be able to work independently and proactively.  
10. Knowledge of Active Directory, Local Area Network, and Wide Area Network.

normalized_jd:
Job description: Actively looking for a System Administrator to support the Film Department. The role offers potential to advance technical skills and experience using state-of-the-art technology, with the opportunity to learn from highly experienced colleagues. If you have a sharp technical mind, enjoy computing, and want to be part of a high-profile production, this is the place. Primary responsibilities include attention to detail, the ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing, the ability to work in a team environment, and the ability to work with staff face-to-face, via phone, ticket, and chat. Provide desktop support to artists and production staff using Windows, macOS, and Linux. Set up and install workstations, diagnose and troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues, calibrate artist monitors, and perform ad hoc project work. Ability to prioritize workload and respond quickly to critical issues.  

Qualifications, knowledge, skills, and experience required: Keen interest in computer hardware and system technology, excellent people skills, desire to be part of a team, self-motivated, proactive, able to work under pressure, basic knowledge of server networking, storage, and render system troubleshooting, purpose and ambition to improve skillset and knowledge base, enthusiastic commitment to learn.  

Additional information: Exciting opportunity to work in the dynamic world of film and visual effects. If interested, please apply online. Information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunity guidelines.

normalized_jd:
Overview  
Network System Administrator  
Organization: Camino Nuevo Charter Academy, California  
Network Charter School serving students across the Pre-Kindergarten to Postsecondary continuum in the greater MacArthur Park neighborhood of Los Angeles.  

Pueblo Nuevo Education Development Group (PN EDG) is the resource development and capacity building arm. PN EDG invests in young people to foster personal transformation and generational social change. PN EDG staff support and build the capacity of Camino Nuevo Charter Academy (CNCA) schools in achieving the vision of the organization, grounded in the belief that public education is a civil right and that students deserve an excellent education to prepare them for success in life.  

CNCA and PN EDG recognize that lower-income immigrant communities often face institutional and cultural barriers that create impediments to student success. Excellent education must eliminate these barriers and integrate a strong focus on progressive, research-based academic and holistic, place-based approaches.  

Serving students since opening its doors in 2001, CNCA has grown to eight schools and nearly 3,500 students. The goal for 2022 is for CNCA graduates to be equipped with the skills, knowledge, and worldview necessary to be literate, critical thinkers, and independent problem solvers. As a result of this success, 90% are accepted, 80% attend, and 60% graduate from a four-year college within six years.  

Organizational Leadership Capacity  
We believe every individual working at Camino Nuevo Charter Academy Home Support Office must embody key mindsets and possess foundational skills that contribute to organizational leadership.  

Organization Mindset:  
- Commitment to and belief in CNCA’s mission and vision.  
- Belief in and embodiment of CNCA’s anchor aspects of work.  
- Commitment to the vision of progressive, socially conscious education and the ability to inspire others towards that vision.  
- Solution orientation and belief in supporting others.  
- Commitment to an asset-based capacity building approach.  
- Commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion.  

Skills:  
- Ability to support an inclusive, positive, high-performing culture.  
- Ability to take ownership of day-to-day and overall success of the organization.  
- Ability to think critically, use sound judgment, and problem solve.  
- Ability to work independently and proactively seek support and guidance when appropriate.  
- Strong organizational and time management skills.  
- Ability to prioritize competing projects in a fast-paced, fluid environment.  
- Effective collaboration at the individual and organizational level.  
- Respect, humility, and discretion to work effectively with stakeholders including colleagues, family members, and the community.  
- Strong self-awareness and ability to reflect on responsibilities and opportunities.  

General Supervision: Director of Technology  

Network System Administrator Responsibilities:  
- Design and maintain network systems to ensure technology standards and industry best practices are in place for operational excellence.  

Essential Functions:  

**Strategy and Vision Setting Responsibility**  
- Contribute to the development and implementation of the strategic plan for the ongoing success of the Information Technology team.  
- Contribute to research and development of a cohesive plan for deployment and maintenance of CNCA network components internally and externally.  
- Collaborate in the development of structures and processes to increase excellence across the use of network resources available to CNCA.  
- Monitor the effectiveness of network and server services using key metrics.  
- Develop communication and escalation plans to distribute key metrics and elevate challenges that arise within the network, including associated wireless, internal and external server, and software client-based issues.  
- Work with the Director of Technology to inform and improve work.  
- Understand and navigate the political, social, economic, legal, and cultural contexts facing urban charter school students served.  

**Team Leadership and Performance Management**  
- Collaborate to develop and facilitate long-term, substantive, and coherent professional development plans for position, school leaders, and Home Support Office leaders.  
- Use data-driven decision making.  
- Set ambitious personal and professional goals and model relentless effort toward goals.  
- Effectively manage networking processes for excellence and knowledge transfer to team members.  

**System Support, Administrative Management, and Compliance Responsibility**  
- Ensure network and server school systems function effectively and are used to meet high expectations.  
- Maintain Cisco, Aruba, and Windows network environments.  
- Ensure systems used by CNCA schools function with minimal downtime.  
- Ensure compliance related to employee and student data backup, retention, and internet safety.  
- Contribute to the creation, preparation, and presentation of regular status reports related to the current network environment, end-of-life network and server equipment, and future needs that may have budgetary impact.  
- Establish relationships with outside agencies related to support, maintenance, and repair of network systems.  
- Create, maintain, and modify software scripts and network policies used by CNCA.  
- Ensure network systems function and projects are effectively carried out to meet high expectations.  
- Perform regular security monitoring to identify possible intrusions or abuse.  
- Configure and maintain new services as needed.  
- Assist in handling helpdesk tickets to ensure timely resolution.  
- Communicate effectively orally and in writing.  
- Perform other duties as assigned.  

**Qualifications and Experience**  
- Bachelor’s degree required.  
- At least three to five years of experience in the area of responsibility.  
- Experience and commitment to working in a team as well as across teams.

normalized_jd:
System Administrator System Administrator assist System Architect maintaining availability Living Space enterprise business system. Ideal candidate will have experience in mid to large size enterprise infrastructure including virtualization, compute, storage, application, database, and network technology. Position based at corporate campus in La Mirada, California. 

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent experience in enterprise computing. Microsoft Certification Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer or equivalent certification relevant to systems preferred. Advanced knowledge of Windows Server 2012 or newer, Windows clustering, Active Directory user and group administration, Group Policy design and configuration, Microsoft Internet Information Services administration and configuration, site deployment and replication, Microsoft Exchange 2010 or newer, Cisco Unified Computing System E-Class compute platform, enterprise storage 3PAR, Nimble, VMware ESXi 6.5 or newer, Microsoft Hyper-V, Terminal Server installation (non-Citrix) with user profile disk, Linux-based virtual appliances, database advanced knowledge of SQL Server 2012 or newer, advanced Always On implementation, data refreshes, data replication, performance tuning, capacity planning, SQL query optimization, tool monitoring vCenter 6.5 or newer, vRealize Operations Manager, Veritas Backup Exec 2014 or newer, ePolicy Orchestrator 5.1 or newer, Windows Server Update Services 2012, SolarWinds Server and Application Monitor, SolarWinds Database Performance Analyzer, Redgate Dynamic Performance, Veeam Zero.

Responsibilities: Monitoring and reviewing system performance and availability, capacity planning, monitoring management, replication, disaster recovery, continuous data protection environment, patch security, system and database troubleshooting, compute, database, storage associated systems. Assist department with problem root cause analysis, backup and recovery of systems and databases. In addition to disaster recovery and continuous data protection, system installation, configuration, deployment including cluster, database installation, configuration, deployment including cluster. Managing and supporting multitiered environments (development, test, staging), code and data promotion to production environment, data refreshes from production to lower level environments. Assist architect with various projects, provide input on technology implementation, documentation of system, database, and network implementation.

Living Space offers competitive compensation, an open casual team-oriented workplace, and the opportunity to work with terrific people and superior technology. Full-time position offers the following benefits: medical, dental, vision, 401(k), annual paid vacation, holiday, annual employee picnic, holiday party. Living Space is an E-Verify employer and an Equal Opportunity Employer.

normalized_jd:
Job summary: System Administrator responsible for administering, optimizing, and supporting company-wide systems in a multi-site manufacturing organization. A certain degree of creativity and latitude is required. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and projects. In addition, the position is also responsible for administration and management of company server-related infrastructure, Active Directory, Domain Name System, Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Exchange environment, VMware, NetApp, backup, and disaster recovery. Stays current with technological developments and recommends ways to take advantage of new technology. Must be familiar with Information Technology Infrastructure Library change and problem management processes, project management, and work well within a collaborative environment.  

Job responsibilities: Administers Windows Server locations including Active Directory in a large environment, Domain Name System, file and print servers, storage, domain controllers, production applications, Microsoft Office 365 email environment. Builds high availability disaster recovery, batch scheduling, security administration, patch management, alert notification, user administration, operational support, backup and recovery. Installs new or rebuilds existing servers, configures hardware, peripheral services, settings, directories, and storage in accordance with standard project and operational requirements. Performs daily system monitoring, verifying integrity and availability of hardware, server resources, systems, and key processes, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs and backups. Provides Tier III and Tier IV support per request from various constituencies. Investigates, troubleshoots issues, repairs, and recovers from hardware or software failures. Coordinates and communicates with impacted constituencies. Coordinates, collaborates, and communicates with Information Technology third-party service providers. Performs ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Configures central processing unit, memory, and disk partitions as required. Plans and undertakes regular maintenance work across systems. Participates in evaluation and recommendation of new technology. Must be on-call and available 24x7. Provides Tier II, Tier III, and Tier IV support as duties are assigned.  

Skills and work experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent education, certification, and work experience. Requires a minimum of four years’ experience in a system administration role. Experience in administration and technical support of local area networks, replication software, virtualization software, VMware, Citrix. Experience in SAP administration and security. Experienced in Windows operating system administration, Domain Name System, Windows file access methods, system utilities, Active Directory in a large environment including backup and recovery utilities. Thorough hands-on understanding of Storage Area Network and Network Attached Storage management and configuration; NetApp preferred. Thorough understanding of Microsoft Office products. Comprehensive knowledge supporting Structured Query Language platforms including ability to write simple queries, understanding joins and subqueries, and ability to diagnose Structured Query Language Server issues from an operational standpoint. Understanding of log shipping, replication, and database backup strategies and concepts. Comprehensive knowledge of technical system procurement and implementation life cycle. Comprehensive knowledge of hardware, telecommunications, networks, and personal computer analysis. Requires multitasking, organizational skills, and stress management skills. Project management skills are a plus. Good knowledge of governance processes supporting problem management and change management is a plus. Excellent written and oral communication skills to effectively interact at all levels of the organization, including professional staff.

normalized_jd:
Position responsible for maintaining a broad range of enterprise level server, storage, security, networking, and personal computer equipment. Ideal candidate will have expertise in all aspects of Windows system administration, a strong grasp of networking fundamentals, and previous experience supporting medium to large data centers. An aggressive, detailed approach to problem solving is required. Candidate must also demonstrate a strong appreciation and knowledge of best practices for maintaining a highly secure environment. A strong background in customer service is required.  

Education, experience, and training:  
1. High school diploma required for new hire starting April 1, 2014.  
2. Bachelor’s degree preferred.  
3. Advanced knowledge of Windows Server and desktop operating systems.  
4. Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate certification and Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer Microsoft certification preferred.  
5. Two years of applicable work experience.  
6. Knowledge of server configuration and hardware installation.  
7. VMware ESX, backup technology, and disaster recovery.  
8. Must be able to manage multiple projects.  
9. Must be able to work independently and proactively.  
10. Knowledge of Active Directory, Local Area Network, and Wide Area Network.  

Work type: Full-time employee.  
Shift:  
1. Day  
2. Evening  
3. Night  
4. Varied  

Equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Does not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. If you need special accommodation in the application process, please contact the Human Resources department. Equal Employment Opportunity law poster.

normalized_jd:
System Administrator Level One position monitor performs basic system administration tasks in a production server environment. Position also provides first level support to end users, handling service requests via remote access, phone, and email. Required to remediate issues with network, desktop, and server problems. Candidate must have the ability to analyze existing systems and make proactive recommendations for improvement. Maintaining accurate documentation of system, application, and networking configuration is essential.  

Qualifications: One to two years of recent computer, server, and network troubleshooting experience. Must be resourceful, able to take initiative in a dynamic environment, and have the ability to effectively and efficiently troubleshoot technical problems. Advanced knowledge of current Microsoft desktop, intermediate to advanced knowledge of Windows Server operating systems, basic knowledge of Office 365 administration, advanced knowledge of computer server hardware, and familiarity with basic network troubleshooting. Professional customer service skills, strong written and oral communication skills, and the ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced environment supporting a broad range of customer types. Bachelor of Computer Science or related field.  

Responsibilities: Monitor production systems, run preassigned tasks based on schedule, react to customer requests, check status, diagnose server issues, make basic configuration changes as needed, participate in helpdesk call queue, provide first level support, provide resolution for escalated service tickets, work with clients to evaluate and solve technical problems, evaluate existing systems and user needs, analyze, design, recommend, and implement system changes, configure and support internal and external networks, troubleshoot network performance, recommend upgrades, patches, new applications, and equipment, and maintain logs of completed work using an incident tracking application.

normalized_jd:
Junior System Administrator tasked with maintaining the flow of day-to-day operations within the office. Ideal candidate would be a former Apple Genius with at least two years of experience in a 1998 Apple Shop. Candidate must have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment, be highly organized, and have the ability to focus and prioritize responsibilities. Perform help desk tasks, assist employees with related issues, create new and remove user accounts, perform maintenance, provision and prepare new employee equipment, learn internal daily systems, and look after system support in the Technology Manager’s absence.  

The following skills are required: setup, installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of client Macintosh hardware; knowledge of Adobe software such as Photoshop; design knowledge not required; ability to troubleshoot application issues; familiarity with business technology peripherals such as copiers, printers, scanners, projectors, and phones; fundamental understanding of TCP/IP networking, DNS, DHCP, subnets, and IP addressing; understanding of network hardware components such as routers, switches, and wireless access points; familiarity with email servers including IMAP, SMTP, ActiveSync, and Exchange. Extra points for Apple certification, which is highly preferred. Required Windows and Apple server experience is a huge plus.  

Compensation: full-time on-site salaried position with solid potential for career growth in a stable company. Contract position initially, turning into employee status with full benefits provided, including excellent 401(k) benefits with full matching, medical, dental, and vision benefits. Casual work environment.

normalized_jd:
Since one thousand eight hundred ninety-seven, Herman Ostrow School of Dentistry has shaped talented students into outstanding dentists and dental hygienists through challenging clinical education and expert faculty members, providing future oral health professionals with the skills needed in order to become the best.  

Herman Ostrow School of Dentistry is looking for a talented System Administrator to join the Information Technology team. The selected individual must have a strong customer service presence and past experience in customer service. The ideal candidate may have experience with Citrix and VMware.  

Preferred educational background includes a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Intelligence, Market Intelligence, or Competitive Intelligence. Please note: not able to support work visa for this position.  

**Job Accountability**  
Work under direct supervision to customize and maintain multi-platform system configurations ensuring efficiency and security. Assist in troubleshooting problems reported by users. Use automated network monitoring systems. Provide assistance related to installation, replacement, and upgrade of server operating systems as appropriate. Assist in the design, programming, and installation of tools to help manage system application environments.  

**Preferred Qualifications**  
- **Preferred Education:** Bachelor’s degree  
- **Preferred Experience:** Two years  
- **Preferred Field of Expertise:** Previous system programming and technical support experience  
- **Preferred Skills:**  
  - Administrative: Communicate with others, gather information, gather data, prioritize different projects, research information, understand and apply policy and procedure  
  - Skills: Analysis, assessment, evaluation, conceptualization, design, consulting  
  - Knowledge: Applicable law, policy, principles of organization, problem identification and resolution  
  - Skilled in: Enterprise information architecture, groupware applications, incident and problem management, large-scale storage administration, network communication technology, network design, connectivity, capacity, configuration, network security, access management, testing network systems, data backup and storage recovery, operating systems, personal communication devices, server applications, hardware troubleshooting  
  - Skilled in use of machines and equipment: Computer networks (department, school, university), computer peripheral equipment, fax machines, personal computers, personal mobile communication devices, photocopiers  

**Minimum Education:** Bachelor’s degree (combined experience and education may substitute for minimum education)  
**Minimum Experience:** One year  
**Minimum Field of Expertise:** Entry-level understanding and experience in system administration, backup, operating systems, programming languages, and associated hardware platforms
